ARO:3002219.definition: IMP-28 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
ARO:3002219.label: IMP-28

ARO:3002218.definition: IMP-27 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of IMP beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002218.label: IMP-27

ARO:3000769.definition: PatA-PatB is an efflux protein complex that is associated with fluoroquinolone resistance in Streptococcus pneumoniae. Experiments indicate that PatA and PatB form a heterodimeric transporter.
ARO:3000769.label: PatA-PatB

ARO:3000768.definition: AbeS in an efflux pump of the SMR family of transporters found in Acinetobacter baumannii.
ARO:3000768.label: abeS

ARO:3002215.definition: IMP-24 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002215.label: IMP-24

ARO:3002214.definition: IMP-23 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of IMP beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002214.label: IMP-23

ARO:3002217.definition: IMP-26 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002217.label: IMP-26

ARO:3002216.definition: IMP-25 is a beta-lactamase found in Serratia marcescens
ARO:3002216.label: IMP-25

ARO:3002211.definition: IMP-20 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas and Acinetobacter spp.
ARO:3002211.label: IMP-20

ARO:3000762.definition: Pefloxacin is structurally and functionally similar to norfloxacin. It is poorly active against mycobacteria, while anaerobes are resistant.
ARO:3000762.label: pefloxacin

ARO:3000761.definition: Mecillinam is a broad-spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic that was semi-synthetically derived to have a different drug centre, being a 6-alpha-amidinopenicillanate instead of a 6-alpha-acylaminopenicillanate. Contrasting most beta-lactam drugs, mecillinam is most active against Gram-negative bacteria. It binds specifically to penicillin binding protein 2 (PBP2).
ARO:3000761.label: mecillinam

ARO:3000760.definition: Cycloserine is an anti-mycobacterial agent, and is active against enterobacteria, streptococci, M. tuberculosis, Staphylococcus aureus, and many Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria. It inhibits cell wall biosynthesis.
ARO:3000760.label: cycloserine

ARO:3000712.definition: Bacterial DNA and RNA synthesis includes many enzymes unique to bacteria that are targeted by antibiotics.
ARO:3000712.label: nucleic acid synthesis machinery targeted by antibiotic

ARO:3004286.definition: Phenotypic variant regulator proteins play a role in controlling the switch between antibiotic-susceptible and antibiotic-resistant forms of bacteria. The characterized member of this family is the PvrR protein in Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which when absent, confers antibiotic resistance.
ARO:3004286.label: phenotypic variant regulator

ARO:3003296.definition: Point mutation of Staphylococcus aureus gyrA resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and gyrA. Thus, conferring resistance.
ARO:3003296.label: Staphylococcus aureus gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3003297.definition: Point mutation of Bartonella bacilliformis gyrA resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and gyrA. Thus, conferring resistance.
ARO:3003297.label: Bartonella bacilliformis gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3003294.definition: Point mutation of Escherichia coli gyrA resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and gyrA. Thus, conferring resistance
ARO:3003294.label: Escherichia coli gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3003295.definition: Point mutation of Mycobacterium tuberculosis gyrA resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and gyrA. Thus, conferring resistance.
ARO:3003295.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3003292.definition: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. GyrA point mutations confer resistance by preventing fluoroquinolone antibiotics from binding the alpha-subunit.
ARO:3003292.label: fluoroquinolone resistant gyrA

ARO:3000480.definition: Expression of parY(R), which encodes an aminocoumarin resistant topoisomerase IV, can confer aminocoumarin resistance.
ARO:3000480.label: aminocoumarin resistant parY

ARO:3003290.definition: Daptomycin resistant RNA polymerases include amino acids substitutions which alter the binding affinity of daptomycin to the protein, resulting in antibiotic resistance.
ARO:3003290.label: daptomycin resistant beta prime subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoC)

ARO:3003291.definition: Point mutations that occurs in Staphylococcus aureus rpoC resulting in resistance to daptomycin
ARO:3003291.label: Staphylococcus aureus rpoC conferring resistance to daptomycin

ARO:3002353.definition: GES-24 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of GES beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002353.label: GES-24

ARO:3003298.definition: Point mutation of Mycobaterium leprae gyrA resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and gyrA. Thus, conferring resistance.
ARO:3003298.label: Mycobaterium leprae gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3002109.definition: CMY-96 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002109.label: CMY-96

ARO:3002108.definition: CMY-95 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002108.label: CMY-95

ARO:3003980.definition: TetA(48) is a Tetracycline efflux pump described in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003980.label: tetA(48)

ARO:3003981.definition: Tetracycline resistant TetB(48) efflux pump found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003981.label: tetB(48)

ARO:3003986.definition: Pleuromutilin (Tiamulin) ABC efflux pump found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to pleuromutilin antibiotics. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003986.label: TaeA

ARO:3003987.definition: Streptogramin A acetyltransferase found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003987.label: VatI

ARO:3003456.definition: Monooxygenase able to convert a wide range of ketones to the corresponding esters or lactones via a Baeyer-Villiger oxidation reaction. It is responsible for the activation of several thiocarbamide-containing pro-drugs into cytotoxic species
ARO:3003456.label: antibiotic resistant ethA

ARO:3003985.definition: Hydrolysis of amido side-chain of asparagine-12 forming hydrogen bond with undecaprenyl pyrophosphate in bacitracin leading to antibiotic inactivation.
ARO:3003985.label: amidohydrolysis of bacitracin undecaprenyl pyrophosphate

ARO:3002101.definition: CMY-88 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002101.label: CMY-88

ARO:3002100.definition: CMY-87 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002100.label: CMY-87

ARO:3002103.definition: CMY-90 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002103.label: CMY-90

ARO:3002102.definition: CMY-89 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002102.label: CMY-89

ARO:3002105.definition: CMY-92 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002105.label: CMY-92

ARO:3002104.definition: CMY-91 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002104.label: CMY-91

ARO:3002107.definition: CMY-94 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002107.label: CMY-94

ARO:3002106.definition: CMY-93 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002106.label: CMY-93

ARO:3003278.definition: Daptomycin binds to the cytoplasmic membrane of Gram-positive. It's lipopeptide tail servers as a ion channel for potassium. This causes a rapid depolarization that result in failures in DNA/RNA/Protein synthesis. Eventually cell death.
ARO:3003278.label: daptomycin sensitive beta-subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoB)

ARO:3003279.definition: the liaFSR system regulates the cell envelope stress response. It is transcriptionally activated by exposure to alkaline shock, detergents, and particularly antibiotics with lipid II inhibition properties.
ARO:3003279.label: antibiotic resistant liaFSR system

ARO:3001968.definition: CTX-M-108 is a beta-lactamase found in Shigella spp.
ARO:3001968.label: CTX-M-108

ARO:3001969.definition: CTX-M-109 is a beta-lactamase found in Shigella spp.
ARO:3001969.label: CTX-M-109

ARO:3002513.definition: LRA-19 is a beta-lactamase isolated from soil samples in Alaska
ARO:3002513.label: LRA-19

ARO:3001962.definition: CTX-M-103 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001962.label: CTX-M-103

ARO:3001963.definition: CTX-M-104 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001963.label: CTX-M-104

ARO:3003272.definition: Cardiolipin synthetase catalyzes the formation of cardiolipin from two phosphatidylglycerol molecules. Cardiolipin is important in membrane translocation and permeabilization. Current known mutations on the enzyme confer resistance to daptomycin.
ARO:3003272.label: daptomycin resistant cls

ARO:3001961.definition: CTX-M-102 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001961.label: CTX-M-102

ARO:3001966.definition: CTX-M-106 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001966.label: CTX-M-106

ARO:3001967.definition: CTX-M-107 is a beta-lactamase found in Shigella spp.
ARO:3001967.label: CTX-M-107

ARO:3003276.definition: RNA polymerase is a multisubunit enzyme that is necessary for transcription. The beta-subunit of RNA polymerase forms the active center of the enzyme and template/transcript binding sites. Mutations in rpoB gene confers antibiotic resistance
ARO:3003276.label: antibiotic resistant rpoB

ARO:3001965.definition: CTX-M-105 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001965.label: CTX-M-105

ARO:3002213.definition: IMP-22 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas spp.
ARO:3002213.label: IMP-22

ARO:3002212.definition: IMP-21 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas and Acinetobacter spp.
ARO:3002212.label: IMP-21

ARO:3004201.definition: BlaB beta-lactamases are class B beta-lactamases that are found in a variety of species and have the ability to hydrolyze penams and carbapenems.
ARO:3004201.label: BlaB beta-lactamase

ARO:3003188.definition: QnrB76 is a fluoroquinolone resistance gene in Lahey's list of qnr genes
ARO:3003188.label: QnrB76

ARO:3003189.definition: QnrB77 is a fluoroquinolone resistance gene in Lahey's list of qnr genes
ARO:3003189.label: QnrB77

ARO:3003182.definition: Beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli clinical isolates in Nepal.
ARO:3003182.label: NDM-13

ARO:3003183.definition: NDM-14 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter lwoffii.
ARO:3003183.label: NDM-14

ARO:1000002.definition: Antibiotic resistance mechanisms evolve naturally via natural selection through random mutation, but it could also be engineered by applying an evolutionary stress on a population.
ARO:1000002.label: mechanism of antibiotic resistance

ARO:1000003.definition: Antibiotics are commonly classified based on their mechanism of action, chemical structure or spectrum of activity.
ARO:1000003.label: antibiotic molecule

ARO:3003186.definition: Present in Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, not yet released
ARO:3003186.label: CARB-23

ARO:3003187.definition: QnrB75 is a fluoroquinolone resistance gene in Lahey's list of qnr genes
ARO:3003187.label: QnrB75

ARO:3003184.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
ARO:3003184.label: PER-8

ARO:3003185.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, not yet released
ARO:3003185.label: GES-25

ARO:3003675.definition: Plazomicin is a neoglycoside, or "next-generation" aminoglycoside, that has been identified as a potentially useful agent to combat drug-resistant bacteria, such as Acinetobacter baumannii and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3003675.label: Plazomicin

ARO:3003676.definition: AAC(6')-Ib' is an aminoglycoside acetyltransferase encoded by plasmids, transposons, integrons in P. aeruginosa and P. fluorescens.
ARO:3003676.label: AAC(6')-Ib'

ARO:3003677.definition: AAC(6')-Iaj is a functional acetyltransferase that modifies the amino groups at the 6' positions of aminoglycosides and contributes to aminoglycoside resistance of P. aeruginosa
ARO:3003677.label: AAC(6')-Iaj

ARO:3003670.definition: PEDO-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Pedobacter roseus exhibiting resistance to carbapenems.
ARO:3003670.label: PEDO-1

ARO:3003678.definition: TriABC-OpmH is a triclosan-specific efflux pump expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. TriABC is the only P. aeruginosa resistance nodulation cell division (RND) pump which contains two membrane fusion proteins, TriA and TriB, and both are required for efflux pump function. TriABC associated with OpmH assemble a functional triclosan efflux pump.
ARO:3003678.label: TriABC-OpmH

ARO:3003679.definition: TriA is a membrane protein that is fused to TriB and both are required for the triclosan efflux pump function of TriABC-OpmH in P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3003679.label: TriA

ARO:3000614.definition: mefE is a proton motive efflux pump in Streptococcus pneumoniae that confers resistance to macrolides. It is found on the same operon as mefA and the ABC-efflux pump mel.
ARO:3000614.label: mefE

ARO:3004422.definition: Less than 5 x 105 cfu/mL for broth dilution and 104 cfu/mL for agar dilution.
ARO:3004422.label: less than standard inoculum

ARO:3004208.definition: DIM type beta-lactamases were first identified from a carbapenem-resistant Pseudomonas stutzeri strain isolated from a Dutch patient. Encoded in mobile elements, these MBLs significantly hydrolyze broad-spectrum cephalosporins and carbapenems.
ARO:3004208.label: DIM beta-lactamase

ARO:3000580.definition: Sao Paulo metallo-beta-lactamase (SPM-1) confers resistance to carbapenem in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3000580.label: SPM beta-lactamase

ARO:3003667.definition: Point mutations in the 16S rRNA of bacteria can confer resistance to peptide antibiotics.
ARO:3003667.label: 16s rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to peptide antibiotics

ARO:3002447.definition: OKP-B-14 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002447.label: OKP-B-14

ARO:3004432.definition: A microbe whose susceptibility to antibiotics is comparable to that of a reference susceptible microbe, meaning that the microbe is sensitive to the particular antibiotic.
ARO:3004432.label: wild-type

ARO:3000507.definition: Proteins which have been experimentally shown to protect RNA-polymerase from rifampin inhibition.
ARO:3000507.label: rifampin-resistant RNA polymerase-binding protein

ARO:3000506.definition: MexR is the repressor of the MexRAB-OprM operon. Mutant forms of mexR result in up-regulation of efflux pump system MexAB-OprM.
ARO:3000506.label: MexR

ARO:3000504.definition: GolS is a regulator activated by the presence of gold, and promotes the expression of the MdsABC efflux pump.
ARO:3000504.label: golS

ARO:3000503.definition: AcrEF-TolC is a tripartite multidrug efflux system similar to AcrAB-TolC and found in Gram-negative bacteria. AcrE is the membrane fusion protein, AcrF is the inner membrane transporter, and TolC is the outer membrane channel protein.
ARO:3000503.label: AcrEF-TolC

ARO:3000502.definition: AcrF is a inner membrane transporter, similar to AcrB.
ARO:3000502.label: AcrF

ARO:3000501.definition: Due to gene duplication, the genomes of Nocardia species include both rifampin-sensitive beta-subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoB) and rifampin-resistant beta-subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoB2) genes, with ~88% similarity between the two gene products. Expression of the rpoB2 variant results in replacement of rifampin sensitivity with rifampin resistance.
ARO:3000501.label: rpoB2

ARO:3000500.definition: The enzyme responsible for converting phosphonoacetaldehyde to (S)-2-/nhydroxypropylphosphonic acid (S-HPP) via an anionic methyl attack, which also reduces the aldehyde to an alcohol.
ARO:3000500.label: phosphonoacetaldehyde methyltransfererase

ARO:3000508.definition: GadX is an AraC-family regulator that promotes mdtEF expression to confer multidrug resistance.
ARO:3000508.label: gadX

ARO:3002418.definition: OKP-A-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002418.label: OKP-A-1

ARO:3004128.definition: Omp1 is an outer membrane porin that confers resistance by absence in S. marcescens.  Knockout, deletion or other inhibition of the omp1 gene confers resistance to certain beta-lactamase antibiotics - including Cefoxitin, Ceftriaxone, Cefotaxime, and Moxalactam - as well as Ciprofloxacin, Tetracycline, and Chloramphenicol, by preventing passage of the antibiotic into the cell.
ARO:3004128.label: Serratia marcescens Omp1

ARO:3003078.definition: liaR is a response regulator found in the liaFSR signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.
ARO:3003078.label: Enterococcus faecium liaR mutant conferring daptomycin resistance

ARO:3003079.definition: liaS is a histidine kinase found in the liaFSR signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.
ARO:3003079.label: Enterococcus faecium liaS mutant conferring daptomycin resistance

ARO:3003076.definition: liaFSR is a two-component signal transduction pathway in B. subtilis that responds to peptide and lipopeptide antibiotics. The liaFSR two-component system consists of a histidine kinase liaS and the response regulator liaR as well as the accessory protein liaF, which acts as a negative regulator of liaRS-dependent signal transduction. Mutations confer resistance to daptomycin.
ARO:3003076.label: daptomycin resistant liaFSR

ARO:3003077.definition: liaF is an accessory protein that acts as a negative regulator of liaRS signal transduction pathway. Mutations confer daptomycin resistance.
ARO:3003077.label: Enterococcus faecalis liaF mutant conferring daptomycin resistance

ARO:3003074.definition: cls or cardiolipin synthetase is an inner membrane protein that is involved in membrane synthesis. Specific mutations in S. aureus can confer resistance to daptomycin.
ARO:3003074.label: Staphylococcus aureus cls conferring resistance to daptomycin

ARO:3003072.definition: Bacillus Cluster A mph are chromosomally-encoded macrolide phosphotransferases that inactivate 14- and 15-membered macrolides such as erythromycin, clarithromycin, azithromycin.
ARO:3003072.label: Bacillus Cluster A intrinsic mph

ARO:3003073.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to lipopeptide antibiotics.
ARO:3003073.label: determinant of resistance to lipopeptide antibiotics

ARO:3003070.definition: vanXD is a vanX variant found in the vanD gene cluster
ARO:3003070.label: vanXD

ARO:3003071.definition: mphE is a macrolide phosphotransferase that phosphorylates macrolides in GTP- dependent manner at 2'-OH hydroxyl of desosamine sugar of macrolides.
ARO:3003071.label: mphE

ARO:3004424.definition: General purpose medium used for culture of nonfastidious microorganisms.
ARO:3004424.label: Mueller-Hinton Broth

ARO:3001317.definition: Pleuromutilin is a natural product antibiotic produced by Clitopilus passeckerianus. Related antibiotics of clinical significance, such as tiamulin and retapamulin, are semi-synthetic derivatives of this compound.
ARO:3001317.label: pleuromutilin

ARO:3004262.definition: Mutations to the liaF accessory protein that confer resistance to daptomycin.
ARO:3004262.label: daptomycin resistant liaF

ARO:3004263.definition: Mutations to the liaR response regulator that confer resistance to daptomycin.
ARO:3004263.label: daptomycin resistant liaR

ARO:3000219.definition: Efflux regulatory proteins with mutations that result in increased expression of efflux proteins.
ARO:3000219.label: mutant efflux regulatory protein conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3000218.definition: Covalent modification of aminoglycoside antibiotic hydroxyl group by ATP-dependent transfer of AMP.
ARO:3000218.label: aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase (ANT)

ARO:3004266.definition: Point mutations in katG confer antibiotic resistance by preventing katG from catalyzing the activation of antibiotics.
ARO:3004266.label: antibiotic resistant katG

ARO:3004267.definition: Point mutations in pncA prevent the enzyme from activating antibiotics, such as pyrazinamide.
ARO:3004267.label: antibiotic resistant pncA

ARO:3004264.definition: Mutations in the liaS histidine kinase that confer daptomycin resistance.
ARO:3004264.label: daptomycin resistant liaS

ARO:3004265.definition: Mutations to demA confer lycosin resistance.
ARO:3004265.label: lysocin resistant menA

ARO:3000213.definition: Peptidoglycan precursors ending in D-Ala-D-Lac or D-Ala-D-Ser instead of D-Ala-D-Ala conferring high level glycopeptide resistance.
ARO:3000213.label: restructuring of bacterial cell wall conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3000212.definition: Point mutations in the DNA may lead to an altered gene product that may result in antibiotic resistance. Examples included modified antibiotic targets with lower binding affinities and the deactivation of repressors that result in increased expression of genes that inactivate or pump out antibiotics.
ARO:3000212.label: mutation conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3000211.definition: Chemical alteration of the ribosome results in modification of an antibiotic's target leading to resistance.
ARO:3000211.label: ribosomal alteration conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3000210.definition: Rifampin resistant RNA polymerases include amino acids substitutions which disrupt the affinity of rifampin for its binding site. These mutations are frequently concentrated in the rif I region of the beta-subunit and most often involve amino acids which make direct interactions with rifampin. However, mutations which also confer resistance can occur outside this region and may involve amino acids which do not directly make contact with rifampin.
ARO:3000210.label: rifamycin-resistant beta-subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoB)

ARO:3000217.definition: blaR1 is a transmembrane spanning and signal transducing protein which in response to interaction with beta-lactam antibiotics results in upregulation of the blaZ/blaR1/blaI operon.
ARO:3000217.label: blaR1

ARO:3000216.definition: Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.
ARO:3000216.label: acrB

ARO:3000215.definition: mecR1 is a transmembrane spanning and signal transducing protein which in response to interaction with beta-lactam antibiotics results in upregulation of the mecA/mecR1/mecI operon.
ARO:3000215.label: mecR1

ARO:3000214.definition: Hygromycin B is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Hygromycin B works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth. Hygromycin B has also been shown to interact with eukaryotic cells.
ARO:3000214.label: hygromycin B

ARO:3003664.definition: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available
ARO:3003664.label: NDM-16

ARO:3002738.definition: QnrB23 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Citrobacter freundii
ARO:3002738.label: QnrB23

ARO:3004426.definition: Medium supplementation with 20–25 mg Ca2+ and 10–12.5 mg Mg2+ per liter, which is representative of the divalent cation concentration in blood. Divalent cation supplemented medium is correct to use for susceptibility testing of tetracyclines, daptomycin for gram-positive bacteria and aminoglycosides for Pseudomonas aeruginosarequires.
ARO:3004426.label: divalent cation supplemented medium

ARO:3000859.definition: RmtA is a 16S rRNA methyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa which methylates G1405 of the 16S rRNA. It confers high level resistance to many aminoglycosides.
ARO:3000859.label: rmtA

ARO:3000176.definition: Dirithromycin is an oxazine derivative of erythromycin, sharing the 14-carbon macrolide ring. The antibiotic binds to the 50S subunit of the ribosome to inhibit bacterial protein synthesis.
ARO:3000176.label: dirithromycin

ARO:3000177.definition: TetJ is a tetracycline efflux protein expressed in Gram-negative bacteria (Escherichia, Morganella, and Proteus).
ARO:3000177.label: tet(J)

ARO:3000174.definition: TetG is a tetracycline efflux protein found in Gram-negative bacteria. It is found in both chromosomal and plasmid DNA, and is linked to floR, sul1, and cmlA9 (florfenicol/chloramphenicol, sulfamethoxazole, and chloramphenicol resistance genes, respectively).
ARO:3000174.label: tet(G)

ARO:3000175.definition: TetH is a tetracycline efflux protein expressed in Gram-negative bacteria (Actinobacillus, Acinetobacter, Gallibacterium, Histophilus, Mannheimia, Moraxella, Pasteurella, and Psychrobacter). Its gene is linked to the resistance genes sul2, and strAB, which confer resistance to sulfamethoxazole and streptomycin, respectively.
ARO:3000175.label: tet(H)

ARO:3000172.definition: A thiol transferase that leads to the resistance of fosfomycin. Contrasting FosA, FosB is dependent on the cofactor Magnesium (II) and uses either bacillithiol or  L-cysteine to open up the epoxide ring of fosfomycin.
ARO:3000172.label: FosB

ARO:3000173.definition: TetE is a tetracycline efflux pump found in many Gram-negative bacteria, especially those in water environments. The gene is found on large plasmids.
ARO:3000173.label: tet(E)

ARO:3000170.definition: Imipenem is a broad-spectrum antibiotic and is usually taken with cilastatin, which prevents hydrolysis of imipenem by renal dehydropeptidase-I. It is resistant to hydrolysis by most other beta-lactamases. Notable exceptions are the KPC beta-lactamases and Ambler Class B enzymes.
ARO:3000170.label: imipenem

ARO:3000171.definition: Diaminopyrimidines are a class of organic compounds containing a pyrimidine ring substituted by two amine groups.  They are inhibitors of dihydrofolate reductase, an enzyme critical for DNA synthesis.
ARO:3000171.label: diaminopyrimidine antibiotic

ARO:3004427.definition: Growth medium supplemented with 2% (wt/vol) sodium chloride for testing susceptibility of Staphylococcus aureus to methicillin, oxacillin and nafcillin.
ARO:3004427.label: NaCl supplemented medium

ARO:3000178.definition: TetK is a tetracycline efflux protein found in both Gram-negative (Haemophilus and Gallibacterium) and Gram-positive (many species, including mycobacteria) bacteria.
ARO:3000178.label: tet(K)

ARO:3000179.definition: TetL is a tetracycline efflux protein found in many species of Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria.
ARO:3000179.label: tet(L)

ARO:3000370.definition: Many drugs target topoisomerases to inhibit DNA synthesis. Resistant DNA topoisomerase subunits prevent antibiotic binding and thus confer resistance.
ARO:3000370.label: antibiotic resistant DNA topoisomerase subunit

ARO:3003450.definition: Mutations that occurs on the iniC genes resulting in the resistance to ethambutol
ARO:3003450.label: Ethambutol resistant iniC

ARO:3000372.definition: VanT is a membrane bound serine racemase, converting L-serine to D-serine. It is associated with VanC, which incorporated D-serine into D-Ala-D-Ser terminal end of peptidoglycan subunits that have a decreased binding affinity with vancomycin. It was isolated from Enterococcus gallinarum.
ARO:3000372.label: vanT

ARO:3000373.definition: EmrKY is a homolog of EmrAB found in E. coli. Together with TolC, it is a tripartite multidrug transporter.
ARO:3000373.label: EmrKY-TolC

ARO:3000375.definition: ErmB confers the MLSb phenotype. Similar to ErmC, expression of ErmB is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmB.
ARO:3000375.label: ErmB

ARO:3000376.definition: vgb (Virginiamycin B) lyase inactivates type B streptogramin antibiotics by linearizing the streptogramin lactone ring at the ester linkage through an elimination mechanism, thus conferring resistance to these compounds.
ARO:3000376.label: streptogramin vgb lyase

ARO:3003983.definition: Chloramphenicol acetyltransferase conferring resistance to phenicol antibiotics detected in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, an isolated strain of Paenibacillus from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003983.label: CatU

ARO:3000378.definition: MexB is the inner membrane multidrug exporter of the efflux complex MexAB-OprM.

ARO:3000379.definition: OprM is an outer membrane factor protein found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Burkholderia vietnamiensis. It is part of the MexAB-OprM, MexVW-OprM, MexXY-OprM and the AmrAB-OprM complex.
ARO:3000379.label: OprM

ARO:3004077.definition: PmpM is a multidrug efflux pump belonging to the MATE family of Pseudomonas aeruginosa. ARO:3002207.definition: IMP-16 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002207.label: IMP-16

ARO:3002204.definition: IMP-13 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002204.label: IMP-13

ARO:3002205.definition: IMP-14 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas and Acinetobacter spp.
ARO:3002205.label: IMP-14

ARO:3002523.definition: AAC(2')-Ia is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in P. stuartii
ARO:3002523.label: AAC(2')-Ia

ARO:3002798.definition: QnrS9 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002798.label: QnrS9

ARO:3002208.definition: IMP-17 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of IMP beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002208.label: IMP-17

ARO:3002209.definition: IMP-18 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002209.label: IMP-18

ARO:3000770.definition: AdeABC is an RND multidrug efflux system in Acinetobacter species, notably A. baunmannii. AdeA is a membrane fusion protein, AdeB is the inner membrane transporter, and AdeC is the outer membrane factor. It confers resistance to tigecycline.
ARO:3000770.label: AdeABC

ARO:3000771.definition: AdeFGH is a RND multidrug efflux pump expressed in Acinetobacter baumannii. It confers resistance to fluoroquinolone, tetracycline, tigecycline, chloramphenicol, clindamycin, trimethoprim, and sulfamethoxazole.
ARO:3000771.label: AdeFGH

ARO:3000772.definition: AdeIJK is a RND multidrug efflux pump expressed in Acinetobacter baumannii. It contributes to resistance for beta-lactams, chloramphenicol, tetracycline, erythromycin, lincosamides, fluoroquinolone, fusidic acid, novobiocin, rifampicin, trimethoprim, acridine, pyronine, and safranin.
ARO:3000772.label: AdeIJK

ARO:3000773.definition: CmeABC is a multidrug efflux pump in Campylobacter jejuni. Its overexpression led to enhanced resistance to ciprofloxacin, norfloxacin, cefotaxime, fusidic acid, and erythromycin. CmeA acts as the periplasmic fusion protein, CmeB is the inner membrane transporter, and CmeC is an outer membrane protein.
ARO:3000773.label: CmeABC

ARO:3003437.definition: Peptide antibiotics inhibit protein synthesis. Resistance to viomycin can be caused by an altered RNA molecule in the 16S ribosomal subunit.
ARO:3003437.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to viomycin

ARO:3003668.definition: Point mutations in the 16S rRNA of bacteria can confer resistance to polyamine antibiotics.
ARO:3003668.label: 16s rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to polyamine antibiotics

ARO:3003191.definition: QnrB79 is a fluoroquinolone resistance gene in Lahey's list of qnr genes
ARO:3003191.label: QnrB79

ARO:3000741.definition: DNA in the transcriptional complex is partially unwound, allowing antibiotics to target exposed bases and prevent DNA transcription.
ARO:3000741.label: transcription complex DNA

ARO:3001304.definition: ErmS is a methyltransferase found in the tylosin producer Streptomyces fradiae. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers two methyl groups. The gene is found within the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance
ARO:3001304.label: ErmS

ARO:3003465.definition: Specific mutations that occurs on Mycobacterium tuberculosis embB causing it to be rifampicin resistant
ARO:3003465.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis embB mutants conferring resistance to rifampicin

ARO:3003464.definition: Arabinosyl transferases allow for the polymerization of arabinose to form arabinan. Arabanan is required for formation of mycobacterial cell walls and arabinosyltransferases are targets of the drug ethambutol. Mutations in these genes can confer resistance to rifampicin.
ARO:3003464.label: rifamycin-resistant arabinosyltransferase

ARO:3003466.definition: GidB is a m7G methyltransferase specific for 16S rRNA. Mutations within the gidB gene causes changes in the structure or 16s rRNA, leading to resistance to aminoglycosides
ARO:3003466.label: antibiotic resistant gidB

ARO:3003461.definition: Point mutations in the Mycobacterium tuberculosis ndh gene shown clinically to confer resistance to isoniazid.
ARO:3003461.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis ndh with mutation conferring resistance to isoniazid

ARO:3003460.definition: ndh is a NADH oxidase. It participates in antibiotic resistance by diminishing NADH oxidation and consequently causes an increase in NADH concentration and depletion of NAD+. This alteration of the NADH/NAD+ ratio prevents the peroxidation reactions required for the activation of INH, as well as the displacement of the NADH-isonicotinic acyl complex from InhA enzyme binding site.
ARO:3003460.label: antibiotic resistant ndh

ARO:3002118.definition: CMY-106 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002118.label: CMY-106

ARO:3003462.definition: kasA is a  ketoacyl acyl carrier protein synthase that catalyzes the condensation reaction of fatty acid synthesis by the addition to an acyl acceptor of two carbons from malonyl-ACP. It is involved in elongation of fatty acids intermediate in the biosynthetic pathway of mycolic acids.
ARO:3003462.label: antibiotic resistant kasA

ARO:3002116.label: CMY-104

ARO:3003710.label: MexL

ARO:3003649.label: CTX-M-165

ARO:3003889.label: Escherichia coli GlpT with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin

ARO:3003888.label: ADC-82

ARO:3001826.label: ACT-9

ARO:3001825.label: ACT-6

ARO:3001824.label: ACT-5

ARO:3001829.label: ACT-4

ARO:3001828.definition: ACT-23 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001828.label: ACT-23

ARO:3000515.definition: EvgSA is a two-component regulatory system that regulates MdtEF and EmrKY expression for multidrug resistance. EvgS is a sensor protein that phosphorylates the regulatory protein EvgA, though EvgA can be phosphorylated by other methods when it is overexpressed.
ARO:3000515.label: evgSA

ARO:3000516.definition: EmrR is a negative regulator for the EmrAB-TolC multidrug efflux pump in E. coli. Mutations lead to EmrAB-TolC overexpression.
ARO:3000516.label: emrR

ARO:3000517.definition: Rifaximin is a semi-synthetic rifamycin used to treat traveller's diarrhea. Rifaximin inhibits RNA synthesis by binding to the beta subunit of bacterial RNA polymerase.
ARO:3000517.label: rifaximin

ARO:3000510.definition: An alternative isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase conferring resistance to mupirocin.
ARO:3000510.label: Staphylococcus mupB conferring resistance to mupirocin

ARO:3000518.definition: CRP is a global regulator that represses MdtEF multidrug efflux pump expression.
ARO:3000518.label: CRP

ARO:3000519.definition: Enzymes that confer resistance by modifying antibiotic targets.
ARO:3000519.label: antibiotic target modifying enzyme

ARO:0000063.definition: Cefuroxime is a second-generation cephalosporin antibiotic with increased stability with beta-lactamases than first-generation cephalosporins. Cefuroxime is active against Gram-positive organisms but less active against methicillin-resistant strains.
ARO:0000063.label: cefuroxime

ARO:0000062.definition: Ceftriaxone is a third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic. The presence of an aminothiazolyl sidechain increases ceftriazone's resistance to beta-lactamases. Like other third-generation cephalosporins, it has broad spectrum activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
ARO:0000062.label: ceftriaxone

ARO:0000061.definition: Ceftobiprole (Zeftera/Zevtera) is a next generation (5th generation) cephalosporin antibiotic with activity against methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus, penicillin-resistant Streptococcus pneumoniae, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, and Enterococci. Ceftobiprole inhibits transpeptidases essential to building cell walls, and is a poor substrate for most beta-lactamases.
ARO:0000061.label: ceftobiprole

ARO:0000060.definition: Ceftazidime is a third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic. Like other third-generation cephalosporins, it has broad spectrum activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. Unlike most third-generation agents, it is active against Pseudomonas aeruginosa, however it has weaker activity against Gram-positive microorganisms and is not used for such infections.
ARO:0000060.label: ceftazidime

ARO:0000067.definition: Colistins are polymyxin antibiotics produced by certain strains of Bacillus polymyxa var. colistinus. Colistin, also referred to as polymyxin E, is a mixture of cyclic polypeptides colistin A and B which disrupt the bacterial cell membrane and is effective against Gram-negative bacteria.
ARO:0000067.label: colistin

ARO:0000066.definition: Clindamycin is a lincosamide antibiotic that blocks A-site aminoacyl-tRNA binding. It is usually used to treat infections with anaerobic bacteria but can also be used to treat some protozoal diseases, such as malaria.
ARO:0000066.label: clindamycin

ARO:0000065.definition: Clarithromycin is a methyl derivative of erythromycin, sharing the 14-carbon macrolide ring. The antibiotic binds to the 50S subunit of the ribosome and is used to treat pharyngitis, tonsillitis, acute maxillary sinusitis, acute bacterial exacerbation of chronic bronchitis, pneumonia (especially atypical pneumonias associated with Chlamydia pneumoniae or TWAR), and skin structure infections.
ARO:0000065.label: clarithromycin

ARO:0000064.definition: Amoxicillin is a moderate-spectrum, bacteriolytic, beta-lactam antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections caused by susceptible microorganisms. A derivative of penicillin, it has a wider range of treatment but remains relatively ineffective against Gram-negative bacteria. It is commonly taken with clavulanic acid, a beta-lactamase inhibitor. Like other beta-lactams, amoxicillin interferes with the synthesis of peptidoglycan.
ARO:0000064.label: amoxicillin

ARO:0000069.definition: Doxycycline is second generation semi-synthetic derivative of the tetracycline group of antibiotics. It inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 30S subunit of the bacterial ribosome and preventing the aminotransferase-tRNA from associating with the ribosome.
ARO:0000069.label: doxycycline

ARO:0000068.definition: Daptomycin is a novel lipopeptide antibiotic used in the treatment of certain infections caused by Gram-positive organisms. Daptomycin interferes with the bacterial cell membrane, reducing membrane potential and inhibiting cell wall synthesis.
ARO:0000068.label: daptomycin

ARO:3003431.definition: Ribosomal protein S12 stabilizes the highly conserved pseudoknot structure formed by 16S rRNA. It is targeted and inhibited by streptomycin
ARO:3003431.label: antibiotic sensitive Ribosomal protein S12 (rpsL)

ARO:3004430.definition: The tissue type used to select breakpoints from a particular standard, for the interpretation of MIC results.
ARO:3004430.label: antimicrobial resistance tissue specificity

ARO:3002068.definition: CMY-57 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3002068.label: CMY-57

ARO:3002069.definition: CMY-59 is a beta-lactamase found in Shigella spp.
ARO:3002069.label: CMY-59

ARO:3000208.definition: Addition of glycosyl moiety to antibiotics thereby inactivating them.
ARO:3000208.label: glycosylation of antibiotic conferring resistance

ARO:3001162.definition: SHV-113 is a beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
ARO:3001162.label: SHV-113

ARO:3004215.definition: This subclass B3 of beta-lactamses have the ability to hydrolyze cephalosporins.
ARO:3004215.label: L1 family beta-lactamase

ARO:3004214.definition: Beta-lactamases that are part of the THIN-B family, which is a subclass B3 beta-lactamase family and hydrolyze a broad spectrum of beta-lactams including penicillins, cephalosporins, and carbapenems.
ARO:3004214.label: THIN-B beta-lactamase

ARO:3004213.definition: GOB-18 is a member of subclass B3 GOB family of beta-lactamases isolated from Elizabethkingia meningoseptica. GOB-18 is unlike other subclass B3 beta-lactamases as it is fully active against a broad range of beta-lactam substrates using a single Zn(II) ion in its active site.
ARO:3004213.label: GOB-18

ARO:3004212.definition: The GOB family of beta-lactamases have been discovered in the Elizabethkingia meningoseptica and are classified as subclass B3 beta-lactamase. They confer resistance to cephalosporins, penicillins, and carbapenems.
ARO:3004212.label: GOB beta-lactamase

ARO:3004211.definition: The FEZ family of beta-lactamases are subclass B3 beta-lactamases that hydrolyze penicillins, cephalosporins, and carbapenems.
ARO:3004211.label: FEZ beta-lactamase

ARO:3000968.definition: TEM-105 is a beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
ARO:3000968.label: TEM-105

ARO:3000200.definition: Gramicidin S is a cyclical decapeptide with two pentapeptides (Val-Orn-Leu-D-Phe-Pro) joined head to tail. Like other gramicidins, Gramicidin S disrupts membrane permeability of cations while also destabilizing the membrane at higher concentrations.
ARO:3000200.label: gramicidin S

ARO:3000201.definition: Enzymes shown to inactivate macrolide antibiotics by chemical modification, thereby conferring resistance to macrolides.
ARO:3000201.label: macrolide inactivation enzyme

ARO:3000202.definition: Cfr genes produce enzymes which catalyze the methylation of the 23S rRNA subunit at position 8 of adenine-2503. Methylation of 23S rRNA at this site confers resistance to some classes of antibiotics, including streptogramins, chloramphenicols, florfenicols, linezolids and clindamycin.
ARO:3000202.label: Cfr 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferase

ARO:3000203.definition: Mechanism of enzymatic degradation common to Ambler Class B beta-lactamases. One or two zinc atoms are used to orient a hydroxide nucleophile for attack of the beta-lactam ring.  In contrast to serine beta-lactamases, no acyl-enzyme intermediate is formed.
ARO:3000203.label: hydrolysis of beta-lactam antibiotic by metallo-beta-lactamase

ARO:3000205.definition: TetX is a flavin-dependent monooxygenase conferring resistance to tetracycline antibiotics. TetX hydroxylates position 11a of the tetraketide group thus inactivating the antibiotic.
ARO:3000205.label: tetX

ARO:3004219.definition: BJP beta-lactamases are a subclass B3 family.
ARO:3004219.label: BJP beta-lactamase

ARO:3004218.definition: CAU beta-lactamases are a subclass B3 family.
ARO:3004218.label: CAU beta-lactamase

ARO:3002613.definition: aadA13 is an aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase gene encoded by plasmids and integrons in Pseudomonas rettgeri, P. aeruginosa, Y. enterocolitica and E. coli
ARO:3002613.label: aadA13

ARO:3004406.definition: Specific vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility headquartered in France. bioMérieux is the developer of the Vitek automated testing platform.
ARO:3004406.label: bioMérieux

ARO:3001559.definition: OXA-373 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of OXA beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001559.label: OXA-373

ARO:3004404.definition: Vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility.
ARO:3004404.label: automated testing platform vendor

ARO:3004405.definition: Specific vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility headquartered in New Jersey, USA. Becton Dickinson is the developer of the Phoenix automated testing platform.
ARO:3004405.label: Becton Dickinson

ARO:3001168.definition: SHV-121 is a beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates. Identical to SHV-136.
ARO:3001168.label: SHV-121

ARO:3000345.definition: Acetylation of the aminoglycoside antibiotic on the amino group at position 6'.
ARO:3000345.label: AAC(6')

ARO:3000344.definition: EmrAB-TolC is a multidrug efflux system found in E. coli. EmrB is the electrochemical-gradient powered transporter; EmrA is the linker; and TolC is the outer membrane channel. It confers resistance to nalidixic acid and thiolactomycin.
ARO:3000344.label: EmrAB-TolC

ARO:3000347.definition: ErmA confers the MLSb phenotype. Similar to ErmC, Expression of ErmA is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmA.
ARO:3000347.label: ErmA

ARO:3001169.definition: SHV-122 is a beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
ARO:3001169.label: SHV-122

ARO:3000341.definition: Acetylation of the aminoglycoside antibiotic on the amino group at position 2'.
ARO:3000341.label: AAC(2')

ARO:3000343.definition: Efflux pump proteins contained within Mycobacterial genomes which confer resistance to a number of different antibiotics including aminoglycosides, and tetracyclines.
ARO:3000343.label: tap

ARO:3000342.definition: Enzymes that inactivate fosfomycin by chemical modification.
ARO:3000342.label: fosfomycin inactivation enzyme

ARO:3004323.definition: Any strain of Pseudomonas aeruginosa that has tested either Intermediate or Resistant to at least one of the following antibiotics: imipenem, meropenem and/or doripenem
ARO:3004323.label: carbapenem-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa

ARO:3004322.definition: Any Klebsiella oxytoca or Klebsiella pneumoniae that has tested Intermediate or Resistant in at least 3 of the following categories: extended-spectrum cephalosporins, fluoroquinolones, aminoglycosides, carbapenems, or pipericillin/tazobactam
ARO:3004322.label: multidrug-resistant Klebsiella

ARO:3004321.definition: Any Klebsiella oxytoca or Klebsiella pneumoniae that has tested resistant to at least one of the following antibiotics: ceftriaxone, ceftazidime, cefepime, and/or cefotaxime.
ARO:3004321.label: extended-spectrum cephalosporin-resistant Klebsiella

ARO:3004320.definition: Any Klebsiella oxytoca or Klebsiella pneumoniae that has tested resistant to at least one of the following antibiotics: imipenem, meropenem, doripenem, ertapenem.
ARO:3004320.label: carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella

ARO:3004327.definition: Any Pseudomonas aeruginosa that has tested resistant (R) to at least one of the following: amikacin, gentamicin, tobramycin
ARO:3004327.label: aminoglycoside-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa

ARO:3004326.definition: Any Pseudomonas aeruginosa that has tested resistant (R) to at least one of the following: ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin
ARO:3004326.label: fluoroquinolone-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa

ARO:3004325.definition: MCR-4 is a plasmid-borne phosphoethanolamine transferase variant of MCR-1, isolated from Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium of porcine origin in Italy, Spain and Belgium through 2013 and 2015-2016. MCR-4 confers resistance to collistin via addition of a phosphoethanolamine group to lipid A, reducing the negative charge of the cell membrane. Described by Carattoli et al. 2017.
ARO:3004325.label: MCR-4

ARO:3004324.definition: Any strain of Pseudomonas aeruginosa that has tested Resistant to at least one of the following antibiotics: cefepime and/or ceftazidime
ARO:3004324.label: extended-spectrum cephalosporin-resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa

ARO:3003719.definition: MSI-OXA is an OXA-85-like class D beta lactamase isolated from Massilia oculi.
ARO:3003719.label: MSI-OXA

ARO:3001618.definition: OXA-70 is a beta-lactamase found in A. baumannii
ARO:3001618.label: OXA-70

ARO:3001619.definition: OXA-71 is a beta-lactamase found in A. baumannii
ARO:3001619.label: OXA-71

ARO:3003370.definition: Sequence variants of Escherichia coli elongation factor Tu that confer resistance to Enacyloxin IIa
ARO:3003370.label: Escherichia coli EF-Tu mutants conferring resistance to Enacyloxin IIa

ARO:3002125.definition: CMY-114 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002125.label: CMY-114

ARO:3003718.definition: MSI-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Massilia oculi conferring resistance to carbapenems.
ARO:3003718.label: MSI-1

ARO:3002124.definition: CMY-113 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002124.label: CMY-113

ARO:3004153.definition: Point mutations in the thymidylate synthetase thyA gene shown clinically to confer resistance to para-aminosalicylic acid. Loss-of-function mutations in thyA disrupt the catalytic activity and substrate-binding affinity, thus conferring resistance.
ARO:3004153.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis thyA with mutation conferring resistance to para-aminosalicylic acid

ARO:3004190.definition: BlaA beta-lactamases are Class A beta-lactamases first identified in Yersinia enterocolitica and have the ability to hydrolize penicilins and cephalosporins.

ARO:3004191.definition: Aminoglycoside 2''-phosphotransferase identified from the gram-negative pathogen Campylobacter jejuni. APH(2'')-If was shown to confer resistance to 4,6-disubstituted antibiotics kanamycin, tobramycin, dibekacin, gentamicin and sisomicin through antibiotic phosphorylation. Described by Toth et al. 2013.
ARO:3004191.label: APH(2'')-If

ARO:3004192.definition: cepA beta-lactamases are Class A beta-lactamases found in Bateroides fragilis and have the ability to hydrolyze cephalosporin.
ARO:3004192.label: cepA beta-lactamase

ARO:3004193.definition: Sed beta-lactamases are Class A beta-lactamases that are capable of hydrolyzing benzypenicillin, cephalothin, and cloxacillin.
ARO:3004193.label: Sed beta-lactamase

ARO:3004198.definition: R39 beta-lactamases are Class A beta-lactamases encoded in Actinomadura R39 with the ability to hydrolyze penicillins.
ARO:3004198.label: R39 beta-lactamase

ARO:3004199.definition: CepS beta-lactamases are Class C beta-lactamases capable of hydrolyzing cephalosporin.
ARO:3004199.label: CepS beta-lactamase

ARO:3000839.definition: ArlS is a protein histidine kinase that phosphorylates ArlR, a promoter for norA expression.
ARO:3000839.label: arlS

ARO:3000838.definition: ArlR is a response regulator that binds to the norA promoter to activate expression. ArlR must first be phosphorylated by ArlS.
ARO:3000838.label: arlR

ARO:3000833.definition: EvgS is a sensor protein that phosphorylates the regulatory protein EvgA. evgS corresponds to 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 and 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
ARO:3000833.label: evgS

ARO:3000832.definition: EvgA, when phosphorylated, is a positive regulator for efflux protein complexes emrKY and mdtEF. While usually phosphorylated in a EvgS dependent manner, it can be phosphorylated in the absence of EvgS when overexpressed.
ARO:3000832.label: evgA

ARO:3000831.definition: CpxR is a regulator that promotes acrD expression when phosphorylated by a cascade involving CpxA, a sensor kinase. CpxR is also directly involved in activation of expression of RND efflux pump MexAB-OprM in P. aeruginosa. CpxR is required to enhance mexAB-oprM expression and drug resistance, in the absence of repressor MexR.
ARO:3000831.label: CpxR

ARO:3000830.definition: CpxA is a membrane-localized sensor kinase that is activated by envelope stress. It starts a kinase cascade that activates CpxR, which promotes efflux complex expression.
ARO:3000830.label: cpxA

ARO:3000837.definition: SoxS is a global regulator that up-regulates the expression of AcrAB efflux genes. It also reduces OmpF expression to decrease cell membrane permeability.
ARO:3000837.label: soxS

ARO:3000836.definition: SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps. In Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which lacks SoxS, SoxR is able to directly upregulate the expression of the MexGHI-OpmD efflux pump.
ARO:3000836.label: soxR

ARO:3000835.definition: PhoQ is a sensor protein that is induced by low Mg2+ concentrations. When activated, PhoQ donates a phosphate to activate PhoP.
ARO:3000835.label: phoQ

ARO:3000834.definition: PhoP is a direct repressor of the macAB efflux genes.
ARO:3000834.label: phoP

ARO:3000466.definition: Dalbavancin is a semisynthetic second-generation lipoglycopeptide derived from teicoplanin. It binds to the D-Ala-D-Ala terminus of peptidoglycan precursors. It is used to treat Gram-positive bacteria and can be used to treat methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus and vancomycin-resistant enterococci.
ARO:3000466.label: dalbavancin

ARO:3000749.definition: Penicillin-binding proteins (PBPs) are responsible for transpeptidation, joining subunits to form peptidoglycan. They are numbered according to descending molecular weight, and may vary between species. These numbers represent the PBPs of E. coli. Inhibition of the larger PBPs responsible for transpeptidation (1-3) are lethal. Smaller PBPs (4-6) are involed in carboxypeptidation; inhibition of these is non-lethal.
ARO:3000749.label: beta-lactam sensitive penicillin-binding protein

ARO:3003479.definition: TetR is the repressor of the tetracycline resistance element; its N-terminal region forms a helix-turn-helix structure and binds DNA. Binding of tetracycline to TetR reduces the repressor affinity for the tetracycline resistance gene (tetA) promoter operator sites. Mutations arise within tetR results in lower affinity for tetracyclin
ARO:3003479.label: tetR
