ARO:3002470.label: LEN-23

ARO:3002473.definition: LEN-17 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002473.label: LEN-17

ARO:3002472.definition: LEN-4 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002472.label: LEN-4

ARO:3003252.definition: Genes that provide a bacteria with resistance to bacitracin
ARO:3003252.label: bacitracin resistance gene

ARO:3003253.definition: Subunit of topoisomerase IV sensitive to aminocourmarins
ARO:3003253.label: aminocoumarin sensitive parY

ARO:3002309.definition: VIM-39 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of VIM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002309.label: VIM-39

ARO:3002308.definition: VIM-38 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002308.label: VIM-38

ARO:3001908.definition: CTX-M-46 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001908.label: CTX-M-46

ARO:3001909.definition: CTX-M-47 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001909.label: CTX-M-47

ARO:3003254.definition: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Binding the alpha-subunit is sufficient to inhibit DNA supercoiling.
ARO:3003254.label: antibiotic sensitive DNA topoisomerase subunit gyrA

ARO:3001904.definition: CTX-M-42 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001904.label: CTX-M-42

ARO:3001905.definition: CTX-M-43 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Acinetobacter spp.
ARO:3001905.label: CTX-M-43

ARO:3001906.definition: CTX-M-44 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001906.label: CTX-M-44

ARO:3001907.definition: CTX-M-45 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001907.label: CTX-M-45

ARO:3001900.definition: CTX-M-38 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001900.label: CTX-M-38

ARO:3001901.definition: CTX-M-39 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001901.label: CTX-M-39

ARO:3001902.definition: CTX-M-40 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001902.label: CTX-M-40

ARO:3001903.definition: CTX-M-41 is a beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis
ARO:3001903.label: CTX-M-41

ARO:3004064.definition: Edeine acetyltransferase enzymes catalyze the transfer of an acetyl group to active edeine, converting it to an inactive form in vivo. This mechanism is used for high-level self-resistance in edeine-producing Brevibacillus spp.
ARO:3004064.label: Edeine acetyltransferase

ARO:3000697.definition: Moenomycin A1 is a major component of moenomycin mixtures. It is produced by Streptomyces ghanaensis, S. bambergiensis, S. ederensis, and S. geysiriensis.
ARO:3000697.label: moenomycin A1

ARO:3000696.definition: Actinomycin D is a cyclic peptide antibiotic that interacts with DNA to inhibit RNA synthesis.
ARO:3000696.label: actinomycin D

ARO:3000695.definition: Actinomycins are peptide antibiotics that interact with DNA. This prevents RNA synthesis, thus preventing the production of proteins vital to the cell.
ARO:3000695.label: actinomycin

ARO:3000694.definition: Magainins are antimicrobial peptides produced by amphibians skil cells as part of their innate immune system. It is active against a broad range of gram-negative and gram-positive bacteria, fungi and protozoa.
ARO:3000694.label: magainin

ARO:3000693.definition: Defensins are natural cationic peptides that have antibiotic properties. It is part of the innate immune system of plants and animals.
ARO:3000693.label: defensin

ARO:3000692.definition: Bleomycin B2 is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Streptomyces verticillus taken as a mixture of bleomycins. It induces stand breaks in bacterial nucleic acids.
ARO:3000692.label: bleomycin B2

ARO:3000691.definition: Bleomycin A2 is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Streptomyces verticillus taken as a mixture of bleomycins. It induces stand breaks in bacterial nucleic acids.
ARO:3000691.label: bleomycin A2

ARO:3000690.definition: Bleomycinic acid is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Streptomyces verticillus taken as a mixture of bleomycins. It induces stand breaks in bacterial nucleic acids.
ARO:3000690.label: bleomycinic acid

ARO:3003657.definition: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available
ARO:3003657.label: IMP-49

ARO:3003654.definition: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available
ARO:3003654.label: CMY-134

ARO:3003655.definition: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available
ARO:3003655.label: ACT-38

ARO:3003652.definition: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available
ARO:3003652.label: CMY-132

ARO:3003653.definition: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available
ARO:3003653.label: CMY-133

ARO:3003650.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamase, no other information available
ARO:3003650.label: CTM-X-166

ARO:3000698.definition: Sulfasalazine is a derivative of the early sulfonamide sulfapyridine (salicylazosulfapyridine). It was developed to increase water solubility and is taken orally for ulcerative colitis.
ARO:3000698.label: sulfasalazine

ARO:3003898.definition: Lugdunin is a thiazolidine-containing cyclic peptide antibiotic isolated from nasal Staphylococcus lugnunensis that prohibits Staphylococcus aureus colony formation. It is a human commensal bacteria, indicating the potential for further antibiotic discoveries from human microbiota.
ARO:3003898.label: lugdunin

ARO:3003899.definition: PtsI (phosphoenolpyruvate-protein phosphotransferase) is involved in cyclic AMP synthesis, which regulates glpT expression. As a result, mutations to ptsI confer resistance to fosfomycin by affecting the regulation of fosfomycin import.
ARO:3003899.label: Escherichia coli PtsI with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin

ARO:3003890.definition: Mutations to the active importer UhpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.
ARO:3003890.label: Escherichia coli UhpT with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin

ARO:3003893.definition: uhpA is a positive activator of the fosfomycin importer uhpT, thus mutations to uhpA confer fosfomycin resistance by reducing uhpT expression. Both knockout and amino acid substitution mutations have been found that confer resistance, with the Protein Knockout model describing the large, knockout mutations causing loss of function of the gene, and the Protein Variant model describing the amino acid substitutions.
ARO:3003893.label: Escherichia coli UhpA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin

ARO:3003894.definition: Rm3 is a class B3 metallo-beta-lactamase isolated from a metagenomic soil sample in Yorkshire, United Kingdom, shown to confer resistance to clinically used penicillins, cephalosporins, and carbapenems.
ARO:3003894.label: Rm3

ARO:3003895.definition: Mutations in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PhoP of the two-component PhoPQ regulatory system. Presence of mutation confers resistance to colistin.
ARO:3003895.label: Pseudomonas mutant PhoP conferring resistance to colistin

ARO:3003896.definition: Mutations in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PhoQ of the two-component PhoPQ regulatory system. Presence of mutation confers resistance to colistin
ARO:3003896.label: Pseudomonas mutant PhoQ conferring resistance to colistin

ARO:3003897.definition: Tedizolid is a synthetic oxazolidinone antibiotic that is administered to the patient as a prodrug that is activated in vivo. It acts as an inhibitor of protein synthesis by binding the 50S subunit of the ribosome and preventing formation of the 70S initiation complex. It is active against Gram-positive pathogens.
ARO:3003897.label: tedizolid

ARO:3000529.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to mupirocin antibiotics. Mutations in ileS is shown to confer low-level mupirocin resistance, while high-level resistance is conferred by the presence of alternative isoleucyl-tRNA synthetases.
ARO:3000529.label: determinant of mupirocin resistance

ARO:3000528.definition: Chlortetracycline was an early, first-generation tetracycline antibiotic developed in the 1940's. It inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 30S subunit of bacterial ribosomes, preventing the aminoacyl-tRNA from binding to the ribosome.
ARO:3000528.label: chlortetracycline

ARO:3001832.definition: ACT-10 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001832.label: ACT-10

ARO:3001833.definition: ACT-11 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001833.label: ACT-11

ARO:3001834.definition: ACT-12 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001834.label: ACT-12

ARO:3001835.definition: ACT-13 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001835.label: ACT-13

ARO:3001836.definition: ACT-14 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001836.label: ACT-14

ARO:3001837.definition: ACT-15 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001837.label: ACT-15

ARO:3001838.definition: ACT-17 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001838.label: ACT-17

ARO:3000520.definition: Isoniazid is an organic compound that is the first-line anti tuberculosis medication in prevention and treatment. As a prodrug, it is activated by mycobacterial catalase-peroxidases such as M. tuberculosis KatG. Isoniazid inhibits mycolic acid synthesis, which prevents cell wall synthesis in mycobacteria.
ARO:3000520.label: isoniazid

ARO:3000522.definition: ErmG is a rRNA adenine N-6-methyltransferase that protects the ribosome from inactivation due to antibiotic binding.
ARO:3000522.label: ErmG

ARO:3000525.definition: A40926 is a glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Nonomuraea sp. ATCC 39727. It is precusor of the second-generation glycopeptide antibiotic dalbavancin.
ARO:3000525.label: antibiotic A40926

ARO:3000524.definition: CpxAR is a two-component regulatory system that involves a sensor kinase, CpxA, and the regulator CpxR. When the membrane envelope is stressed, CpxAR promotes acrD and mdtABC expression to confer multidrug resistance through efflux.
ARO:3000524.label: cpxAR

ARO:3000527.definition: Polyamine antibiotics are organic compounds having two or more primary amino groups.
ARO:3000527.label: polyamine antibiotic

ARO:3000526.definition: CmeR is a repressor for the CmeABC multidrug efflux pump, binding to the cmeABC promoter region.
ARO:3000526.label: cmeR

ARO:3000582.definition: L1 is an Ambler class B MBL; subclass B3 originally isolated from Stenotrophomonas maltophilia.  It has activity against a broad range of beta-lactams and is only active with two Zn(II) ions in the active site.
ARO:3000582.label: L1 beta-lactamase

ARO:0000070.definition: Ertapenem is a carbapenem antibiotic and is highly resistant to beta-lactamases like other carbapenems. It inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis.
ARO:0000070.label: ertapenem

ARO:3003091.definition: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface of both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins. Mutations in mprF can additionally confer resistance to daptomycin in S. aureus.
ARO:3003091.label: daptomycin resistant mprF

ARO:0000072.definition: Linezolid is a synthetic antibiotic used for the treatment of serious infections caused by Gram-positive bacteria that are resistant to several other antibiotics. It inhibits protein synthesis by binding to domain V of the 23S rRNA of the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes.
ARO:0000072.label: linezolid

ARO:0000073.definition: Meropenem is an ultra-broad spectrum injectable antibiotic used to treat a wide variety of infections, including meningitis and pneumonia. It is a beta-lactam and belongs to the subgroup of carbapenem, similar to imipenem and ertapenem.
ARO:0000073.label: meropenem

ARO:0000074.definition: Moxifloxacin is a fourth generation synthetic fluoroquinolone chemotherapeutic agent, and has been shown to be significantly more active than levofloxacin (4 to 8 times more) against Streptococcus pneumoniae. It acts by inhibiting bacterial DNA topoisomerases.
ARO:0000074.label: moxifloxacin

ARO:3003095.definition: imiS is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas veronii. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems.
ARO:3003095.label: imiS

ARO:0000076.definition: Inhibitors of antibiotic resistance, including specifically antibiotic adjuvants, are non-antibiotic compounds which act to block resistance or enhance antibiotic action. These are delivered in combination with an antibiotic (e.g. amoxicillin-clavulanic acid) and may either affect the host organism or the pathogen. Adjuvants are therefore used to rescue the activity of existing drugs, and are researched as an alternative solution the antibiotic resistance crisis.
ARO:0000076.label: inhibitor of antibiotic resistance

ARO:0000077.definition: Tazobactam is a compound which inhibits the action of bacterial beta-lactamases.
ARO:0000077.label: tazobactam

ARO:0000078.definition: Piperacillin is an acetylureidopenicillin and has an extended spectrum of targets relative to other beta-lactam antibiotics. It inhibits cell wall synthesis in bacteria, and is usually taken with the beta-lactamase inhibitor tazobactam to overcome penicillin-resistant bacteria.
ARO:0000078.label: piperacillin

ARO:0000079.synonyms: Clavulox;Isoclavulanic acid;acidum clavulanicum;clavulanic acid;Acido clavulanico;Acide clavulanique;Clavulansaeure;Sodium Clavulanate
ARO:0000079.definition: Clavulanic acid is a beta-lactamase inhibitor (marketed by GlaxoSmithKline, formerly Beecham) combined with penicillin group antibiotics to overcome certain types of antibiotic resistance. It is used to overcome resistance in bacteria that secrete beta-lactamase, which otherwise inactivates most penicillins.
ARO:0000079.label: clavulanate

ARO:3000078.definition: The Class A beta-lactamases are one of the subgroups of beta-lactamases that are classified as serine enzymes. Class A beta-lactamases exhibit a large degree of variability and are known to hydrolyze penicillins.
ARO:3000078.label: class A beta-lactamase

ARO:3003395.definition:
Ribosomal protein S12 stabilizes the highly conserved
pseudoknot structure formed by 16S rRNA. Amino acid
substitutions in RpsL affect the higher-order structure of 16S
rRNA and confer streptomycin resistance by disrupting interactions between 16S rRNA and streptomycin.
ARO:3003395.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis rpsL mutations conferring resistance to Streptomycin

ARO:3004260.definition: Bah amidohydrolases are membrane proteins that inactivate bacitracin.
ARO:3004260.label: Bah amidohydrolase

ARO:3004261.definition: Viomycin family of phosphotransferases confer resistance to viomycin antibiotics.
ARO:3004261.label: viomycin phosphotransferase

ARO:3004204.definition: EBR beta-lactamases are Class B beta-lactamases first isolated from Empedobacter brevis and are able to hydrolyze penicillins, cephalosporins, and carbapenems.
ARO:3004204.label: EBR beta-lactamase

ARO:3004205.definition: TUS beta-lactamases are Class B beta-lactamases that can hydrolyze a variety of beta-lactams, such as cephems and carbapenems
ARO:3004205.label: TUS beta-lactamase

ARO:3004206.definition: SIM beta-lactamases are Class B beta-lactamases that are capable of hydrolyzing a wide variety of beta-lactams, including penicillins, narrow- to expanded-spectrum cephalosporins, and carbapenem. The SIM family of beta-lactamases appear to be transferable through integrons.
ARO:3004206.label: SIM beta-lactamase

ARO:3004207.definition: KHM beta-lactmases are Class B beta-lactamases that can confer resistance to all classes of beta-lactams, except the monobactams.
ARO:3004207.label: KHM beta-latamase

ARO:3004200.definition: CcrA beta-lactamases are chromosomal-encoded carbapenemase commonly found in Bacteroides fragilis isolates.
ARO:3004200.label: CcrA beta-lactamase

ARO:3000238.definition:
This inducible cluster confers resistance to vancomycin but organisms remain sensitive to teicoplanin by allowing restructuring of peptidoglycan precursors to end in D-Ala-D-Lac.  Sensitivity to teicoplanin is due to lack of binding to the sensor kinase VanS. The vanB gene cluster can be located either on plasmids or on the chromosome.

Gene orientation: vanRSYWHBX
ARO:3000238.label: glycopeptide resistance gene cluster VanB

ARO:3004202.definition: JOHN beta-lactamases hydrolyse penicillins, narrow- and expanded-spectrum cephalosporins, and carbapenems.
ARO:3004202.label: JOHN beta-lactamase

ARO:3004203.definition: CGB beta-lactamases are Class B beta-lactamases found in Chryseobacterium gleu that can hydrolyze penicillins; narrow- and expanded-spectrum cephalosporins; and carbapenems.
ARO:3004203.label: CGB beta-lactamase

ARO:3000235.definition: embB gene encodes for an arabinosyl transferase in the arabinogalactan synthesis pathway. It is inhibited by ethambutol. Mutations within the ERDR region of embB confers resistance to ethambutol.
ARO:3000235.label: ethambutol resistant embB

ARO:3000234.definition: Genes that when expressed confer resistance to vancomycin and teicoplanin type antibiotics.
ARO:3000234.label: glycopeptide resistance gene cluster

ARO:3000237.definition: TolC is a protein subunit of many multidrug efflux complexes in Gram negative bacteria. It is an outer membrane efflux protein and is constitutively open. Regulation of efflux activity is often at its periplasmic entrance by other components of the efflux complex.
ARO:3000237.label: TolC

ARO:3000236.definition:
This inducible cluster confers high resistance to both vancomycin and teicoplanin by allowing restructuring of peptidoglycan precursors to end in D-Ala-D-Lac. The vanA gene cluster can be located either on plasmids or on the chromosome.

Gene orientation: vanRSHAXYZ
ARO:3000236.label: glycopeptide resistance gene cluster VanA

ARO:3000231.definition: An operon conferring resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics.
ARO:3000231.label: beta-lactam resistance operon

ARO:3004209.definition: First identified from a multi-drug resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa clinical isolate in 2012, HMB type beta-lactamases can be encoded in transposons and hydrolyze carbapenems.
ARO:3004209.label: HMB beta-lactamase

ARO:3000233.definition: Resistance to streptogramin antibiotics may be conferred through enzymatic inactivation. There are two known mechanisms of streptogramin inactivation shown clinically to confer resistance: 1) vgB lyase enzymes linearize type B streptogramin antibiotics by breaking the ester linkage; 2) vat acetyltransferase enzymes modify type A streptogramin antibiotics by transferring an acetyl group from acetyl-CoA to the secondary streptogramin hydroxyl. Both mechanisms result in antibiotic inactivation thus conferring resistance.
ARO:3000233.label: streptogramin inactivation enzyme

ARO:3000232.definition: Nucleotidylylation of streptomycin at the hydroxyl group at position 3''
ARO:3000232.label: ANT(3'')-Ia

ARO:3004268.definition: A group of mobile colistin resistance genes encode the MCR family of phosphoethanolamine transferases, which catalyze the addition of phosphoethanolamine onto lipid A, thus interfering with the binding of colistin to the cell membrane.
ARO:3004268.label: MCR phosphoethanolamine transferase

ARO:3004269.definition: This family of phosphoethanolamine transferase catalyze the addition of 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (L-Ara4N) and phosphoethanolamine to lipid A, which impedes the binding of colistin to the cell membrane.
ARO:3004269.label: pmr phosphoethanolamine transferase

ARO:3003769.definition: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. A point mutation in the putative mprF synthase domain is associated with enhanced expression, increased synthesis and reduced daptomycin surface binding. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.
ARO:3003769.label: Staphylococcus aureus mprF

ARO:3000829.definition: BaeS is a sensor kinase in the BaeSR regulatory system. While it phosphorylates BaeR to increase its activity, BaeS is not necessary for overexpressed BaeR to confer resistance.
ARO:3000829.label: baeS

ARO:0010000.definition: Antibiotic resistance via the transport of antibiotics out of the cell.
ARO:0010000.label: antibiotic efflux

ARO:0010001.definition: Directed pumping of antibiotic out of a cell to confer resistance. ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporters are present in all cells of all organisms and use the energy of ATP binding/hydrolysis to transport substrates across cell membranes.
ARO:0010001.label: ATP-binding cassette (ABC) antibiotic efflux pump

ARO:0010002.definition: Directed pumping of antibiotic out of a cell to confer resistance. Major facilitator superfamily (MFS) transporters and ABC transporters comprise the two largest and most functionally diverse of the transporter superfamilies. However, MFS transporters are distinct from ABC transporters in both their primary sequence and structure and in the mechanism of energy coupling. As secondary transporters they are, like RND and SMR transporters, energized by the electrochemical proton gradient.
ARO:0010002.label: major facilitator superfamily (MFS) antibiotic efflux pump

ARO:0010003.definition: Directed pumping of antibiotic out of a cell to confer resistance. Small multidrug resistance (SMR) proteins are a relatively small family of transporters, restricted to prokaryotic cells. They are also the smallest multidrug transporters, with only four transmembrane alpha-helices and no significant extramembrane domain.
ARO:0010003.label: small multidrug resistance (SMR) antibiotic efflux pump

ARO:0010004.definition: Directed pumping of antibiotic out of a cell to confer resistance. Resistance-nodulation-division (RND) proteins are found in both prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells and have diverse substrate specificities and physiological roles. However, there are relatively few RND transporters and they are secondary transporters, energized not by ATP binding/hydrolysis but by proton movement down the transmembrane electrochemical gradient.
ARO:0010004.label: resistance-nodulation-cell division (RND) antibiotic efflux pump

ARO:3004338.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3004338.label: PDC-75

ARO:3004339.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3004339.label: PDC-76

ARO:3004330.definition: Any Enterococcus faecium or Enterococcus faecalis that has tested non-susceptible (NS) to daptomycin
ARO:3004330.label: daptomycin-resistant Enterococcus

ARO:3004331.definition: Coagulase-Negative Staphylococci that has tested resistant(R) or intermediate(I) to vancomycin
ARO:3004331.label: vancomycin-resistant coagulase-negative Staphylococci

ARO:3004332.definition: MCR-5 is a transposon-associated phosphoethanolamine transferase gene, identified in Salmonella Paratyphi B dTa+ (d-tartrate fermenting Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Paratyphi B) isolates from food-producing animals. The isolates were collected between 2011 and 2013, and retrieved from the German National Reference Laboratory for Salmonella. MCR-5 confers resistance to collistin through the addition of a phosphoethanolamine group to lipid A, causing a reduction in negative charge of the cell membrane. Described by Borowiak et al, 2017.
ARO:3004332.label: MCR-5

ARO:3004333.definition: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Point mutations in gyrA have been shown to decrease susceptibility to the antibiotic triclosan. Although the mechanism is unclear, it is hypothesized that changes in supercoiling activity of mutant DNA gyrase proteins alters expression of stress response pathways thereby indirectly decreasing triclosan susceptibility. It has been shown that triclosan does not interact directly with gyrA.
ARO:3004333.label: triclosan resistant gyrA

ARO:3004334.definition: Point mutations in Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium which have been shown to increase the minimum inhibitory concentration of the antibiotic triclosan. It is hypothesized that decreased susceptibility to triclosan in Salmonella gyrA mutants occurs indirectly due to alterations in the stress response pathways.
ARO:3004334.label: Salmonella enterica gyrA with mutation conferring resistance to triclosan

ARO:3004335.definition: Point mutations in Escherichia coli which have been shown to increase the minimum inhibitory concentration of the antibiotic triclosan. It is hypothesized that decreased susceptibility to triclosan in E. coli gyrA mutants occurs indirectly due to alterations in the stress response pathways.
ARO:3004335.label: Escherichia coli gyrA with mutation conferring resistance to triclosan

ARO:3004336.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3004336.label: PDC-73

ARO:3004337.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3004337.label: PDC-74

ARO:3001960.definition: CTX-M-101 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001960.label: CTX-M-101

ARO:3003231.definition: Precursor molecule during the synthesis of bacterial cell wall. Lipid II anchors itself onto the cell and it's disaccharide-peptide subunit is used in PG polymer assembly by peptidoglycan glycosyltransferases. Due to it's importance in cell wall synthesis, it is the target of antibiotics.
ARO:3003231.label: Lipid II

ARO:3000825.definition: robA is a positive regulator for the acrAB efflux genes, and is structurally similar to SoxS and MarA.
ARO:3000825.label: rob

ARO:3002879.definition: linG is an integron-associated gene cassette, with aadA2, encoding a lincosomide nucleotidyltransferase found in Salmonella enterica. linG confers resistance to lincosomide antibiotics.
ARO:3002879.label: linG

ARO:3002878.definition: Bacillus cereus beta-lactamase II is a zinc metallo-beta-lactamase that hydrolyzes a large number of penicillins and cephalosporins in the Bacillus cereus strain 5/B/6
ARO:3002878.label: BcII

ARO:3002871.definition: tet37 is a chromosome-encoded oxidoreductase isolated from an uncultured bacterium that confers resistance to tetracycline
ARO:3002871.label: tet37

ARO:3002870.definition: tet34 causes the activation of Mg2+-dependent purine nucleotide synthesis, which protects the protein synthesis pathway. It is found in Gram-negative Vibrio
ARO:3002870.label: tet34

ARO:3002873.definition: A thiol transferase that leads to the resistance of fosfomycin in Enterococcus faecium. Contrasting FosA, FosB is dependent on the cofactor Magnesium (II) and uses either bacillithiol to open up the epoxide ring of fosfomycin.
ARO:3002873.label: FosB3

ARO:3002872.definition: An enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule. It depends on the cofactors Manganese (II) and Potassium and uses Glutathione (GSH) as the nucleophilic molecule.
ARO:3002872.label: FosA3

ARO:3002875.definition: dfrE is a chromosome-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Enterococcus faecalis
ARO:3002875.label: dfrE

ARO:3002874.definition: FosC2 is an enzyme that phosphorylates fosfomycin to confer resistance in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002874.label: FosC2

ARO:3002877.definition: Bacillus cereus beta-lactamase I is a zinc metallo-beta-lactamase that hydrolyzes a large number of penicillins and cephalosporins in the Bacillus cereus strain 569/H/9
ARO:3002877.label: BcI

ARO:3002876.definition: Arabinosyl transferases allow for the polymerization of arabinose to form arabinan. Arabinan is required for formation of mycobacterial cell walls and arabinosyltransferases are targets of the drug ethambutol. Mutations in these genes can confer resistance to ethambutol.
ARO:3002876.label: ethambutol resistant arabinosyltransferase

ARO:3004055.definition: The Escherichia coli CpxR/CpxA system responds to general periplasmic stress and has been used as a model two-component system for transcription regulation in bacteria. CpxR/CpxA system facilitates Salmonella and E. coli resistance to cationic antimicrobial peptides.The CpxR/CpxA system can activate transcription of marRAB operon, thus facilitating multidrug-resistant regulator to enhance expression of TolC-dependent tripartite multidrug transporters.
ARO:3004055.label: Escherichia coli CpxR

ARO:3004054.definition: CpxR is directly involved in activation of expression of RND efflux pump MexAB-OprM in P. aeruginosa. CpxR is required to enhance mexAB-oprM expression and drug resistance, in the absence of repressor MexR.
ARO:3004054.label: Pseudomonas aeruginosa CpxR

ARO:3004057.definition: Point mutations in the 23S rRNA subunit may confer resistance to linezolid and other oxazolidinone antibiotics.
ARO:3004057.label: 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to linezolid antibiotics

ARO:3004056.definition: ArmR, a 53-amino-acid antirepressor, allosterically inhibits MexR dimer-DNA binding by occupying a hydrophobic binding cavity within the center of the MexR dimer. ArmR up-regulation and MexR-ArmR complex formation have previously been shown to upregulate MexAB-OprM.
ARO:3004056.label: ArmR

ARO:3004051.definition: MexAB-OprM efflux pump system with NalC mutations conferring resistance to aztreonam. While efflux gene hyperexpression typically results from mutations in the linked mexR repressor gene, it also occurs independently of mexR mutations in so-called nalC mutants that demonstrate more modest mexAB-oprM expression and, thus, more modest multidrug resistance than do mexR strains.
ARO:3004051.label: MexAB-OprM with NalC mutations conferring resistance to aztreonam

ARO:3004050.definition: fabG is a bacterial 3-oxoacyl enoyl-acyl carrier reductase (ENR) isozyme. As with other ENRs, mutations in fabG are shown to confer resistance to the biocide triclosan.
ARO:3004050.label: antibiotic sensitive fabG

ARO:3004053.definition: CpxR is directly involved in activation of expression of RND efflux pump MexAB-OprM in P. aeruginosa. CpxR is required to enhance mexAB-oprM expression and drug resistance, in the absence of repressor MexR.
ARO:3004053.label: MexAB-OprM with CpxR regulator conferring resistance to ciprofloxacin, ceftazidime, and aztreonam

ARO:3004052.definition: MexAB-OprM efflux pump system with a NalD mutation conferring resistance to multiple antibiotics. This NalD mutation was found in multidrug-resistant clinical strains lacking mutations in MexR or NalC.
ARO:3004052.label: MexAB-OprM with NalD mutations conferring resistance to multiple antibiotics

ARO:3004059.definition: Type A NfxB mutants are four to eight times more resistant to ofloxacin, erythromycin, and new zwitterionic cephems, i.e., cefpirome, cefclidin, cefozopran, and cefoselis, than the parent strain, PAO1. nfxB corresponds to 2 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (gene name: esrC/nfxB) and 2 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58 (gene name: nfxB).
ARO:3004059.label: Type A NfxB

ARO:3004058.definition: Point mutations in the 23S rRNA subunit of the large ribosomal bacterial subunit in Staphylococcus aureus, which confer resistance to linezolid by disrupting antibiotic target binding
ARO:3004058.label: Staphylococcus aureus 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to linezolid

ARO:3002916.definition: vanV is an accessory protein of van operons, first identified in the vanB operon. It is not required for vancomycin resistance.
ARO:3002916.label: vanV

ARO:3002917.definition: Homologous to vanC, contains a D-Ala-D-Ser ligase. The plasmid-located vanM gene cluster is inducible and confers low resistance to vancomycin. vanN organisms remain susceptible to teicoplanin. Gene orientation: N(XY)TRS
ARO:3002917.label: glycopeptide resistance gene cluster VanN

ARO:3000071.definition: VanS is similar to histidine protein kinases like EnvZ and acts as a response regulator by activating VanR. VanS is required for high level transcription of other van glycopeptide resistance genes.
ARO:3000071.label: vanS

ARO:3002915.definition: VanK is a member of the Fem family of enzymes that add the cross-bridge amino acids to the stem pentapeptide of cell wall precursors in Streptomyces coelicolor that confers inducible, high-level vancomycin resistance
ARO:3002915.label: vanK

ARO:3002912.definition: VanN is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Ser, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity in Enterococcus faecium
ARO:3002912.label: vanN

ARO:3002913.definition: VanO is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Lac, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity. It is associated with both vancomycin and teicoplanin resistance.
ARO:3002913.label: vanO

ARO:3002910.definition: VanL is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Ser, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity in Enterococcus faecalis
ARO:3002910.label: vanL

ARO:3002911.definition: VanM is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that can synthesize D-Ala-D-Lac, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity. It is associated with both vancomycin and teicoplanin resistance.
ARO:3002911.label: vanM

ARO:3002918.definition: Homologous to vanA, contains a D-Ala-D-Lac ligase. The chromosome-located vanO gene cluster is inducible. Not much is known about the biochemistry about the vanO gene cluster. Gene orientation: orf1 RS orf2 HOX
ARO:3002918.label: glycopeptide resistance gene cluster VanO

ARO:3002919.definition: vanRA, also known as vanR, is a vanR variant found in the vanA gene cluster

ARO:3000820.definition: NfxB is a repressor of the efflux pump mexCD-oprJ and itself (NfxB binds upstream of the nfxB gene and negatively regulates its own expression). Increased expression of MexCD–OprJ brought about by mutations in NfxB.
ARO:3000820.label: NfxB

ARO:3000821.definition: PhoPQ is a two-component regulatory system. phoP is phosphorylated by phoQ at a low [mg2+], activating the repressor. Its part of a two component regulating system that activates the PmrA/B system which has downstream effects, leading to Antimicrobial resistance in many pathogens. In Salmonella, phoP bind to macAB ABC transporter and represses it. In Escherichia coli, phoPQ regulates arnA expression. In Pseudomonas aeruginosa, phoPQ regulates OprH expression. phoPQ have other roles in other species.
ARO:3000821.label: phoPQ

ARO:3000822.definition: PmrA is a MFS-type efflux pump expressed in Streptococcus pneumoniae that confers low-level resistance to norfloxacin, ciprofloxacin, and acriflavine.
ARO:3000822.label: pmrA

ARO:3000823.definition: RamA ("resistance antibiotic multiple") is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae, Salmonella enterica, and Enterobacter aerugenes, increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.
ARO:3000823.label: ramA

ARO:3000824.definition: RamR is a repressor that regulates RamA expression. Mutations lead to the upregulation of AcrAB, which is positively regulated by RamA.
ARO:3000824.label: ramR

ARO:3002961.definition: vanYM is a vanY variant found in the vanM gene cluster

ARO:3000826.label: sdiA

ARO:3000827.definition: SoxRS is a two-component regulator part of the superoxide stress response. It is a positive regulator for many multidrug efflux pumps.

ARO:3001242.definition: Enacyloxin IIa is structurally distinct but acts in a similar mechanism to kirromycin-like elfamycins. It prohibits the transfer of the amino acid at the A site to the elongating peptide chain. It is most likely that the mechanism of action is that EF-Tu*GDP is locked in the EF-Tu*GTP form, and EF-Tu*GDP*aa-tRNA is immobilized on the ribosome. It is an open question whether enacyloxin IIa actually belongs to the kirromycin-like group of elfamycins due to their high similarity.

ARO:3000410.definition: Sul1 is a sulfonamide resistant dihydropteroate synthase of Gram-negative bacteria. It is linked to other resistance genes of class 1 integrons.
ARO:3000410.label: sul1

ARO:3000684.definition: Mafenide is a sulfonamide used topically for treating burns.
ARO:3000684.label: mafenide

ARO:3000685.definition: Arylomycins are lipopeptide antibiotics, sharing a lipohexapeptide with a C-terminal tripeptide macrolide and varying by the length of its alkyl chains.
ARO:3000685.label: arylomycin

ARO:3000686.definition: Thiostrepton is a cyclic peptide active against Gram-positive bacteria. It is produced by streptomyces bacteria.
ARO:3000686.label: thiostrepton

ARO:3000687.definition: Moemomycin antibiotics are phosphoglycolipids that contain a 3-phosphoglyceric acid, often used as a mixture. They inhibit petidoglycan glycosyltransferases to prevent bacterial cell wall biosynthesis.
ARO:3000687.label: moenomycin

ARO:3000680.definition: Patricin A is a streptogramin B antibiotic.
ARO:3000680.label: patricin A

ARO:3000681.definition: Patricin B is a streptogramin B antibiotic.
ARO:3000681.label: patricin B

ARO:3000682.definition: Ostreogrycin B3 is a derivative of pristinamycin IA, with an additional 3-hydroxy group on its 4-oxopipecolic acid.
ARO:3000682.label: ostreogrycin B3

ARO:3000683.definition: Sulfacetamide is a very soluable sulfonamide antibiotic previously used to treat urinary tract infections. Its relatively low activity and toxicity to those with Stevens-Johnson syndrome have reduced its use and availability.
ARO:3000683.label: sulfacetamide

ARO:3002440.definition: OKP-B-7 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002440.label: OKP-B-7

ARO:3000688.definition: Furazolidone is a nitrofuran antibiotic that is a non-ionic synthetic compound. It is taken orally and is active against many enteric pathogens. Furazolidone also has antiprotozoal activity and acts by inhibiting monoamine oxidase.
ARO:3000688.label: furazolidone

ARO:3000689.definition: Metronidazole is a nitroimidazole that is active against anaerobic bacteria and protozoa. It is not effective against aerobic bacteria. Nitroimidazoles act by oxidizing DNA causing strand breaks and cell death.
ARO:3000689.label: metronidazole

ARO:3002008.definition: CTX-M-151 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002008.label: CTX-M-151

ARO:3003313.definition: ParE is a subunit of topoisomerase IV, necessary for cell survival. Point mutations in ParE prevent fluoroquinolones from inhibiting DNA synthesis, thus conferring resistance.
ARO:3003313.label: fluoroquinolone resistant parE

ARO:3003312.definition: Point mutation in Staphylococcus aureus parC resulting in fluoroquinolone resistance
ARO:3003312.label: Staphylococcus aureus parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

ARO:3003311.definition: Point mutation in Streptococcus pneumoniae parC resulting in fluoroquinolone resistance
ARO:3003311.label: Streptococcus pneumoniae parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

ARO:3003310.label: Mycoplasma hominis parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

ARO:3003317.definition: Point mutation in Salmonella serovars parE resulting in fluoroquinolones resistance
ARO:3003317.label: Salmonella serovars parE conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3003316.definition: Point mutation in Escherichia coli parE resulting in fluoroquinolones resistance
ARO:3003316.label: Escherichia coli parE conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3003315.definition: Point mutation in Staphylococcus aureus parE resulting in fluoroquinolones resistance
ARO:3003315.label: Staphylococcus aureus parE conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3003314.definition: Point mutation in Staphylococcus aureus parE resulting in aminocoumarin resistance. Please note: the reference sequence associated with this model corresponds to Staphylococcus aureus MRSA parE, while the SNPs correspond to Staphylococcus aureus RN4220 (for which a complete annotated genome does not exist in genbank at present).
ARO:3003314.label: Staphylococcus aureus parE conferring resistance to aminocoumarin

ARO:3003319.definition: Point mutations that occur within Staphylococcus aureus mprF gene resulting in resistance to daptomycin
ARO:3003319.label: Staphylococcus aureus mprF with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin

ARO:3003318.definition: point mutation on the Streptomyces rishiriensis parY resulting in aminocoumarin resistance
ARO:3003318.label: Streptomyces rishiriensis parY mutant conferring resistance to aminocoumarin

ARO:3003529.definition: Sensitive form of 16s susceptable to antibiotics
ARO:3003529.label: Antibiotic sensitive Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium 16S rRNA

ARO:3001805.label: OXA-198

ARO:3001804.definition: OXA-145 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3001804.label: OXA-145

ARO:3001807.label: OXA-246

ARO:3001806.definition: OXA-224 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3001806.label: OXA-224

ARO:3001801.definition: OXA-147 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3001801.label: OXA-147

ARO:3001800.label: OXA-226

ARO:3001803.label: OXA-142

ARO:3001802.definition: OXA-141 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3001802.label: OXA-141

ARO:3000536.definition: Novobiocin is produced from biosynthetic clusters in Streptomyces spheroides and Streptomyces niveus.
ARO:3000536.label: Streptomyces spheroides novobiocin biosynthetic gene cluster

ARO:3000534.definition: Rifapentine is a semisynthetic rifamycin that inhibits DNA-dependent RNA synthesis. It is often used in the treatment of tuberculosis and leprosy.
ARO:3000534.label: rifapentine

ARO:3000535.definition: MacB is an ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter that exports macrolides with 14- or 15- membered lactones. It forms an antibiotic efflux complex with MacA and TolC. macB corresponds to 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 and 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
ARO:3000535.label: macB

ARO:3001809.definition: OXA-209 is a beta-lactamase found in Riemerella anatipestifer
ARO:3001809.label: OXA-209

ARO:3001808.definition: OXA-60 is a beta-lactamase found in Ralstonia pickettii
ARO:3001808.label: OXA-60

ARO:3000530.definition: Rifabutin is a semisynthetic rifamycin used in tuberculosis therapy. It inhibits DNA-dependent RNA synthesis.
ARO:3000530.label: rifabutin

ARO:3000531.definition: BaeSR is a two component regulatory system for efflux proteins in Gram-negative bacteria. BaeR is a response regulator, while BaeS is a sensor kinase.
ARO:3000531.label: baeSR

ARO:3000794.definition: MdtC is a transporter that forms a heteromultimer complex with MdtB to form a multidrug transporter. MdtBC is part of the MdtABC-TolC efflux complex. In the absence of MdtB, MdtC can form a homomultimer complex that results in a functioning efflux complex with a narrower drug specificity. mdtC corresponds to 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (gene name: muxC/muxB) and 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
ARO:3000794.label: mdtC

ARO:3002442.definition: OKP-B-9 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002442.label: OKP-B-9

ARO:3000795.definition: MdtE is the membrane fusion protein of the MdtEF multidrug efflux complex. It shares 70% sequence similarity with AcrA.
ARO:3000795.label: mdtE

ARO:0000045.definition: Acriflavin is a topical antiseptic. It has the form of an orange or brown powder. It may be harmful in the eyes or if inhaled. Acriflavine is also used as treatment for external fungal infections of aquarium fish.
ARO:0000045.label: acriflavin

ARO:0000044.definition: Cephamycins are a group of beta-lactam antibiotics, very similar to cephalosporins. Together with cephalosporins, they form a sub-group of antibiotics known as cephems. Cephamycins are bactericidal, and act by inhibiting the synthesis of the peptidoglycan layer of bacterial cell walls. The peptidoglycan layer is important for cell wall structural integrity, especially in Gram-positive organisms. The 7-alpha-methoxy group increases resistance to beta-lactamases.
ARO:0000044.label: cephamycin

ARO:0000047.definition: Puromycin is an aminonucleoside antibiotic, derived from Streptomyces alboniger, that causes premature chain termination during ribosomal protein translation.
ARO:0000047.label: puromycin

ARO:0000046.definition: Lincomycin is a lincosamide antibiotic that comes from the actinomyces Streptomyces lincolnensis. It binds to the 23s portion of the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes and inhibit early elongation of peptide chain by inhibiting transpeptidase reaction.
ARO:0000046.label: lincomycin

ARO:0000041.definition: Bacitracin is a mixture of related cyclic polypeptides produced by organisms of the licheniformis group of Bacillus subtilis var Tracy. Bacitracin interferes with the dephosphorylation of the C55-isoprenyl pyrophosphate, a molecule which carries the building blocks of the peptidoglycan bacterial cell wall outside of the inner membrane.
ARO:0000041.label: bacitracin

ARO:0000040.synonyms: streptomycin A;streptomycin sulphate;streptomycin sulfate;streptomycin A sulfate
ARO:0000040.definition: Streptomycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Streptomycin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.
ARO:0000040.label: streptomycin

ARO:0000043.definition: Carbenicillin is a semi-synthetic antibiotic belonging to the carboxypenicillin subgroup of the penicillins. It has gram-negative coverage which includes Pseudomonas aeruginosa but limited gram-positive coverage. The carboxypenicillins are susceptible to degradation by beta-lactamase enzymes. Carbenicillin antibiotics are bactericidal, and act by inhibiting the synthesis of the peptidoglycan layer of bacterial cell walls. The peptidoglycan layer is important for cell wall structural integrity, especially in Gram-positive organisms.
ARO:0000043.label: carbenicillin

ARO:0000042.definition: Glycylcyclines are a new class of antibiotics derived from tetracycline. These tetracycline analogues are specifically designed to overcome two common mechanisms of tetracycline resistance. Presently, there is only one glycylcycline antibiotic for clinical use: tigecycline. It works by inhibiting action of the prokaryotic 30S ribosome, preventing the binding of aminoacyl-tRNA.
ARO:0000042.label: glycylcycline

ARO:0000049.definition: Kanamycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Kanamycin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.
ARO:0000049.label: kanamycin A

ARO:3000798.definition: MexEF-OprN is a multidrug efflux protein expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexE is the membrane fusion protein; MexF is the inner membrane transporter; and OprN is the outer membrane channel. MexEF-OprN is associated with resistance to fluoroquinolones, chloramphenicol, and trimethoprim. Regulation of mexEF-oprN operon expression is multifaceted with the MexT activator being one of the most prominent regulatory proteins. MexEF-OprN is the only positively regulated RND pump of P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3000798.label: MexEF-OprN

ARO:3000799.definition: MexGHI-OpmD is an efflux complex expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexG is a membrane protein required for drug export; MexH is the membrane fusion protein; MexI is the inner membrane transporter; and MexJ is the outer membrane channel protein. MexGHI-OpmD confers resistance to vanadium, norfloxacin, and acriflavin.
ARO:3000799.label: MexGHI-OpmD

ARO:3004239.definition: NPS-1 is a plasmid-encoded class D beta-lactamases identified from two Pseudomonas aeruginosa isolates in 1986.
ARO:3004239.label: NPS-1

ARO:3004238.definition: The sul genes encode forms of dihydropteroate synthase that confer resistance to sulfonamide.
ARO:3004238.label: sulfonamide resistant sul

ARO:3004231.definition: Beta-lactamases that are part of the LRA gene family and are classified as Class C beta-lactamases.
ARO:3004231.label: class C LRA beta-lactamase

ARO:3004230.definition: Beta-lactamases belonging to the Bla genes from Bacillus anthracis that are classified as subclass B1 beta-lactamases.
ARO:3004230.label: subclass B1 Bacillus anthracis Bla beta-lactamase

ARO:3004233.definition: Class A Beta-lactamases first isolated from Mycobacterium fortuitum.
ARO:3004233.label: blaF family beta-lactamase

ARO:3004232.definition: AmpC beta-lactamases are clinically important class C beta-lactamase enzymes which confer resistance to cephalosporins and penicillin-like antibiotics. AmpC beta-lactamases are typically found in Enterobacteriaceae, and were described in Escherichia coli in 1940 as the first reported enzymatic deactivation of penicillin. The name AmpC connects these enzymes functionally across many species, however these enzymes are generally unnamed and not phylogenetically related.
ARO:3004232.label: ampC-type beta-lactamase

ARO:3004235.definition: A family of class A beta-lactamases that have been discovered in the Rhodobacter genus.
ARO:3004235.label: RCP beta-lactamase

ARO:3004234.definition: Beta-lactamases part of this family discovered in Streptomyces albus G.
ARO:3004234.label: EXO beta-lactamase

ARO:3004237.definition: The mgt family encompasses macrolide glycotransferases of the Streptomyces genus.
ARO:3004237.label: mgt macrolide glycotransferase

ARO:3004236.definition: This family of macrolide glycosyltransferases derive from gimA, which was discovered in Streptomyces ambofaciens.
ARO:3004236.label: gimA family macrolide glycosyltransferase

ARO:3000222.definition: Gramicidin A is the most abundant (more than 80%) of the three gramicidins in gramicidin D, with a tryptophan in position 11. Gramicidins form dimers in the bacterial membrane that increase the permeability of cations.
ARO:3000222.label: gramicidin A

ARO:3000223.definition: Gramicidin B is one of the three gramicidins in gramicidin D, with a phenylalanine in position 11. It is structurally similar to gramicidin A, but its ability to induce the assembly of bilayers is reduced. Gramicidins form dimers in the bacterial membrane that increase the permeability of cations.
ARO:3000223.label: gramicidin B

ARO:3000220.definition: Point mutations in gyrB confer antibiotic resistance by preventing drugs from binding the beta-subunit of gyrase, essential for DNA supercoiling.
ARO:3000220.label: antibiotic resistant DNA topoisomerase subunit gyrB

ARO:3000221.definition: Resistance to the lincosamide antibiotic by ATP-dependent modification of the 3' and/or 4'-hydroxyl groups of the methylthiolincosamide sugar.
ARO:3000221.label: lincosamide nucleotidyltransferase (LNU)

ARO:3000226.definition: Point mutations in dihydropteroate synthase folP prevent sulfonamide antibiotics from inhibiting its role in folate synthesis, thus conferring sulfonamide resistance.
ARO:3000226.label: antibiotic resistant folP

ARO:3000227.definition: Tyrothricin is a mixture of antibiotics including tyrocidines and gramicidins, isolated from Bacillus brevis.
ARO:3000227.label: tyrothricin

ARO:3000224.definition: Gramicidin C is one of the three gramicidins in gramicidin D, with a tyrosine in position 11. It is structurally similar to gramicidin A, but its ability to induce the assembly of bilayers is reduced. Gramicidins form dimers in the bacterial membrane that increase the permeability of cations.
ARO:3000224.label: gramicidin C

ARO:3000225.definition: Nucelotidylylation of streptomycin at the hydroxyl group at position 6
ARO:3000225.label: ANT(6)

ARO:3000228.definition: Nucleotidylylation of spectinomycin at the hydroxyl group at position 9
ARO:3000228.label: ANT(9)

ARO:3000229.definition: Nucleotidylylation of 2-deoxystreptamine aminoglycosides at the hydroxyl group at position 4'
ARO:3000229.label: ANT(4')

ARO:3001792.definition: OXA-62 is a beta-lactamase found in Pandoraea pnomenusa
ARO:3001792.label: OXA-62

ARO:3002762.definition: QnrB47 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002762.label: QnrB47

ARO:3004150.definition: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Escherichia coli shown clinically to confer resistance to chloramphenicol
ARO:3004150.label: Escherichia coli 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to chloramphenicol

ARO:3002445.definition: OKP-B-12 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002445.label: OKP-B-12

ARO:3003201.definition: The TLA beta-lactamases are resistant to expanded-spectrum cephalosporins, aztreonam, ciprofloxacin, and ofloxacin but was susceptible to amikacin, cefotetan, and imipenem.
ARO:3003201.label: TLA beta-lactamase

ARO:3003988.definition: AAC(2')-IIb is an intrinsic Kasugamycin 2' acetyltransferase protein found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to aminoglycoside antibiotics, including kasugamycin. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003988.label: AAC(2')-IIb

ARO:3000329.definition: Sulfamethoxazole is a sulfonamide antibiotic usually taken with trimethoprim, a diaminopyrimidine antibiotic. Sulfamethoxazole inhibits dihydropteroate synthase, essential to tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthesis. This pathway generates compounds used in the synthesis of many amino acids and nucleotides.
ARO:3000329.label: sulfamethoxazole

ARO:3000328.definition: Single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in rRNA can confer antibiotic resistance to drugs that target the bacterial ribosome.
ARO:3000328.label: rRNA with mutation conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3000327.definition: Sulfadoxine is an inhibitor of dihydropteroate synthase, interfering with the tetrahydrofolic biosynthesis pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor to many nucleotides and amino acids.
ARO:3000327.label: sulfadoxine

ARO:3000326.definition: ErmE is a methyltransferase found in the erythromycin producer Saccharopolyspora erythraea. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the erythromycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.
ARO:3000326.label: ErmE

ARO:3000325.definition: Sulfadimidine is an alkaline sulfonamide antibiotic that inhibits dihydropteroate synthase, and enzyme in the tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthesis pathway. This interferes with the production of folate, which is a precursor to many amino acids and nucleotides.
ARO:3000325.label: sulfadimidine

ARO:3000324.definition: Sulfadiazine is a potent inhibitor of dihydropteroate synthase, interfering with the tetrahydrofolic biosynthesis pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor to many nucleotides and amino acids.
ARO:3000324.label: sulfadiazine

ARO:3000322.definition: Acetylation of the aminoglycoside antibiotic on the amino group at position 3.
ARO:3000322.label: AAC(3)

ARO:3000321.definition: Hydrolysis of the the macrocycle lactone ring of macrolide antibiotics.
ARO:3000321.label: hydrolysis of macrolide macrocycle lactone ring

ARO:3000320.definition: Hydrolytic enzymes that cleave the macrocycle lactone ring of macrolide antibiotics.
ARO:3000320.label: macrolide esterase

ARO:3004423.definition: Around equal to 5 x 105 cfu/mL for broth dilution and 104 cfu/mL for agar dilution.
ARO:3004423.label: = standard inoculum

ARO:3004309.definition: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus that has additionally tested intermediate to vancomycin antibiotics.
ARO:3004309.label: Vancomycin-intermediate MRSA

ARO:3004308.definition: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus that has additionally tested resistant to the fluoroquinolone antibiotics ciprofloxacin and/or levofloxacin
ARO:3004308.label: Fluoroquinolone-resistant MRSA

ARO:3004305.definition: Multidrug-resistant organisms are defined as bacterial strains that have become resistant to multiple classes of antibacterial drugs or other agents. The phenotype of these organisms is defined by the spectrum of antibiotic drug classes to which that organism is resistant. Often, these organisms are susceptible to a narrow range of available drugs, making treatment difficult and urgent.
ARO:3004305.label: multidrug resistance antimicrobial phenotype

ARO:3004304.definition: A bacterial strain is said to be susceptible-dose dependent (SDD) to a given antibiotic when growth is inhibited with a high likelihood of therapeutic success, but when multiple approved dosing options exist. When a higher or more frequent dose is used, the predicted therapeutic result is the same as for susceptible individuals.
ARO:3004304.label: susceptible dose dependent antimicrobial phenotype

ARO:3004307.definition: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus that has additionally tested resistant to the antibiotic drug linezolid
ARO:3004307.label: Linezolid-resistant MRSA

ARO:3004306.definition: Any strain of Staphylococcus aureus that has tested resistant (R) to at least one of methicillin, oxacillin or cefoxitin by standard susceptibility testing methods.
ARO:3004306.label: methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus

ARO:3004301.definition: A bacterial strain is said to be resistant to a given antibiotic when it is inhibited in vitro by a concentration of this drug that is associated with a high likelihood of therapeutic failure.
ARO:3004301.label: resistant antimicrobial phenotype

ARO:3004300.definition: Intermediate sensitivity of a bacterial strain to a given antibiotic occurs when it is inhibited by a concentration of the drug that is associated with uncertain therapeutic effect. The elimination of intermediate phenotype bacteria may depend on the site of infection and/or the concentration of the administered drug.
ARO:3004300.label: intermediate antimicrobial phenotype

ARO:3004303.definition: A bacterial strain is said to be nonsusceptible to a given antibiotic drug if it demonstrates either an intermediate or resistant phenotype when exposed to a concentration of a drug that is associated with a high likelihood of therapeutic failure, i.e. if the bacterial strain is not susceptible to the antibiotic drug but not necessarily totally resistant under all conditions.
ARO:3004303.label: nonsusceptible antimicrobial phenotype

ARO:3003756.definition: nfsB encodes the minor oxygen-insesitive nitroreductase in E. coli. The first step of resistance to nitrofurazone is mutation of nfsA, while the increased resistance associated with second step mutants is a consequence of nfsB mutation.
ARO:3003756.label: Escherichia coli nfsB with mutation conferring resistance to nitrofurantoin

ARO:3003989.definition: AAC(6')-34 is an aminoglycoside 6'-phosphotransferase found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to aminoglycoside antibiotics. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003989.label: AAC(6')-34

ARO:3003207.definition: FosK is a fosfomycin thiol transferase isolated from Acinetobacter soli. It is integrin-mediated. It confers a high level of resistance to fosfomycin.
ARO:3003207.label: FosK

ARO:3003754.definition: The nfsA-encoded nitroreductase is the major oxygen-insensitive nitroreductase present in E. coli. NfsA uses only NADPH and has broad electron acceptor specificity. Mutations in nfsA cause resistance to nitrofurazone and furazolidone. Resistance to nitrofurantoin via mutation of nfsA reduces the fitness of clinical isolates of E. coli.
ARO:3003754.label: antibiotic resistant nfsA

ARO:3000980.definition: TEM-117 is a beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
ARO:3000980.label: TEM-117

ARO:3004173.definition: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Escherichia coli shown to confer resistance to oxazolidinone type antibiotics
ARO:3004173.label: Escherichia coli 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to oxazolidinone antibiotics

ARO:3004048.definition: MexAB-OprM efflux pump system with a prematurely terminated MexR confers resistance to meropenem and ciprofloxacin.
ARO:3004048.label: MexAB-OprM with prematurely terminated MexR conferring resistance to meropenem and ciprofloxacin

ARO:3004049.definition: fabG is a 3-oxoacyl-acyl carrier protein reductase involved in lipid metabolism and fatty acid biosynthesis.The bacterial biocide Triclosan blocks the final reduction step in fatty acid elongation, inhibiting biosynthesis. Point mutations in fabG can confer resistance to Triclosan.
ARO:3004049.label: Escherichia coli fabG mutations conferring resistance to triclosan

ARO:3002868.definition: dfrG is a plasmid-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Staphylococcus aureus
ARO:3002868.label: dfrG

ARO:3002869.definition: dfrK is a plasmid-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Staphylococcus aureus
ARO:3002869.label: dfrK

ARO:3004042.definition: AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB-TolC multidrug efflux system that in E. cloacae.
ARO:3004042.label: Enterobacter cloacae acrA

ARO:3004043.definition: AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB-TolC multidrug efflux system that in E. coli.
ARO:3004043.label: Escherichia coli acrA

ARO:3004040.definition: Enzymes, protein or other gene products that inactivate rifampin (rifamycin) antibiotics through phosphorylation of the antibiotic at the 21-OH position.
ARO:3004040.label: rifampin phosphotransferase

ARO:3004041.definition: AcrA is a subunit of the AcrAB multidrug efflux system that in K. pneumoniae, which is encoded by the acrRAB operon.
ARO:3004041.label: Klebsiella pneumoniae acrA

ARO:3004046.definition: kdpDE is a two-component regulatory system in Escherichia coli, well studied for its role in potassium transport and homeostasis. kdpE is also implicated in virulence loci regulation and overexpression of kdpE is shown to confer resistance to aminoglycoside antibiotics.
ARO:3004046.label: kdpDE

ARO:3004047.definition: kdpD is a component of the two-component regulatory system, kdpDE. This system is involved in potassium transport and homeostasis, and has been implicated in virulence factor regulation along with kdpE.
ARO:3004047.label: kdpD

ARO:3004044.definition: fabI is a bacterial enoyl-acyl carrier reductase (ENR) isozyme. As with other ENRs, mutations in fabI can confer resistance to the biocide triclosan.
ARO:3004044.label: antibiotic sensitive fabI

ARO:3002861.definition: dfrA5 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Vibrio cholerae
ARO:3002861.label: dfrA5

ARO:3001795.definition: OXA-56 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3001795.label: OXA-56

ARO:3004171.definition: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Streptomyces ambofaciens shown to confer resistance to macrolide type antibiotics
ARO:3004171.label: Streptomyces ambofaciens 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics

ARO:3000036.definition: Enzymes or other gene products which hydroxylate tetracycline and other tetracycline derivatives. Hydroxylation inactivates tetracycline-like antibiotics, thus conferring resistance to these compounds.
ARO:3000036.label: tetracycline inactivation enzyme

ARO:3000035.definition: Lipopeptide antibiotics are aliphatic, with their hydrophobic components interacting with the bacterial cell membrane.
ARO:3000035.label: lipopeptide antibiotic

ARO:3000034.definition: Nucleoside antibiotics are made of modified nucleosides and nucleotides with wide-ranging activities and means of antibacterial effects. This drug class includes aminonucleoside antibiotics, which contain an amino group.
ARO:3000034.label: nucleoside antibiotic

ARO:3001797.definition: OXA-46 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3001797.label: OXA-46

ARO:3003818.definition: Mutations in Acinetobacter baumannii parC that result in resistance to fluoroquinolones.
ARO:3003818.label: Acinetobacter baumannii parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

ARO:3001796.definition: OXA-50 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. It confers decreased susceptibility to ampicillin and ticarcillin and, interestingly, to moxalactam and meropenem in P. aeruginosa but not in E. coli. Also confers resistance to piperacillin-tazobactam and cephalotin.
ARO:3001796.label: OXA-50

ARO:3001063.definition: SHV-4 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
ARO:3001063.label: SHV-4

ARO:3002857.definition: dfrA26 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002857.label: dfrA26

ARO:3001061.definition: SHV-2A is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Enterobacter cloacae, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, and Salmonella enterica.
ARO:3001061.label: SHV-2A

ARO:3002856.definition: dfrA24 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002856.label: dfrA24

ARO:3001060.definition: SHV-2 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli., Klebsiella pneumoniae, and Shigella flexneri.
ARO:3001060.label: SHV-2

ARO:3002855.definition: dfrA2d is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Enterobacteriaceae
ARO:3002855.label: dfrA2d

ARO:3001140.definition: SHV-86 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
ARO:3001140.label: SHV-86

ARO:3004070.definition: A deletion of MvaT results in the overexpression of MexEF-OprN conferring resistance to chloramphenicol and norfloxacin.
ARO:3004070.label: MexEF-OprN with MvaT deletion conferring resistance to chloramphenicol and norfloxacin

ARO:3001141.definition: SHV-89 is a broad-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
ARO:3001141.label: SHV-89

ARO:3002853.definition: arr-8 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
ARO:3002853.label: arr-8

ARO:3001142.definition: SHV-90 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
ARO:3001142.label: SHV-90

ARO:3002852.definition: arr-7 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002852.label: arr-7

ARO:3001798.definition: OXA-74 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3001798.label: OXA-74

ARO:3001415.definition: OXA-20 is a beta-lactamase found in P. aeruginosa
ARO:3001415.label: OXA-20

ARO:3001328.definition: Multidrug efflux pump in E. coli. This multidrug efflux system was originally identified as the Cmr/CmlA chloramphenicol exporter.
ARO:3001328.label: Escherichia coli mdfA

ARO:3001329.definition: The MdtG protein, also named YceE, appears to be a member of the major facilitator superfamily of transporters, and it has been reported, when overexpressed, to increase fosfomycin and deoxycholate resistances. mdtG is a member of the marA-soxS-rob regulon.
ARO:3001329.label: mdtG

ARO:3001144.definition: SHV-92 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
ARO:3001144.label: SHV-92

ARO:3001326.definition: One of a small group of kirromycin-like elfamycins which lack the pyridone moiety. Ganefromycin is produced by Streptomyces lydicus spp. tanzanius, and was considered for use as a growth promoting antibiotic in agriculture.
ARO:3001326.label: ganefromycin

ARO:3001327.definition: A multidrug and toxic compound extrusions (MATE) transporter conferring resistance to norfloxacin, doxorubicin and acriflavine.
ARO:3001327.label: MdtK

ARO:3001320.definition: SB22484 antibiotics are of the same chemical group as kirromycins. SB22484 antibiotics are produced by Streptomyces sp. NRRL 15496. There are two SB22484 isomers with the same UV absorption spectra, but differing molecular masses. These antibiotics are strongly active against Neisseria species, but also show activity against Streptococci, and Haemophilus influenzae.
ARO:3001320.label: SB22484

ARO:3001321.definition: UK-69,753 is a glycosylated form of factumycin. The disaccharide moiety of UK-69,753 is virtually identical to that of efrotomycin, another member of this class of antibiotics. UK-69,753 has been shown to have strong in vitro and in vivo activity toward a swine pathogen, Treponema hyodysenteriae.
ARO:3001321.label: UK-69,753

ARO:3001322.definition: Phenelfamycin G is produced by Streptomyces albospinus strain Acta 3619. Phenelfamycin G and H are isomeric and similar to phenelfamycin E and F only with the addition of a hydroxyl group at position C-30. Phenelfamycin G and H have a narrow antibacterial spectrum with potent activity against Propionibacterium acnes.
ARO:3001322.label: phenelfamycin G

ARO:3001145.definition: SHV-93 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
ARO:3001145.label: SHV-93

ARO:3001410.definition: OXA-15 is a beta-lactamase found in P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3001410.label: OXA-15

ARO:3001411.definition: OXA-16 is a beta-lactamase found in P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3001411.label: OXA-16

ARO:3002773.definition: QnrB60 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Citrobacter freundii
ARO:3002773.label: QnrB60

ARO:3000756.definition: The P-site of the ribosome binds the peptidyl-tRNA with the growing polypeptide chain. Antibiotics that target the P-site block fMet-tRNA from entering, thus inhibiting peptide elongation.
ARO:3000756.label: 30S ribosomal subunit P-site

ARO:3000819.definition: NalD is a repressor of MexAB-OprM. Mutations lead to multidrug resistance and MexAB-OprM overexpression.
ARO:3000819.label: nalD

ARO:3000818.definition: NalC is a repressor of PA3720-PA3719, which are positive regulators of MexAB-OprM. Thus, nalC mutants confer multidrug resistance.
ARO:3000818.label: nalC

ARO:3000757.definition: The P-site of the ribosome binds the peptidyl-tRNA with the growing polypeptide chain, and is a common target for many antibiotics that inhibit the 50S ribosomal subunit. Some antibiotics (oxazolidinones) block the 50S subunit from interacting with the 30S subunit to prevent the formation of the ribosomal complex. Other antibiotics (thiostrepton) block the 50S subunit from interacting with elongation factors G and Tu (EF-G, Ef-Tu), preventing GTP-dependent reactions of peptidyl transferase, and translocation, respectively. Other antibiotics (macrolides) prevent protein translocation.
ARO:3000757.label: 50S ribosomal subunit P-site

ARO:3000815.definition: MgrA, also known as NorR, is a regulator for norA, norB, and tet38. It is a positive regulator for norA expression, but is a direct repressor for norB and an indirect repressor of tet38.
ARO:3000815.label: mgrA

ARO:3000814.definition: MexT is a LysR-type transcriptional activator that positively regulates the expression of MexEF-OprN, OprD, and MexS.
ARO:3000814.label: MexT

ARO:3000817.definition: MtrR is a repressor of mtrCDE expression. Mutations in mtrR increase multidrug resistance.
ARO:3000817.label: mtrR

ARO:3000816.definition: MtrA is a transcriptional activator of the MtrCDE multidrug efflux pump of Neisseria gonorrhoeae.
ARO:3000816.label: mtrA

ARO:3000811.definition: MtrD is the inner membrane multidrug transporter of the MtrCDE efflux complex.
ARO:3000811.label: mtrD

ARO:3000754.definition: The bacterial 23S rRNA, at the P site of the 50S subunit, has peptidyl transferase activity and is responsible for peptide synthesis and elongation.
ARO:3000754.label: antibiotic sensitive peptidyl transferase (23S rRNA)

ARO:3000813.definition: MexS is a suppressor of MexT, which is an activator of the multidrug pump MexEF-OprN. Mutations in MexS lead to multidrug resistance.
ARO:3000813.label: MexS

ARO:3000812.definition: MtrE is an outer membrane exporter protein that is part of the MtrCDE multidrug efflux complex.
ARO:3000812.label: mtrE

ARO:3002267.definition: IND-11 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002267.label: IND-11

ARO:3002858.definition: dfrA12 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Vibrio cholerae
ARO:3002858.label: dfrA12

ARO:3000753.definition: AbeM is an multidrug efflux pump found in Acinetobacter baumannii.
ARO:3000753.label: abeM

ARO:3001496.definition: OXA-234 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii
ARO:3001496.label: OXA-234

ARO:3001497.label: OXA-238

ARO:3002263.label: IND-7

ARO:3001498.label: OXA-239

ARO:3001499.label: OXA-240

ARO:3001250.definition: Phenelfamycin B was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin B has a monosaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin A. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile.
ARO:3001250.label: phenelfamycin B

ARO:3000617.definition: A foreign PBP2a acquired by lateral gene transfer that able to perform peptidoglycan synthesis in the presence of beta-lactams.
ARO:3000617.label: mecA

ARO:3001252.definition: Phenelfamycin D was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin D has a disaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin C. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile.
ARO:3001252.label: phenelfamycin D

ARO:3001253.definition: Phenelfamycin E was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin E has a trisaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin F. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile. Phenelfamycin E and F are the most potent of the phenelfamycins.
ARO:3001253.label: phenelfamycin E

ARO:3001256.definition: Phenelfamycin F was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Phenelfamycin F has a trisaccaride moeity and is isomeric with phenelfamycin E. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile. Phenelfamycin E and F are the most potent of the phenelfamycins.
ARO:3001256.label: phenelfamycin F

ARO:3002144.definition: DHA-13 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of DHA beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002144.label: DHA-13

ARO:3001258.definition: L-681217 is a kirromycin-like antibiotic produced by Streptomyces cattleya. Its biosynthetic gene cluster is characterized.

ARO:3001259.definition: GE37468 is a thiazolyl peptide produced by Streptomyces ATCC 55365. GE37468 is produced by post-transcription modification of a ribosomally synthesized preprotein, of which the biosynthetic gene cluster has been elucidated.
ARO:3001259.label: GE37468

ARO:3003797.definition: YybT has phosphodiesterase activity towards cyclic dinucleotides using a c-di-GMP hydrolyzing phosphodiesterase domain. Mutations to the gene confer resistance to daptomycin.
ARO:3003797.label: Enterococcus faecalis YybT with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance

ARO:3003788.label: Bacillus subtilis pgsA with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin
