ARO:3002764.definition: QnrB49 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Citrobacter freundii
ARO:3002764.label: QnrB49

ARO:3002659.definition: APH(6)-Ic is a transposon-encoded aminoglycoside phosphotransferase in S. enterica, P. aeruginosa and E. coli
ARO:3002659.label: APH(6)-Ic

ARO:3002658.definition: APH(6)-Ib is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside phosphotransferase in S. glaucescens
ARO:3002658.label: APH(6)-Ib

ARO:3004092.definition: Shotgun cloning of beta-lactam resistant P. aeruginosa NRZ-03096 yielded a clone producing a novel subclass B1 enzyme with only 74.3% identity to the next nearest relative, KHM-1. The novel MBL was named HMB-1 (for Hamburg MBL). HMB-1 gene was chromosomally located as part of a Tn 3 family transposon that was named Tn 6345, where expression of bla HMB-1 in E. coli TOP10 led to increased resistance to β-lactams.
ARO:3004092.label: HMB-1

ARO:3003232.definition: Lipid III is the precursor to the wall teichoic acid. It's inhibition leads to bacterial death as teichoic acid is required to anchor autolysins which control the hydrolysis of peptidoglycan cell wall.
ARO:3003232.label: Lipid III

ARO:3002039.definition: CMY-28 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002039.label: CMY-28

ARO:3004097.definition: CdsA is a phosphatidate cytidylyltransferase which plays a role in the production of membrane phosphatidylglycerol and cardiolipin.
ARO:3004097.label: Streptococcus mitis CdsA with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance

ARO:3000778.definition: AdeG is the inner membrane transporter of the AdeFGH multidrug efflux complex.
ARO:3000778.label: adeG

ARO:3002381.definition: SME-3 is a beta-lactamase found in Serratia marcescens
ARO:3002381.label: SME-3

ARO:3003090.definition: Daptomycin resistant RNA polymerases include amino acids substitutions which alter expression of the dlt operon, which increases the cell surface positive charge. Known from S. aureus.
ARO:3003090.label: daptomycin resistant beta-subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoB)

ARO:3000779.definition: AdeH is the outer membrane channel protein of the AdeFGH multidrug efflux complex.
ARO:3000779.label: adeH

ARO:3002439.definition: OKP-B-6 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002439.label: OKP-B-6

ARO:3003921.definition: oqxAB encodes for OqxAB, a plasmid-encoded efflux pump, which confer resistance to multiple agents including fluoroquinolones.
ARO:3003921.label: oqxAB

ARO:3003922.definition: RND efflux pump conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone
ARO:3003922.label: oqxA

ARO:3003923.definition: RND efflux pump conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone
ARO:3003923.label: oqxB

ARO:3003432.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to the antibiotic drug, isoniazid.
ARO:3003432.label: determinant of isoniazid resistance

ARO:3003433.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to the antibiotic drug pyrazinamide.
ARO:3003433.label: determinant of pyrazinamide resistance

ARO:3003430.definition: ParE is a subunit of topoisomerase IV, necessary for cell survival. Point mutations in ParE prevent fluoroquinolones from inhibiting DNA synthesis, thus conferring resistance.
ARO:3003430.label: fluoroquinolone sensitive parE

ARO:3002431.definition: OKP-A-14 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002431.label: OKP-A-14

ARO:3003929.definition: Point mutations in Neisseria gonorrhoeae parC protein that confer resistance to fluoroquinolone by reducing affinity to antibiotic binding site
ARO:3003929.label: Neisseria gonorrhoeae parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

ARO:3002433.definition: OKP-A-16 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002433.label: OKP-A-16

ARO:3002038.definition: CMY-27 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3002038.label: CMY-27

ARO:3002435.definition: OKP-B-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002435.label: OKP-B-2

ARO:3002434.definition: OKP-B-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002434.label: OKP-B-1

ARO:3002437.definition: OKP-B-4 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002437.label: OKP-B-4

ARO:3003439.definition: The switch region is a structural element that mediates conformational changes and contacts required for RNAP to load DNA into the RNAP active-center cleft during transcription initiation. The switch region is located at the base of the RNAP "clamp" and serves as the "hinge" that mediates opening of the RNAP clamp to load DNA into the RNAP active-center cleft and mediates closing of the RNAP clamp to retain DNA in the RNAP active-center cleft.
ARO:3003439.label: antibiotic sensitive RNA polymerase switch region

ARO:3001690.definition: OXA-255 is a beta-lactamase found in A. baumannii
ARO:3001690.label: OXA-255

ARO:3001691.definition: OXA-228 is a beta-lactamase found in A. bereziniae
ARO:3001691.label: OXA-228

ARO:3001692.definition: OXA-229 is a beta-lactamase found in A. bereziniae
ARO:3001692.label: OXA-229

ARO:3001693.definition: OXA-230 is a beta-lactamase found in A. bereziniae
ARO:3001693.label: OXA-230

ARO:3001694.definition: OXA-257 is a beta-lactamase found in A. bereziniae
ARO:3001694.label: OXA-257

ARO:3001695.definition: OXA-134 is a beta-lactamase found in A. lwoffii
ARO:3001695.label: OXA-134

ARO:3001696.definition: OXA-186 is a beta-lactamase found in A. lwoffii
ARO:3001696.label: OXA-186

ARO:3001697.definition: OXA-187 is a beta-lactamase found in A. lwoffii
ARO:3001697.label: OXA-187

ARO:3001698.definition: OXA-188 is a beta-lactamase found in A. lwoffii
ARO:3001698.label: OXA-188

ARO:3001699.definition: OXA-189 is a beta-lactamase found in A. lwoffii
ARO:3001699.label: OXA-189

ARO:3001257.definition: Unphenelfamycin was isolated from two environmental isolates called AB999F-80 and AB1047T-33. They were both identified as Streptomyces violaceoniger strains. Both these strains were found to produce phenelfamycins A-F and unphenelfamycin. Unphenelfamycin has a monosaccaride moeity and lacks the  phenacetyl moeity present in the other phenelfamycins. All phenelfamycins were selected due to their activity against anaerobic bacteria, especially Clostridium difficile.
ARO:3001257.label: unphenelfamycin

ARO:3000491.definition: AcrD is an aminoglycoside efflux pump expressed in E. coli. Its expression can be induced by indole, and is regulated by baeRS and cpxAR.
ARO:3000491.label: acrD

ARO:3000490.definition: Tuberactinomycins are a family of cyclic peptide antibiotics that are important in the treatment of tuberculosis. Tuberactinomycins contain nonproteinogenic amino acids and inhibit group I self-splicing RNA to disrupt prokaryotic protein synthesis.
ARO:3000490.label: tuberactinomycin

ARO:3002345.definition: GES-16 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of GES beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002345.label: GES-16

ARO:3000492.definition: Genes that are involved in conferring self resistance to antibiotic
ARO:3000492.label: gene involved in self-resistance to antibiotic

ARO:3002343.definition: GES-14 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii
ARO:3002343.label: GES-14

ARO:3000494.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to glycopeptide antibiotics.
ARO:3000494.label: determinant of resistance to glycopeptide antibiotics

ARO:3002341.definition: GES-12 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii
ARO:3002341.label: GES-12

ARO:3002340.definition: GES-11 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii
ARO:3002340.label: GES-11

ARO:3000499.definition: AcrE is a membrane fusion protein, similar to AcrA.
ARO:3000499.label: AcrE

ARO:3000549.definition: AdeS is a sensor kinase in the AdeRS regulatory system of AdeABC. It is essential for AdeABC expression.
ARO:3000549.label: adeS

ARO:3002349.definition: GES-20 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3002349.label: GES-20

ARO:3002348.definition: GES-19 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3002348.label: GES-19

ARO:3000653.definition: A gentamicin class aminoglycoside antibiotic often used in mammalian cell culture work as a selectable marker for the neo cassette (APH3').
ARO:3000653.label: G418

ARO:3000652.definition: A semi-synthetic derivative of gentamicin B (hydroxyamino propionyl genamicin B). It is modified to combat microbial inactivation and has a slightly larger spectrum of activity compared to other aminoglycosides, including Ser marcescens, Enterobacteria, and K pneumoniae.
ARO:3000652.label: isepamicin

ARO:3000651.definition: Ceftaroline is a novel cephalosporin active against methicillin resistant Staphylococcus aureus. Like other cephalosporins it binds penicillin-binding proteins to inhibit cell wall synthesis. It strongly binds with PBP2a, associated with methicillin resistance. It is taken orally as the prodrug ceftaroline fosamil.
ARO:3000651.label: ceftaroline

ARO:3000650.definition: Cefdinir is similar to cefixime with a modified side-chain at its 7-amino position. It also shares similar activity with cefixime but is more active against staphylococci. It has also be shown to enhance phagocytosis.
ARO:3000650.label: cefdinir

ARO:3000657.definition: An aminoglycoside antibiotic used for the treatment of parasitic infections. It is similar to neomycin sharing a similar spectrum of activity, but its hydroxyl group at the 6'-position instead of an amino group makes it resistant to AAC(6') modifying enzymes.
ARO:3000657.label: paromomycin

ARO:3000656.definition: AcrS is a repressor of the AcrAB efflux complex and is associated with the expression of AcrEF. AcrS is believed to regulate a switch between AcrAB and AcrEF efflux.
ARO:3000656.label: AcrS

ARO:3000655.definition: Gentamicin B is a semisynthetic aminoglycoside antibacterial.
ARO:3000655.label: gentamicin B

ARO:3000654.definition: A synthetic derivative (1-N-(4-amino-2-hydroxybutyryl) of dibekacin used in Japan. It is active against methicillin-resistant Staph. aureus and shows synergy with ampicillin when treating gentamicin and vancomycin resistant enterocci.
ARO:3000654.label: arbekacin

ARO:3003692.definition: mexJ is the membrane fusion protein of the MexJK multidrug efflux protein.
ARO:3003692.label: MexJ

ARO:3003693.definition: mexK is the inner membrane resistance-nodulation-cell division (RND) transporter in the MexJK multidrug efflux protein.
ARO:3003693.label: MexK

ARO:3003690.definition: Sitafloxacin is a fluoroquinolone active against multi-resistant Gram-positive and negative pathogens. Sitafloxacin shows inhibitory activity against DNA gyrase and topoisomerase IV, which blocks bacterial DNA replication, thereby causing double-stranded breaks in the bacterial chromosome.
ARO:3003690.label: sitafloxacin

ARO:3003691.definition: MexJK-OpmH is a triclosan efflux protein expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexJ is the membrane fusion protein, MexK is the inner membrane resistance-nodulation-cell division (RND) transporter, and OpmH is the outer membrane efflux protein. MexJK is constitutively expressed in mexL mutants.
ARO:3003691.label: MexJK-OpmH

ARO:3003696.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to the antibacterial biocide triclosan.
ARO:3003696.label: determinant of triclosan resistance

ARO:3003697.definition: MexPQ-OpmE multidrug efflux pump expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexP is the membrane fusion protein; MexQ is the inner membrane transporter; and OpmE is the outer membrane channel.
ARO:3003697.label: MexPQ-OpmE

ARO:3003694.definition: MexJK-OprM is a multidrug efflux protein expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexJ is the membrane fusion protein, MexK is the inner membrane resistance-nodulation-cell division (RND) transporter, and OprM is the outer membrane factor protein.
ARO:3003694.label: MexJK-OprM

ARO:3002799.definition: QnrVC1 is an integron-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Vibrio cholerae
ARO:3002799.label: QnrVC1

ARO:3003323.definition: Point mutations that occur within Staphylococcus aureus pgsA gene resulting in resistance to daptomycin
ARO:3003323.label: Staphylococcus aureus pgsA mutations conferring resistance to daptomycin

ARO:3003326.definition: Point mutations that occur within Mycobacterium tuberculosis embB gene resulting in resistance to ethambutol
ARO:3003326.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis embB mutations conferring resistance to ethambutol

ARO:3003327.definition: Point mutations in Mycobacterium tuberculosis embC that result in lower affinity between ethambutol and EmbC, resulting in resistance
ARO:3003327.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis mutant embC conferring resistance to ethambutol

ARO:3003324.definition: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins. Additionally, large-scale mutations causing loss of function of the gene result in increased susceptibility to daptomycin.
ARO:3003324.label: Bacillus subtilis mprF

ARO:3003325.definition: Point mutations that occur within Mycobacterium bovis embB gene resulting in resistance to ethambutol
ARO:3003325.label: Mycobacterium bovis embB mutations conferring resistance to ethambutol

ARO:3002509.definition: PDC-10 is a extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3002509.label: PDC-10

ARO:3002508.definition: PDC-9 is a extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3002508.label: PDC-9

ARO:3002505.definition: PDC-6 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3002505.label: PDC-6

ARO:3002507.definition: PDC-8 is a extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3002507.label: PDC-8

ARO:3002506.definition: PDC-7 is a extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3002506.label: PDC-7

ARO:3002501.definition: PDC-4 is a extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3002501.label: PDC-4

ARO:3002500.definition: PDC-3 is a extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3002500.label: PDC-3

ARO:3002502.definition: PDC-5 is a extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3002502.label: PDC-5

ARO:3003102.definition: cphA6 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas veronii. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
ARO:3003102.label: cphA6

ARO:3003103.definition: cphA7 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas jandaei. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
ARO:3003103.label: cphA7

ARO:3003100.definition: CphA4 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas allosaccharophila. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
ARO:3003100.label: cphA4

ARO:3003101.definition: cphA5 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas salmonicida. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
ARO:3003101.label: cphA5

ARO:3001878.definition: CTX-M-15 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001878.label: CTX-M-15

ARO:3001879.definition: CTX-M-16 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001879.label: CTX-M-16

ARO:3003104.definition: cphA8 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas sobria. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
ARO:3003104.label: cphA8

ARO:3003105.definition: dfrA3 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3003105.label: dfrA3

ARO:3001874.definition: CTX-M-11 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001874.label: CTX-M-11

ARO:3001875.definition: CTX-M-12 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3001875.label: CTX-M-12

ARO:3001876.definition: CTX-M-13 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001876.label: CTX-M-13

ARO:3001877.definition: CTX-M-14 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001877.label: CTX-M-14

ARO:3001870.definition: CTX-M-7 is a beta-lactamase found in Salmonella typhimurium
ARO:3001870.label: CTX-M-7

ARO:3001871.definition: CTX-M-8 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001871.label: CTX-M-8

ARO:3001872.definition: CTX-M-9 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001872.label: CTX-M-9

ARO:3001873.definition: CTX-M-10 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001873.label: CTX-M-10

ARO:3003976.definition: Point mutations in bacterial 16S rRNA that confer resistance to antibiotic pactamycin
ARO:3003976.label: 16S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to pactamycin

ARO:3003198.definition: rmtH is a 16s ribosomal RNA methyltransferase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae strain MRSN2404 that was isolated from the chronic wound of a soldier wounded in Iraq in 2006. It confers high resistance to all aminoglycosides
ARO:3003198.label: rmtH

ARO:0000038.definition: Netilmicin is a member of the aminoglycoside family of antibiotics. These antibiotics have the ability to kill a wide variety of bacteria by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth. Netilmicin is not absorbed from the gut and is therefore only given by injection or infusion. It is only used in the treatment of serious infections particularly those resistant to gentamicin.
ARO:0000038.label: netilmicin

ARO:0000039.definition: Spectinomycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Spectinomycin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit inhibiting translation.
ARO:0000039.label: spectinomycin

ARO:0000034.definition: Streptogramin A antibiotics are cyclic polyketide peptide hybrids that bind to the ribosomal peptidyl transfer centre. Structural variation arises from substituting a proline for its desaturated derivative and by its substitution for Ala or Cys. Used alone, streptogramin A antibiotics are bacteriostatic, but is bactericidal when used with streptogramin B antibiotics.
ARO:0000034.label: streptogramin A antibiotic

ARO:0000035.definition: Sisomicin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Sisomicin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.
ARO:0000035.label: sisomicin

ARO:0000036.definition: Ciprofloxacin is a bacteriocidal fluoroquinolone. It blocks bacterial DNA replication by binding to the toposiomerase II or IV-DNA complex (or cleavable complex), thereby causing double-stranded breaks in the bacterial chromosome.
ARO:0000036.label: ciprofloxacin

ARO:0000037.definition: Apramycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections in animals. Apramycin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.
ARO:0000037.label: apramycin

ARO:0000030.definition: Tigecycline is an glycylcycline antibiotic. It works by inhibiting action of the prokaryotic 30S ribosome.
ARO:0000030.label: tigecycline

ARO:0000031.definition: Resistance to antibiotics is often conferred by single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) and other mutations in target genes.
ARO:0000031.label: antibiotic resistant gene variant or mutant

ARO:0000032.definition: Cephalosporins are a class of beta-lactam antibiotics, containing the beta-lactam ring fused with a dihydrothiazolidine ring. Together with cephamycins they belong to a sub-group called cephems. Cephalosporin are bactericidal, and act by inhibiting the synthesis of the peptidoglycan layer of bacterial cell walls. The peptidoglycan layer is important for cell wall structural integrity, especially in Gram-positive organisms.
ARO:0000032.label: cephalosporin

ARO:3003748.definition: oleC is an ABC transporter isolated from Streptomyces antibioticus and is involved in oleandomycin secretion.
ARO:3003748.label: oleC

ARO:3003749.definition: salA is an ABC transporter gene isolated from the chromosome of Staphylococcus sciuri conferring resistance to lincosamides and streptogramins.
ARO:3003749.label: salA

ARO:3003741.definition: The mphD gene codes for a macrolide 2'-phosphotransferase partial sequence detected in Pseudomonas aeruginosa that provides a high level of resistance to all 14- and 15-membered-ring macrolides.
ARO:3003741.label: mphD

ARO:3003742.definition: The mphG gene encodes a macrolide 2'-phosphotransferase found in Photobacterium damselae sharing sequence similarity to mphA in E. coli.
ARO:3003742.label: mphG

ARO:3003744.definition: vatF is a streptogramin A acetyl transferase gene isolated from the chromosome of Yersinia enterocolitica.
ARO:3003744.label: vatF

ARO:3003745.definition: mefC is a macrolide efflux gene isolated from a plasmid in Photobacterium damselae.
ARO:3003745.label: mefC

ARO:3003746.definition: optrA encodes an ABC-transporter gene conferring resistance to oxazolidinones that was isolated from a plasmid in Enterococcus faecalis and Enterococcus faecium.
ARO:3003746.label: optrA

ARO:3003747.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to oxazolidinone (ie., linezolid) antibiotics.
ARO:3003747.label: determinant of oxazolidinone resistance

ARO:3003397.definition: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of helix 44, in the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to G418
ARO:3003397.label: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to G418

ARO:3002402.definition: OXY-2-7 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
ARO:3002402.label: OXY-2-7

ARO:3000271.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to fosfomycin antibiotics.
ARO:3000271.label: determinant of fosfomycin resistance

ARO:3000270.definition: Enzymes or other proteins either directly or indirectly reducing overall permeability to antibiotics.
ARO:3000270.label: protein modulating permeability to antibiotic

ARO:3000273.definition: Point mutations in gyrA confer antibiotic resistance by preventing drugs from binding the alpha-subunit of gyrase, essential for DNA supercoiling.
ARO:3000273.label: antibiotic resistant DNA topoisomerase subunit gyrA

ARO:3000274.definition: Point mutations in parC confer antibiotic resistance by preventing drugs from binding the parC subunit of topoisomerase IV, essential for DNA decatanation and relaxation.
ARO:3000274.label: antibiotic resistant DNA topoisomerase subunit parC

ARO:3000276.definition: Cephems have a six-membered dihydrothiazine ring with a sulfur atom and double bond fused with its beta-lactam ring. This group includes the cephalosporins and cephamycins, the latter containing an additional alpha-methoxy group.
ARO:3000276.label: cephem

ARO:3000479.definition: Point mutations in DNA gyrase subunit B (gyrB) can result in resistance to aminocoumarins. These mutations usually involve arginine residues in organisms.
ARO:3000479.label: aminocoumarin resistant gyrB

ARO:3000478.definition: Tet33 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Gram-positive bacteria, including Arthrobacter and Corynebacterium.
ARO:3000478.label: tet(33)

ARO:3000472.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to tetracycline antibiotics or tetracycline-like derivatives.
ARO:3000472.label: determinant of tetracycline resistance

ARO:3000477.definition: Point mutations to DNA topoisomerase enzymes clinically shown to confer resistance to aminocoumarins. In some cases, expression of parY(R), which encodes an aminocoumarin resistant topoisomerase IV, can also confer aminocoumarin resistance.
ARO:3000477.label: determinant of aminocoumarin resistance

ARO:3000476.definition: Tet31 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Aeromonas salmonicida, a Gram-negative bacteria. It has also been shown to be expressed in Gallibacterium anatis.
ARO:3000476.label: tet(31)

ARO:3004157.definition: Point mutations in the dihydrofolate synthetase folC gene shown clinically to confer resistance to p-aminosalicylic acid or other aminosalicylates. Mutations in folC inhibit bioactivation of PAS and thus confer resistance.
ARO:3004157.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis folC with mutation conferring resistance to para-aminosalicylic acid

ARO:3001309.definition: Cyclic thiazolyl peptide elfamycins inhibit protein synthesis by preventing the formation of the EF-Tu*GTP-aa-tRNA ternary complex, a mechanism similar to that of pulvomycin. There are non-elfamycin cyclic thiazolyl peptide antibiotics which inhibit protein synthesis by by targeting the 50S ribosomal subunit and are not discussed here further.
ARO:3001309.label: cyclic thiazolyl peptide elfamycin

ARO:3000316.definition: The mphA gene encodes for resistance enzyme MPH(2')-I which preferentially inactivate 14-membered macrolides (e.g.erythromycin, telithromycin, roxithromycin) over 16-membered macrolides (e.g.tylosin, spiramycin). It phosphorylates macrolides at 2'-OH hydroxyl of desosamine sugar of macrolides in a GTP-dependent manner.
ARO:3000316.label: mphA

ARO:3000317.definition: Acetylation of paromomycin, and apramycin, on the amino group at position 1 in E. coli, Actinomycete, Campylobacter spp.
ARO:3000317.label: AAC(1)-I

ARO:3000315.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to macrolide antibiotics.
ARO:3000315.label: determinant of macrolide resistance

ARO:3003172.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
ARO:3003172.label: ACT-37

ARO:3000319.definition: The mphC gene was identified from Staphylococcus aureus.  This gene shows similarity to mphB gene from Escherchia coli.
ARO:3000319.label: mphC

ARO:3004374.definition: A calcium-dependent cyclic lipopeptide found to be effective against multidrug-resistant Staphylococcus aureus in cutaneous wound infections.
ARO:3004374.label: malacidin A

ARO:3004375.definition: Biosynthesis of malacidin A and malacidin B calcium-dependent cyclic lipopeptide antibiotics from uncultured soil bacteria.
ARO:3004375.label: malacidin biosynthesis

ARO:3004376.definition: Biosynthesis of the broad-spectrum Rho transcription factor inhibitor bicyclomycin by hydroxylation of a tRNA-dependent cyclodipeptide synthase core.
ARO:3004376.label: bicyclomycin biosynthesis

ARO:3004370.definition: Lowest concentration of antimicrobial at which visible bacterial growth is inhibited
ARO:3004370.label: minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC)

ARO:3002566.definition: AAC(6')-Iv is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Acinetobacter sp.
ARO:3002566.label: AAC(6')-Iv

ARO:3004378.definition: A plasmid-mediate quinolone efflux pump described in Enterobacter aerogenes and Escherichia coli. QepA3 confers resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics by expelling the antibiotic molecules from the cell. This is distinct from the usual chromosomal mutation mechanism of quinolone resistance. Described by Wang et al. 2017.
ARO:3004378.label: QepA3

ARO:3004379.definition: A plasmid-mediate quinolone efflux pump variant described in Escherichia coli. QepA4 confers resistance to quinolone and fluoroquinolone antibiotics by expulsion from the cell. Described by Manageiro et al. 2017.
ARO:3004379.label: QepA4

ARO:3002564.definition: AAC(6')-It is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Acinetobacter genomosp. 16
ARO:3002564.label: AAC(6')-It

ARO:3002563.definition: AAC(6')-Isa is a plasmid-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Streptomyces albulus
ARO:3002563.label: AAC(6')-Isa

ARO:3004159.definition: Point mutations in the 23S rRNA (domain V) of Mycoplasma gallisepticum can confer resistance to pleuromutilin antibiotics (tiamulin and valnemulin). The mutants also show cross-resistance to lincomycin, chloramphenicol and florfenicol.
ARO:3004159.label: Mycoplasma gallisepticum 23S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to pleuromutilin antibiotics

ARO:3002290.definition: VIM-20 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of VIM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002290.label: VIM-20

ARO:3002769.definition: QnrB56 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Citrobacter freundii
ARO:3002769.label: QnrB56

ARO:3002293.definition: VIM-23 is a beta-lactamase found in Enterobacter cloacae
ARO:3002293.label: VIM-23

ARO:3003092.definition: cls or cardiolipin synthetase is an inner membrane protein that is involved in membrane synthesis. Specific mutations in Enterococcus can confer resistance to daptomycin.
ARO:3003092.label: Enterococcus faecium cls conferring resistance to daptomycin

ARO:3002119.definition: CMY-107 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002119.label: CMY-107

ARO:3002787.definition: QnrC is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Proteus mirabilis
ARO:3002787.label: QnrC

ARO:3001573.definition: OXA-387 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of OXA beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001573.label: OXA-387

ARO:3004011.definition: Clinafloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic and gyrase (DNA topoisomerase II) inhibitor. It binds to DNA gyrase and disrupts replication by causing double-stranded DNA breaks, resulting in cell death.
ARO:3004011.label: clinafloxacin

ARO:3004010.definition: Cinoxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic primarily used for the treatment of urinary tract infections in adults. Cinoxacin binds to DNA gyrase, resulting in double-stranded DNA breaks and cell death.
ARO:3004010.label: cinoxacin

ARO:3000008.definition: Penams, often referred to as penicillins, are a group of antibiotics derived from Penicillium fungi. Penicillin antibiotics are historically significant because they are the first drugs that were effective against many previously serious diseases such as syphilis and Staphylococcus infections. Penicillins are still widely used today, though many types of bacteria are now resistant. All penicillins are beta-lactam antibiotics in the penam sub-group, and are used in the treatment of bacterial infections caused by susceptible, usually Gram-positive, organisms.
ARO:3000008.label: penam

ARO:3004012.definition: Clofazimine is a fluoroquinolone-class phenazine dye used for the treatment of leprosy. Clofazimine binds to DNA and disrupts bacterial DNA gyrase, thereby causing double-stranded DNA breaks, and subsequent cell death.
ARO:3004012.label: Clofazimine

ARO:3004015.definition: Gentamicin A is part of a complex of broad spectrum aminoglycoside antibiotics. Gentamicin inhibits protein synthesis, resulting in bacterial cell death.
ARO:3004015.label: gentamicin A

ARO:3004014.definition: Flomoxef is a second-generation cephamycin (oxacephem) and beta-lactam antibiotic.
ARO:3004014.label: flomoxef

ARO:3004017.definition: Moxalactam (Latamoxef) is a broad spectrum cephalosporin (oxacephem) and beta-lactam antibiotic. Moxalactam binding to PBPs inhibits peptidoglycan cross-linkage in the cell wall, resulting in cell death. Moxalactam is proposed to be effective against meningitides as it passes the blood-brain barrier.
ARO:3004017.label: moxalactam

ARO:3004016.definition: Loracarbef is a second-generation cephalosporin (carbacephem) and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Loracarbef inhibits PBPs through binding, disrupting peptidoglycan cell wall cross-linkage and resulting in cell death.
ARO:3004016.label: loracarbef

ARO:3004019.definition: para-aminosalicylic acid (PAS) is an anti-tubercular antibiotic agent, often used in conjunction with Isoniazid for treatment of M. tuberculosis infections. PAS diminishes bacterial cell growth by limiting folic acid production.
ARO:3004019.label: para-aminosalicylic acid

ARO:3004018.definition: Nafcillin is a penicillin-class narrow-spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. It inhibits cell wall synthesis and peptidoglycan cross-linkage through binding to PBPs, similarly to other penicillin-like antibiotics.
ARO:3004018.label: nafcillin

ARO:3000000.definition: A mutation, single nucleotide polymorphism, gene, or gene product that confers antibiotic resistance.
ARO:3000000.label: determinant of antibiotic resistance

ARO:3000001.definition: Beta-lactamases are enzymes (EC 3.5.2.6) produced by some bacteria and are responsible for their resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics like penicillins, cephalosporins (are relatively resistant to beta-lactamase), cephamycins, and carbapenems (ertapenem). These antibiotics have a common element in their molecular structure: a four-atom ring known as a beta-lactam. The lactamase enzyme breaks that ring open, deactivating the molecule's antibacterial properties. Beta-lactam antibiotics are typically used to treat a broad spectrum of gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria. Beta-lactamases produced by gram-negative organisms are usually secreted.
ARO:3000001.label: beta-lactamase

ARO:3000006.definition: VanH is a D-specific alpha-ketoacid dehydrogenase that synthesizes D-lactate. D-lactate is incorporated into the end of the peptidoglycan subunits, decreasing vancomycin binding affinity.
ARO:3000006.label: vanH

ARO:3000007.definition: Beta-lactam antibiotics are a broad class of antibiotics that include penams (penicillin derivatives), cephems (cephalosporins), monobactams, and carbapenems. These antibiotic agents contain a beta-lactam nucleus in its molecular structure. They are the most widely-used group of antibiotics.
ARO:3000007.label: beta-lactam antibiotic

ARO:3000004.definition: Ambler Class B beta-lactamases are the metallo-beta-lactamases.  These enzymes possess one or two zinc ions in the active site, which are used to orient a hydroxide nucleophile to attack the carbonyl on a beta-lactam ring.  There are currently no inhibitors in late-stage development for these relatively new beta-lactamases.
ARO:3000004.label: class B (metallo-) beta-lactamase

ARO:3000005.definition: VanD is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog similar to VanA, and can synthesize D-Ala-D-Lac, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity. It is associated with both vancomycin and teicoplanin resistance.
ARO:3000005.label: vanD

ARO:3002768.definition: QnrB55 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Raoultella terrigena
ARO:3002768.label: QnrB55

ARO:3002443.definition: OKP-B-10 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002443.label: OKP-B-10

ARO:3002444.definition: OKP-B-11 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002444.label: OKP-B-11

ARO:3002113.definition: CMY-101 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CMY beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002113.label: CMY-101

ARO:3004074.definition: MuxB is one of the two necessary RND components in the Pseudomonas aeruginosa efflux pump system MuxABC-OpmB.
ARO:3004074.label: MuxB

ARO:3001579.definition: OXA-393 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of OXA beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001579.label: OXA-393

ARO:3002569.definition: AAC(6')-Iy is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in S. enteritidis and S. enterica. Regulatory mutation required to increase expression of this chromosomally-encoded gene for resistance. In the specific system, aminoglycoside resistance was due to a transcriptional fusion secondary to a chromosomal deletion in which the downstream aac(6')-Iy gene was placed under the control of the upstream nmpC promoter.
ARO:3002569.label: AAC(6')-Iy

ARO:3001578.label: OXA-392

ARO:3002568.definition: AAC(6')-Ix is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Acinetobacter sp.
ARO:3002568.label: AAC(6')-Ix

ARO:3000043.definition: VEB beta-lactamases or Vietnamese extended-spectrum beta-lactamases are class A beta-lactamases that confer high-level resistance to oxyimino cephalosporins and to aztreonam
ARO:3000043.label: VEB beta-lactamase

ARO:3001856.label: CFE-1

ARO:3004161.label: Propionibacteria 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics

ARO:3000589.definition: NDM-1 is a metallo-beta-lactamase isolated from Klebsiella pneumoniae with nearly complete resistance to all beta-lactam antibiotics.
ARO:3000589.label: NDM-1

ARO:3004163.definition: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycobacterium abscessus shown to confer resistance to clarithromycin, a macrolide type antibiotic.
ARO:3004163.label: Mycobacterium abscessus 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin

ARO:3000588.definition: Ser beta-lactamase inhibitor targeting class A, class C, and some class D enzymes.
ARO:3000588.label: avibactam

ARO:3004168.label: Mycobacterium kansasii 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin

ARO:3002867.definition: dfrF is a chromosome-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Streptococcus pyogenes
ARO:3002867.label: dfrF

ARO:3000864.definition: Point mutations in DNA gyrase subunit B (gyrB) observed in Mycobacterium tuberculosis can result in resistance to fluoroquinolones.
ARO:3000864.label: fluoroquinolone resistant gyrB

ARO:3000865.definition: OleD is a glycotransferase found in Streptomyces antibioticus, a natural producer  of oleandomycin. OleD can glycosylate a wide range of macrolides. Unlike oleI, oleD is not found in the oleandomycin biosynthetic cluster.
ARO:3000865.label: oleD

ARO:3000866.definition: OleI is a glycosyltransferase found in Streptomyces antibioticus, specifically the oleandomycin biosynthetic cluster. OleI glycosylates oleandomycin to confer self-resistance.
ARO:3000866.label: oleI

ARO:3000867.definition: Oleandomycin is a 14-membered macrolide produced by Streptomyces antibioticus. It is ssimilar to erythromycin, and contains a desosamine amino sugar and an oleandrose sugar. It targets the 50S ribosomal subunit to prevent protein synthesis.
ARO:3000867.label: oleandomycin

ARO:3000860.definition: RmtB is a 16S rRNA methyltransferase that targets mature or nearly mature 30S subunits. It transfers a methyl group from S-adenosyl-L-methionine to N7-G1405 of the 16S rRNA, an aminoglycoside binding site.
ARO:3000860.label: rmtB

ARO:3000861.definition: RmtC is a rRNA methyltransferase found in Proteus mirabilis with high level resistance to similar to aminoglycosides, with the exception of non-4,6-disubstituted deoxystreptamines (streptomycin and neomycin). It has also been isolated in Salmonella enterica ser. Virchow. It is hypothesized to methylate G1405, like related methyltransferases RmtA, RmtB, and ArmA.
ARO:3000861.label: rmtC

ARO:3000862.definition: Sgm, or sisomicin-gentamicin methyltransferase, methylates G1405 of 16S rRNA to confer resistance to various aminoglycosides.
ARO:3000862.label: sgm

ARO:3000863.definition: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface of both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.
ARO:3000863.label: defensin resistant mprF

ARO:3003168.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
ARO:3003168.label: CTX-M-160

ARO:3000869.definition: AcetylCoA dependent acetyltransferase that acetylate streptothricins such as nourseothricin at position 16 (beta position of beta-lysine).
ARO:3000869.label: streptothricin acetyltransferase (SAT)

ARO:3003240.definition: Point mutations in the 16S rRNA of Mycobacterium abscessus conferring resistance to gentamicin
ARO:3003240.label: Mycobacterium abscessus 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to gentamicin

ARO:3002864.definition: dfrB1 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002864.label: dfrB1

ARO:3000581.definition: CphA is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas hydrophilia.  This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
ARO:3000581.label: CphA beta-lactamase

ARO:3001209.definition: A foreign PBP2a acquired by lateral gene transfer that able to perform peptidoglycan synthesis in the presence of beta-lactams.
ARO:3001209.label: mecC

ARO:3001208.definition: In methicillin sensitive S. aureus (MSSA), beta-lactams bind to native penicillin-binding proteins (PBPs) and disrupt synthesis of the cell membrane's peptidoglycan layer. In methicillin resistant S. aureus (MRSA), foreign PBP2a acquired by lateral gene transfer is able to perform peptidoglycan synthesis in the presence of beta-lactams.
ARO:3001208.label: methicillin resistant PBP2

ARO:3001207.definition: A gene whose product inactivates an antibiotic by formation of a complex, preventing interaction of the antibiotic with its target.
ARO:3001207.label: gene involved in antibiotic sequestration

ARO:3001206.definition: Inactivation of an antibiotic by formation of a complex, preventing interaction of the antibiotic with its target.
ARO:3001206.label: antibiotic inactivation by sequestration

ARO:3001205.definition: A novel bleomycin resistance protein encoded by a metallo-beta-lactamase-associated ble gene. Expression of BRP(MBL) confers resistance to bleomycin and bleomycin-like antibiotics in Enterobacteriaceae and Acinetobacter, where it is co-expressed with an MBL and controlled by the same promoter region.
ARO:3001205.label: BRP(MBL)

ARO:3000481.definition: Tet35 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in the Gram-negative Vibrio and Stenotrophomonas. It is unrelated to other tet resistance genes.
ARO:3000481.label: tet(35)

ARO:3002358.definition: NDM-8 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002358.label: NDM-8

ARO:3002359.definition: NDM-9 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
ARO:3002359.label: NDM-9

ARO:3000488.definition: Telavancin is a semi-synthetic derivative of vancomycin and is a second-generation lipoglycopeptide antibiotic. Telavancin inhibits cell wall synthesis by forming a complex with the D-Ala-D-Ala terminus of peptidoglycan precursors and preventing transglycosylation.
ARO:3000488.label: telavancin

ARO:3000489.definition: Sav1866 is a multidrug efflux pump in the Gram-positive Staphylococcus aureus. It is a homolog of the human ABC transporter Mdr1 and pumps out toxic compounds including verapamil, tetraphenylphosphorchloride, and Hoechst 33342.
ARO:3000489.label: sav1866

ARO:3000640.definition: Doripenem is a carbapenem with a broad range of activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, and along with meropenem, it is the most active beta-lactam antibiotic against Pseudomonas aeruginosa. It inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis.
ARO:3000640.label: doripenem

ARO:3000641.definition: Cefalexin is a cephalosporin antibiotic that causes filamentation. It is resistant to staphylococcal beta-lactamase, but degraded by enterobacterial beta-lactamases.
ARO:3000641.label: cefalexin

ARO:3000642.definition: Cefadroxil, or p-hydroxycephalexin, is an cephalosporin antibiotic similar to cefalexin.
ARO:3000642.label: cefadroxil

ARO:3000643.definition: Cefotiam is a cephalosporin antibiotic with similar activity to cefuroxime but more active against enterobacteria. It is consumed orally as the prodrug cefotiam hexetil.
ARO:3000643.label: cefotiam

ARO:3000644.definition: Cefaclor is a semisynthetic cephalosporin derived from cephalexin. It has broad-spectrum antibiotic activity.
ARO:3000644.label: cefaclor

ARO:3000645.definition: Cefotaxime is a semisynthetic cephalosporin taken parenterally. It is resistant to most beta-lactamases and active against Gram-negative rods and cocci due to its aminothiazoyl and methoximino functional groups.
ARO:3000645.label: cefotaxime

ARO:3000646.definition: Cefixime is a cephalosporin resistant to most beta-lactamases. It is active against many enterobacteria, but activity against staphylococci is poor.
ARO:3000646.label: cefixime

ARO:3000647.definition: Cefpodoxime is a semisynthetic cephalosporin that acts similarly to cefotaxime with broad-spectrum activity. It is stable to many plasmid-mediated beta-lactamses. Cefpodoxime is consumed as the prodrug cefpodoxime proxetil.
ARO:3000647.label: cefpodoxime

ARO:3000648.definition: Ceftibuten is a semisynthetic cephalosporin active against Gram-negative bacilli. It is resistant against many plasmid-mediated beta-lactamases.
ARO:3000648.label: ceftibuten

ARO:3000649.definition: Cefditoren is a semisynthetic cephalosporin active against staphylococci, streptococci, and and most enterobacteria. It is resistant to staphylococcal and most enterobacterial beta-lactamases, and is usually taken as the prodrug cefditoren pivoxil.
ARO:3000649.label: cefditoren

ARO:3004143.definition: AxyX is the inner membrane transporter of the AxyXY-OprZ efflux pump system in Achromobacter spp.
ARO:3004143.label: AxyX

ARO:3003762.definition: lnuE encodes a lincosamide resistance gene isolated from Streptococcus suis that was truncated by an ISEnfa5-cfr-ISEnfa5 segment insertion. It shares the closest sequence similarity to lnuA.
ARO:3003762.label: lnuE

ARO:3002753.label: QnrB38

ARO:3002719.definition: QnrB5 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3002719.label: QnrB5

ARO:0000001.definition: The fluoroquinolones are a family of synthetic broad-spectrum antibiotics that are 4-quinolone-3-carboxylates. These compounds interact with topoisomerase II (DNA gyrase) to disrupt bacterial DNA replication, damage DNA, and cause cell death.
ARO:0000001.label: fluoroquinolone antibiotic

ARO:0000000.definition: Macrolides are a group of drugs (typically antibiotics) that have a large macrocyclic lactone ring of 12-16 carbons to which one or more deoxy sugars, usually cladinose and desosamine, may be attached. Macrolides bind to the 50S-subunit of bacterial ribosomes, inhibiting the synthesis of vital proteins.
ARO:0000000.label: macrolide antibiotic

ARO:0000003.definition: Astromicin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Astromicin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.
ARO:0000003.label: astromicin

ARO:0000002.definition: A family of proteins known to bind to the 30S ribosomal subunit. This interaction prevents tetracycline and tetracycline derivatives from inhibiting ribosomal function. Thus, these proteins confer elevated resistance to tetracycline derivatives as a ribosomal protection protein.
ARO:0000002.label: tetracycline-resistant ribosomal protection protein

ARO:0000005.definition: Neomycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Neomycin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.
ARO:0000005.label: neomycin

ARO:0000004.definition: Monobactams are a class of beta-lactam antibiotics with a broad spectrum of antibacterial activity, and have a structure which renders them highly resistant to beta-lactamases. Unlike penams and cephems, monobactams do not have any ring fused to its four-member lactam structure. Monobactam antibiotics are bactericidal, and act by inhibiting the synthesis of the peptidoglycan layer of bacterial cell walls. The peptidoglycan layer is important for cell wall structural integrity, especially in Gram-positive organisms.
ARO:0000004.label: monobactam

ARO:0000007.definition: Dibekacin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat different types of bacterial infections. Dibekacin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.
ARO:0000007.label: dibekacin

ARO:0000006.definition: Erythromycin is a macrolide antibiotic with a 14-carbon ring that has an antimicrobial spectrum similar to or slightly wider than that of penicillin, and is often used for people that have an allergy to penicillins. Erythromycin may possess bacteriocidal activity, particularly at higher concentrations by binding to the 50S subunit of the bacterial 70S rRNA complex, inhibiting peptidyl-tRNA translocation. Thus, protein synthesis and subsequently structure/function processes critical for life or replication are inhibited.
ARO:0000006.label: erythromycin

ARO:0000009.definition: Tunicamycin is mixture of homologous nucleoside antibiotics that block the reaction of UDP-N-acetylglucosamine and dolichyl phosphate in the first step of glycoprotein synthesis.
ARO:0000009.label: tunicamycin

ARO:0000008.definition: Cefoxitin is a cephamycin antibiotic often grouped with the second generation cephalosporins. Cefoxitin is bactericidal and acts by inhibiting the synthesis of the peptidoglycan layer of bacterial cell walls. The peptidoglycan layer is important for cell wall structural integrity, especially in Gram-positive organisms. Cefoxitin's 7-alpha-methoxy group and 3' leaving group make it a poor substrate for most beta-lactamases.
ARO:0000008.label: cefoxitin

ARO:3003779.definition: Mutations in the Mycobacterium bovis ndh gene that results in increased resistance to isoniazid.
ARO:3003779.label: Mycobacterium bovis ndh with mutation conferring resistance to isoniazid

ARO:3003778.definition: Mutations in the Mycobacterium smegmatis ndh gene that results in increased resistance to isoniazid.
ARO:3003778.label: Mycobacterium smegmatis ndh with mutation conferring resistance to isoniazid

ARO:3003775.definition: murA or UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvyl transferase catalyses the initial step in peptidoglycan biosynthesis and is inhibited by fosfomycin. Overexpression of murA through mutations such as Asp369Asn and Leu370Ile confers fosfomycin resistance. Extensive evidence has shown the significance of C115 mutations in conferring fosfomycin resistance since this residue represents a primary binding site for the antibiotic across many species.
ARO:3003775.label: Escherichia coli murA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin

ARO:3003774.definition: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.
ARO:3003774.label: Streptococcus agalactiae mprF

ARO:3003777.definition: murA or UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvyl transferase catalyses the initial step in peptidoglycan biosynthesis and is inhibited by fosfomycin. Mutations to the murA enzyme confers resistance to the antibiotic.
ARO:3003777.label: Borrelia burgdorferi murA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin

ARO:3003776.definition: murA or UDP-N-acetylglucosamine enolpyruvyl transferase catalyses the initial step in peptidoglycan biosynthesis and is inhibited by fosfomycin. Overexpression of murA through mutations confers fosfomycin resistance.
ARO:3003776.label: Staphylococcus aureus murA with mutation conferring resistance to fosfomycin

ARO:3003770.definition: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.
ARO:3003770.label: Listeria monocytogenes mprF

ARO:3003773.definition: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.
ARO:3003773.label: Clostridium perfringens mprF

ARO:3003772.definition: MprF is a integral membrane protein that modifies the negatively-charged phosphatidylglycerol on the membrane surface. This confers resistance to cationic peptides that disrupt the cell membrane, including defensins.
ARO:3003772.label: Brucella suis mprF

ARO:3003009.label: ceoA

ARO:3003008.definition: CeoAB is an RND efflux system that confers multidrug resistance in Burkholderia cenocepacia
ARO:3003008.label: CeoAB-OpcM

ARO:3003019.definition: dfrA23 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3003019.label: dfrA23

ARO:3003007.definition: bmr is an MFS antibiotic efflux pump that confers resistance to multiple drugs including acridine dyes, fluoroquinolone antibiotics, chloramphenicol, and puromycin
ARO:3003007.label: bmr

ARO:3003006.definition: blt is an MFS efflux pump that confers resistance to multiple drugs such as rhodamine and acridine dyes, and fluoroquinolone antibiotics
ARO:3003006.label: blt

ARO:3003005.definition: cfxA4 beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in Bacteroides fragilis
ARO:3003005.label: CfxA4

ARO:3000132.definition: Clorobiocin is an aminocoumarin antibiotic produced by Streptomyces roseochromogenes, and binds DNA gyrase subunit B to inhibit ATP-dependent DNA supercoiling.
ARO:3000132.label: clorobiocin

ARO:3002712.definition: QnrA6 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Proteus mirabilis
ARO:3002712.label: QnrA6

ARO:3000268.definition: The mec operon is composed of mecA/mecR1/mecI.
ARO:3000268.label: mec operon

ARO:3000269.definition: Brodimoprim is a structural derivative of trimethoprim and an inhibitor of bacterial dihydrofolate reductase. The 4-methoxy group of trimethoprim is replaced with a bromine atom.
ARO:3000269.label: brodimoprim

ARO:3000266.definition: The inactivation of antibiotics by the enzymatic addition of ADP-ribose from NAD+.
ARO:3000266.label: ADP-ribosylation of antibiotic conferring resistance

ARO:3000267.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to linezolid antibiotics.

ARO:3000264.definition: EmrE is a small multidrug transporter that functions as a homodimer and that couples the efflux of small polyaromatic cations from the cell with the import of protons down an electrochemical gradient. EmrE is found in E. coli and P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3000264.label: emrE

ARO:3000265.definition: In the presence of antibiotic stress, E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA, which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB, also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.

ARO:3000260.definition:
Homologous to VanC, contains a D-Ala-D-Ser ligase. The chromosome-located vanL gene cluster is inducible and confers low resistance to vancomycin. vanL organisms remain susceptible to teicoplanin. It is the only van gene cluster with two vanT genes.

Gene orientation: vanL(XY)TmTrRS
ARO:3000260.label: glycopeptide resistance gene cluster VanL

ARO:3000461.definition: Florfenicol is a fluorine derivative of chloramphenicol, where the nitro group (-NO2) is substituted by a sulfomethyl group (-SO2CH3) and the hydroxyl group (-OH), by a fluorine group (-F). The action mechanism is the same as chloramphenicol's, where the antibiotic binds to the 23S RNA of the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes to inhibit protein synthesis.
ARO:3000461.label: florfenicol

ARO:3000462.definition: A macrolide glycosyltransferase encoded by the mgtA gene in Streptomyces lividans. This enzyme inactivates macrolides using UDP-glucose as a cofactor. Its optimal substrates are lankamycin, calcomycin, rosaramicin, methymycin, and pikromycin, while interactions with erythomycin, oldeandomycin, azithromycin, and tylosin were weaker. It is inactive against spiramycin and carbomycin. Mechanism first described by Cundliffe, 1992.
ARO:3000462.label: mgtA

ARO:3000463.definition: A macrolide glycosyltransferase encoded by the gimA gene in Streptomyces ambofaciens, a natural producer of the macrolide antibiotic spiramycin. Chalcomycin, methymycin, tylosin, pikromycin, rosaramicin, oleandomycin, josamycin, and carbomycin are preferred substrates of gimA glycosyltransferase, while erythromycin and spiramycin have notably low binding affinities. GimA may be able to inactivate spiramycin precursors. Described by Gourmelen et al. 1998.
ARO:3000463.label: gimA

ARO:3000464.definition: Mutant forms of the porin Por result in reduced permeability to antibiotics, particularly tetracyclines and beta-lactams.
ARO:3000464.label: Neisseria gonorrhoeae porin PIB (por)

ARO:3000465.definition: OleI and OleD are glycosyltransferases found in Streptomyces antibioticus which is a natural producer of antibiotic oleandomycin. OleI glycosylates antibiotic oleandomycin whereas OleD can glycosylate a wide variety of macrolides.
ARO:3000465.label: ole glycosyltransferase

ARO:3004045.definition: fabI is a enoyl-acyl carrier reductase used in lipid metabolism and fatty acid biosynthesis. The bacterial biocide Triclosan blocks the final reduction step in fatty acid elongation, inhibiting biosynthesis. Point mutations in fabI can confer resistance to Triclosan and Isoniazid

ARO:3003499.definition: Tetracycline binds tightly to the helix 34 domain in 16S rRNA, where it interferes sterically with the binding of aminoacyl-tRNA to the ribosome A site to block protein synthesis. Mutations in the nucleotide sequence in this domain for Propionibacterium acnes can result in resistance against tetracycline.
ARO:3003499.label: Propionibacterium acnes 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to tetracycline

ARO:3001119.definition: SHV-64 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
ARO:3001119.label: SHV-64

ARO:3000971.definition: TEM-108 is a beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
ARO:3000971.label: TEM-108

ARO:3000626.definition: Polymyxin B2 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a 6-methylheptanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.
ARO:3000626.label: polymyxin B2

ARO:3000627.definition: Polymyxin B3 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with an octanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.
ARO:3000627.label: polymyxin B3

ARO:3002136.definition: DHA-7 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3002136.label: DHA-7

ARO:3004006.definition: Ceftiofur is a third-generation broad spectrum cephalosporin and beta-lactam antibiotic. It causes cell lysis by disrupting peptidoglycan cross-linkage and cell wall formation by binding to PBPs.
ARO:3004006.label: ceftiofur

ARO:3004007.definition: Ceftizoxime is a third-generation cephalosporin and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Ceftizoxime causes bacterial cell lysis through peptidoglycan cross-linking inhibition by binding to PBPs.
ARO:3004007.label: ceftizoxime

ARO:3004004.definition: Cefotetan is a cephamycin-class beta-lactam antibiotic that is highly resistant to beta-lactamases and effective against a wide range of gram-negative and gram-positive bacteria.
ARO:3004004.label: cefotetan

ARO:3004005.definition: Cefprozil is a cephalosporin and beta-lactam antibiotic with bactericidal activity. It selectively binds to PBPs and inhibits peptidoglycan synthesis, a major cell wall component, resulting in cell lysis.
ARO:3004005.label: cefprozil

ARO:3004002.definition: Cefonicid is a second-generation cephalosporin-class beta-lactam antibiotic with broad spectrum activity. Particularly used against urinary tract infections and lower respiratory infections. Causes cell lysis by inactivation of PBPs through binding, inhibiting peptidoglycan synthesis.
ARO:3004002.label: cefonicid

ARO:3004003.definition: Cefoperazone is a semi-synthetic cephalosporin containing a tetrazolyl moiety that is resistant to beta-lactamases. Particularly used for treatment of Pseudomonas spp. infections.
ARO:3004003.label: cefoperazone

ARO:3004000.definition: Cefetamet is a third-generation semi-synthetic beta-lactam antibiotic that inactivates inner cell wall PBPs through targeting binding, resulting in cell lysis.
ARO:3004000.label: cefetamet

ARO:3004001.definition: Cefmetazole is a semi-synthetic cephamycin antibiotic with broad spectrum antibiotic activity against both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, that disrupt cell wall synthesis through binding to PBPs causing cell lysis.
ARO:3004001.label: cefmetazole

ARO:3000077.definition: VanY is a D,D-carboxypeptidase that cleaves removes the terminal D-Ala from peptidoglycan for the addition of D-Lactate. The D-Ala-D-Lac peptidoglycan subunits have reduced binding affinity with vancomycin compared to D-Ala-D-Ala.
ARO:3000077.label: vanY

ARO:3000076.definition: AmpC type beta-lactamases are commonly isolated from extended-spectrum cephalosporin-resistant Gram-negative bacteria. AmpC beta-lactamases (also termed class C or group 1) are typically encoded on the chromosome of many Gram-negative bacteria including Citrobacter, Serratia, Enterobacter species, and P. aeruginosa where its expression is usually inducible; it may also occur on Escherichia coli but is not usually inducible, although it can be hyperexpressed. AmpC type beta-lactamases may also be carried on plasmids. AmpC beta-lactamases, in contrast to ESBLs, hydrolyse broad and extended-spectrum cephalosporins (cephamycins as well as to oxyimino-beta-lactams) but are not inhibited by beta-lactamase inhibitors such as clavulanic acid.
ARO:3000076.label: class C beta-lactamase

ARO:3000075.definition: Class D beta-lactamases are one of the subgroups of beta-lactamases that are classified as serine enzymes.
ARO:3000075.label: class D beta-lactamase

ARO:3000074.definition: emrB is a translocase in the emrB -TolC efflux protein in E. coli. It recognizes substrates including carbonyl cyanide m-chlorophenylhydrazone (CCCP), nalidixic acid, and thioloactomycin.
ARO:3000074.label: emrB

ARO:3000073.definition: ACC beta-lactamases or Ambler class C beta-lactamases are AmpC beta-lactamases. They possess an interesting resistance phenotype due to their low activity against cephamycins.
ARO:3000073.label: ACC beta-lactamase

ARO:3000072.definition: ACT beta-lactamases, also known as AmpC beta-lactamases, are cephalosporinases that cannot be inhibited by clavulanate. These enzymes are encoded by genes located on the chromosome and can be induced by the presence of beta-lactam antibiotics. However recently, these genes have been found on plasmids and expressed at high constitutive levels in Escherichia coli and Klebsiella pneumoniae.
ARO:3000072.label: ACT beta-lactamase

ARO:3004008.definition: Cephapirin is a first-generation cephalosporin and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Inactivation of penicillin-binding proteins through cephapirin binding disrupts peptidoglycan cross-linking, resulting in cell lysis.
ARO:3004008.label: cephapirin

ARO:3004009.definition: Cefradine is a first-generation cephalosporin and broad spectrum beta-lactam antibiotic. Cefradine binding to penicillin-binding proteins disrupts cell wall peptidoglycan cross-linkage, resulting in cell lysis.
ARO:3004009.label: cefradine

ARO:3000620.definition: AdeL is a regulator of AdeFGH in Acinetobacter baumannii. AdeL mutations are associated with AdeFGH overexpression and multidrug resistance.
ARO:3000620.label: adeL

ARO:3000621.definition: The blaZ beta-lactamase is found in Bacillus subtilis and Staphylococcus aureus.
ARO:3000621.label: PC1 beta-lactamase (blaZ)

ARO:3002138.definition: DHA-5 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of DHA beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002138.label: DHA-5

ARO:3002139.definition: DHA-8 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of DHA beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002139.label: DHA-8

ARO:3004178.definition: Point mutations in the 23S rRNA subunit may confer resistance to pleuromutilin antibiotics
ARO:3004178.label: 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to pleuromutilin antibiotics

ARO:3004179.definition: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycoplasma pneumoniae shown to confer resistance to erythromycin
ARO:3004179.label: Mycoplasma pneumoniae 23S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to erythromycin

ARO:3000755.definition: The 16S rRNA of the 30S ribosomal subunit helps to stabilize the aminoacyl-tRNAs for pairing with the mRNA codons. Some antibiotics (aminoglycosides) that target the 16S rRNA lead to mRNA misreading as well as premature termination. Other antibiotics (tetracyclines) that target the 16S rRNA prevent incoming charged-tRNAs from binding to the ribosome's A-site, stopping elongation.
ARO:3000755.label: antibiotic sensitive 16S rRNA

ARO:3000628.definition: Polymyxin B4 is in the family of polymyxin lipopeptides with a heptanoic acid acyl group. These antibiotics disrupt the cell membrane of Gram-negative bacteria.
ARO:3000628.label: polymyxin B4

ARO:3004172.definition: Point mutations in the 23S rRNA subunit may confer resistance to oxazolidinone antibiotics
ARO:3004172.label: 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to oxazolidinone antibiotics

ARO:3004170.definition: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Streptococcus pneumoniae shown to confer resistance to macrolide type antibiotics
ARO:3004170.label: Streptococcus pneumoniae 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics

ARO:3001622.definition: OXA-77 is a beta-lactamase found in A. baumannii
ARO:3001622.label: OXA-77

ARO:3004176.definition: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycoplasma hominis shown to confer resistance to macrolide type antibiotics
ARO:3004176.label: Mycoplasma hominis 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics

ARO:3004177.definition: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Mycoplasma fermentans shown to confer resistance to macrolide type antibiotics
ARO:3004177.label: Mycoplasma fermentans 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics

ARO:3004174.definition: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Chlamydia trachomatis shown to confer resistance to macrolide type antibiotics
ARO:3004174.label: Chlamydia trachomatis 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics

ARO:3000458.definition: Macrolide glycosyltransferases are enzymes encoded by macrolide glycosyltransferase genes and inactivate macrolides by glycosylating them at 2'-OH of desosamine sugar moiety. They are predominantly found in macrolide producers and are also found in non-producers and are used as a resistance mechanism. Different variants of this enzyme has been reported.
ARO:3000458.label: macrolide glycosyltransferase

ARO:3000103.definition: Aminocoumarin antibiotics bind DNA gyrase subunit B to inhibit ATP-dependent DNA supercoiling.
ARO:3000103.label: aminocoumarin antibiotic

ARO:3000102.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics
ARO:3000102.label: determinant of fluoroquinolone resistance

ARO:3000100.definition: Genes that directly or indirectly modulate beta-lactam resistance.
ARO:3000100.label: gene modulating beta-lactam resistance

ARO:3000106.definition: Addition of an acyl group to an antibiotic, often via acetylation by acetylCoA.
ARO:3000106.label: acylation of antibiotic conferring resistance

ARO:3000105.definition: Phosphorylation of antibiotic usually by ATP, sometimes GTP
ARO:3000105.label: phosphorylation of antibiotic conferring resistance

ARO:3000104.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to aminoglycoside antibiotics.
ARO:3000104.label: determinant of aminoglycoside resistance

ARO:3002177.definition: MIR-12 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of MIR beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002177.label: MIR-12

ARO:3001751.definition: OXA-296 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter spp.
ARO:3001751.label: OXA-296

ARO:3000451.definition: Protein(s) and two component regulatory systems that directly or indirectly change rates of antibiotic efflux.
ARO:3000451.label: protein(s) and two-component regulatory system modulating antibiotic efflux

ARO:3003848.definition: ADC-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Oligella urethralis.
ARO:3003848.label: ADC-2

ARO:3002210.definition: IMP-19 is a beta-lactamase found in Aeromonas caviae
ARO:3002210.label: IMP-19

ARO:3001989.definition: CTX-M-130 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001989.label: CTX-M-130

ARO:3001750.definition: OXA-295 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter spp.
ARO:3001750.label: OXA-295

ARO:3001218.definition: Alternative dihydropteroate synthase dfr present on plasmids produces alternate proteins that are less sensitive to trimethoprim from inhibiting its role in folate synthesis, thus conferring trimethoprim resistance.
ARO:3001218.label: trimethoprim resistant dihydrofolate reductase dfr

ARO:3001219.definition: Elfamycins are molecules that inhibit bacterial elongation factor Tu (EF-Tu), a key protein which brings aminoacyl-tRNA (aa-tRNA) to the ribosome during protein synthesis. Elfamycins defined by their target (EF-Tu), rather than a conserved chemical backbone. Elfamycins follow two mechanisms to disrupt protein synthesis: 1. kirromycins and enacyloxin fix EF-Tu in the GTP bound conformation and lock EF-Tu onto the ribosome, and 2. pulvomycin and GE2270 cover the binding site of aa-tRNA disallowing EF-Tu from being charged with aa-tRNA. All elfamycins cause increased the affinity of EF-Tu for GTP.
ARO:3001219.label: elfamycin antibiotic

ARO:3003302.definition: Point mutation in Bartonella bacilliformis resulting in aminocoumarin resistance
ARO:3003302.label: Bartonella bacilliformis gyrB conferring resistance to aminocoumarin

ARO:3004431.definition: Qualitative description of a microbe’s response to antimicrobial agents as described by EUCAST using breakpoints determined through in-vitro testing.  These breakpoints are determined irrespective of tissue specificity of infection.
ARO:3004431.label: EUCAST antimicrobial phenotype

ARO:3003080.definition: pgsA or phosphatidylglycerophosphate synthetase is an integral membrane protein involved in phospholipid biosynthesis. It is a CDP-diacylglycerol-glycerol-3-phosphate 3-phosphatidyltransferase. Laboratory experiments have detected mutations conferring daptomycin resistance in Entercoccus.
ARO:3003080.label: daptomycin resistant pgsA

ARO:3001753.label: OXA-298

ARO:3003924.definition: Point mutation of Haemophilus parainfluenzae gyrA resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and GyrA. Thus, conferring resistance. Both Ser and Tyr are hydrophilic amino acids, however Tyr has an additional bulky hydrophobic group which could affect the interaction between the DNA gyrase with quinolones
ARO:3003924.label: Haemophilus parainfluenzae gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3003925.definition: Point mutation of Haemophilus parainfluenzae parC resulted in the lowered affinity between fluoroquinolones and ParC. Thus, conferring resistance.

ARO:3002988.definition: bcrB is an ABC transporter found in Bacillus licheniformis that confers bacitracin resistance
ARO:3002988.label: bcrB

ARO:3003926.definition: Point mutations in Salmonella gyrA that confer resistance to Nalidixic acid, a fluoroquinolone antibiotic. These mutations have also been shown to reduce susceptibility to ciprofloxacin.
ARO:3003926.label: Salmonella enterica gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3002639.definition: APH(3'')-Ib is an aminoglycoside phosphotransferase encoded by plasmids, transposons, integrative conjugative elements and chromosomes in Enterobacteriaceae and Pseudomonas spp.
ARO:3002639.label: APH(3'')-Ib

ARO:3002638.definition: APH(3'')-Ia is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside phosphotransferase in S. griseus
ARO:3002638.label: APH(3'')-Ia

ARO:3002981.definition: AmrAB is an RND efflux system that impairs aminoglycoside accumulation in clinical Burkholderia vietnamiensis strains
ARO:3002981.label: AmrAB-OprM

ARO:3002980.definition: Aspergillomarasmine A, a fungal natural product, has been shown to inhibit the NDM-1 and VIM-2 enzymes, restoring of the activity of meropenem against carbapenem-resistant pathogens possessing either NDM-1 or VIM-2.
ARO:3002980.label: aspergillomarasmine A

ARO:3002635.definition: APH(2'')-IIa is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside phosphotransferase in E. faecium and E. coli
ARO:3002635.label: APH(2'')-IIa

ARO:3002634.definition: APH(2'')-Ie is a plasmid or transposon-encoded aminoglycoside phosphotransferase in E. faecium and E. casseliflavus
ARO:3002634.label: APH(2'')-Ie

ARO:3002985.definition: arnA modifies lipid A with 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (Ara4N) which allows gram-negative bacteria to resist the antimicrobial activity of cationic antimicrobial peptides and antibiotics such as polymyxin. arnA is found in E. coli and P. aeruginosa.

ARO:3002984.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to polymyxin antibiotics, i.e. colistin.

ARO:3002987.definition: bcrA is an ABC transporter found in Bacillus licheniformis that confers bacitracin resistance

ARO:3003902.definition: Mutations to the active importer UhpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.

ARO:3003903.definition: Thusin is a two-component lantibiotic isolated from B. thuringiensis strain BGSC 4BT1, exhibiting antimicrobial activity against several Gram-positive pathogens. Bacillus cereus, Listeria monocytogenes, Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA), Staphylococcus sciuri, Enterococcus faecalis, and Streptococcus pneumoniae have all shown susceptibility to Thusin, with inhibition activities greater than Vancomycin or other lantibiotics.

ARO:3003900.definition: CyaA (adenylate cyclase) is involved with the synthesis of cyclic AMP which regulates the fosfomycin transporter glpT. As a result, mutations to cyaA confer resistance to fosfomycin.

ARO:3003901.definition: Mutations to the active importer GlpT, which is involved with the uptake of many phosphorylated sugars, confer resistance to fosfomycin by reducing import of the drug into the bacteria.

ARO:3002161.label: FOX-8

ARO:3002160.definition: FOX-7 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002160.label: FOX-7

ARO:3002167.label: MIR-4

ARO:3002166.label: MIR-1

ARO:3002164.definition: FOX-11 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of FOX beta-lactamases.
