ARO:3000675.definition: Pristinamycin IB is a class B streptogramin similar to pristinamycin IA, the former containing a N-methyl-4-(methylamino)phenylalanine instead of a N-methyl-4-(dimethylamino)phenylalanine in its class A streptogramin counterpart (one less methyl group).
ARO:3000675.label: pristinamycin IB

ARO:3000674.definition: Dalfopristin is a water-soluble semi-synthetic derivative of pristinamycin IIA. It is produced by Streptomyces pristinaespiralis and is used in combination with quinupristin in a 7:3 ratio. Both work together to inhibit protein synthesis, and is active against Gram-positive bacteria.
ARO:3000674.label: dalfopristin

ARO:3000677.definition: Virginiamycin S2 is a streptogramin B antibiotic.
ARO:3000677.label: virginiamycin S2

ARO:3000676.definition: H-NS is a histone-like protein involved in global gene regulation in Gram-negative bacteria. It is a repressor of the membrane fusion protein genes acrE, mdtE, and emrK as well as nearby genes of many RND-type multidrug exporters.
ARO:3000676.label: H-NS

ARO:3000671.definition: Tiamulin is a pleuromutilin derivative currently used in veterinary medicine. It binds to the 23 rRNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit to inhibit protein translation.
ARO:3000671.label: tiamulin

ARO:3000670.definition: Pleuromutilins are natural fungal products that target bacterial protein translation by binding the the 23S rRNA, blocking the ribosome P site at the 50S subunit. They are mostly used for agriculture and veterinary purposes.
ARO:3000670.label: pleuromutilin antibiotic

ARO:3000673.definition: Griseoviridin is a streptogramin A antibiotic.
ARO:3000673.label: griseoviridin

ARO:3000672.definition: Madumycin II is a streptogramin A antibiotic.
ARO:3000672.label: madumycin II

ARO:3000679.definition: Vernamycin C is a streptogramin B antibiotic.
ARO:3000679.label: vernamycin C

ARO:3000678.definition: Vernamycin B-gamma is a class B streptogramin derived from virginiamycin S1.
ARO:3000678.label: vernamycin B-gamma

ARO:3003308.definition: Point mutation in Escherichia coli parC resulting in fluoroquinolone resistance
ARO:3003308.label: Escherichia coli parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

ARO:3001020.definition: TEM-154 is a CMT-type, inhibitor-resistant, extended-spectrum beta-lactamase.
ARO:3001020.label: TEM-154

ARO:3001027.definition: TEM-161 is a beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
ARO:3001027.label: TEM-161

ARO:3001026.definition: TEM-160 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis.
ARO:3001026.label: TEM-160

ARO:3002295.definition: VIM-25 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of VIM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002295.label: VIM-25

ARO:3002294.definition: VIM-24 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002294.label: VIM-24

ARO:3002297.definition: VIM-27 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002297.label: VIM-27

ARO:3002296.definition: VIM-26 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of VIM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002296.label: VIM-26

ARO:3002291.definition: VIM-21 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of VIM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002291.label: VIM-21

ARO:3001757.definition: OXA-302 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter spp.
ARO:3001757.label: OXA-302

ARO:3003588.definition: The loss or reduction of the net negative charge within the cell wall of gram negative bacteria is a mechanism of resistance for cationic antimicrobials that depend on the negative charge for binding to the surface
ARO:3003588.label: charge alteration conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3002292.definition: VIM-22 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of VIM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002292.label: VIM-22

ARO:3004329.definition: Any Enterococcus faecium or Enterococcus faecalis that has tested resistant (R) to vancomycin
ARO:3004329.label: vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus

ARO:3003585.definition: A mutant phoP activates pmrHFIJKLM expression responsible for L-aminoarabinose synthesis and polymyxin resistance, by way of alteration of negative charge
ARO:3003585.label: Klebsiella mutant PhoP conferring antibiotic resistance to colistin

ARO:3002299.definition: VIM-29 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3002299.label: VIM-29

ARO:3002298.definition: VIM-28 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of VIM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002298.label: VIM-28

ARO:3003580.definition: Genes involved in alteration of the cell wall overall charge, leading to antimicrobial resistance due to reduced binding
ARO:3003580.label: gene altering cell wall charge

ARO:3003581.definition: These genes are involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane. Mutation by absence or insertion of ISAba11 sequence is a known cause of resistance in Acinetobacter baumannii▿.
ARO:3003581.label: Acinetobacter mutant Lpx gene conferring resistance to colistin

ARO:3003164.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
ARO:3003164.label: CTX-M-156

ARO:3003165.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
ARO:3003165.label: CTX-M-157

ARO:3003166.label: CTX-M-158

ARO:3003160.label: OXA-422

ARO:3003161.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
ARO:3003161.label: OXA-423

ARO:3003162.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
ARO:3003162.label: OXA-435

ARO:3003163.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
ARO:3003163.label: CTX-M-155

ARO:3000586.definition: Pulvomycin is a polyketide antibiotic that binds elongation factor Tu (EF-Tu) to inhibit protein biosynthesis by preventing the formation of the ternary complex (EF-Tu*GTP*aa-tRNA). Phenotypically, it was shown that pulvomycin sensitivity is dominant over resistance.
ARO:3000586.label: pulvomycin

ARO:3000584.definition: Quinupristin is a type B streptogramin and a semisynthetic derivative of pristinamycin 1A. It is a component of the drug Synercid and interacts with the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome to inhibit protein synthesis.
ARO:3000584.label: quinupristin

ARO:3000583.definition: Pristinamycin 1A is a type B streptogramin antibiotic produced by Streptomyces pristinaespiralis. It binds to the P site of the 50S subunit of the bacterial ribosome, preventing the extension of protein chains.
ARO:3000583.label: pristinamycin IA

ARO:3003169.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
ARO:3003169.label: CTX-M-161

ARO:3001858.definition: IMI-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Enterobacter cloacae
ARO:3001858.label: IMI-1

ARO:3001859.definition: IMI-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Enterobacteriaceae
ARO:3001859.label: IMI-2

ARO:3002344.definition: GES-15 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of GES beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002344.label: GES-15

ARO:3001323.definition: Phenelfamycin H is produced by Streptomyces albospinus strain Acta 3619. Phenelfamycin G and H are isomeric and similar to phenelfamycin E and F only with the addition of a hydroxyl group at position C-30. Phenelfamycin G and H have a narrow antibacterial spectrum with potent activity against Propionibacterium acnes.
ARO:3001323.label: phenelfamycin H

ARO:3002342.definition: GES-13 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002342.label: GES-13

ARO:0000016.definition: Aminoglycosides are a group of antibiotics that are mostly effective against Gram-negative bacteria. These molecules consist of aminated sugars attached to a dibasic cyclitol. Aminoglycosides work by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit (some work by binding to the 50S subunit), inhibiting the translocation of the peptidyl-tRNA from the A-site to the P-site and also causing misreading of mRNA, leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.
ARO:0000016.label: aminoglycoside antibiotic

ARO:0000017.definition: Lincosamides (e.g. lincomycin, clindamycin) are a class of drugs which bind to the 23s portion of the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes. This interaction inhibits early elongation of peptide chains by inhibiting the transpeptidase reaction, acting similarly to macrolides.
ARO:0000017.label: lincosamide antibiotic

ARO:0000014.definition: Gentamicin C is a mixture of gentamicin C1, gentamicin C1a, and gentamicin C2 (these differ in substituents at position C6'). Gentamicin works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.
ARO:0000014.label: gentamicin C

ARO:0000015.definition: Derived from penicillin to combat penicillin-resistance, methicillin is insensitive to beta-lactamases (also known as penicillinases) secreted by many penicillin-resistant bacteria. Methicillin is bactericidal, and acts by inhibiting the synthesis of the peptidoglycan layer of bacterial cell walls. The peptidoglycan layer is important for cell wall structural integrity, especially in Gram-positive organisms.
ARO:0000015.label: methicillin

ARO:0000012.definition: Streptothricins are a group of N-glycoside antibiotics that include a carbamoylated D-glucosamine to which are attached a series of L-beta-lysine residues at position 2 and a streptolidine at position 1.  Streptothricins vary by the number of beta-lysine residues (from 1 (nourseothricin) to 7) and target protein synthesis in bacteria and eukaryotes.
ARO:0000012.label: streptothricin

ARO:0000013.definition: Amikacin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic that works by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit, causing misreading of mRNA and leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.
ARO:0000013.label: amikacin

ARO:0000010.definition: Clusters of antibiotic resistance genes. May be regulated by a shared promoter or repressor.
ARO:0000010.label: antibiotic resistance gene cluster, cassette, or operon

ARO:0000011.definition: Cloxacillin is a semisynthetic, isoxazolyl penicillin derivative in the beta-lactam class of antibiotics. It interferes with peptidogylcan synthesis and is commonly used for treating penicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus infections.
ARO:0000011.label: cloxacillin

ARO:3000496.definition: VanXY is a protein with both D,D-carboxypeptidase and D,D-dipeptidase activity, found in Enterococcus gallinarum. It cleaves and removes the terminal D-Ala of peptidoglycan subunits for the incorporation of D-Ser by VanC. D-Ala-D-Ser has low binding affinity with vancomycin.
ARO:3000496.label: vanXY

ARO:0000018.definition: Viomycin sulfate (Viocin) is an polypeptide antibiotic used in the treatment of tuberculosis. It is produced by the actinomycete Streptomyces puniceus and binds to the bacterial ribosome, inhibiting prokaryotic protein synthesis and certain forms of RNA splicing.
ARO:0000018.label: viomycin

ARO:3004353.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3004353.label: PDC-90

ARO:3002369.definition: PER-7 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii
ARO:3002369.label: PER-7

ARO:3003763.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to the antibiotic drug, nitrofurantoin
ARO:3003763.label: determinant of nitrofuran resistance

ARO:3003760.definition: cls or cardiolipin synthase is an inner membrane protein involved in membrane synthesis and phosopholipid metabolism, with mutations to the gene being capable of conferring daptomycin resistance.
ARO:3003760.label: Enterococcus faecalis cls with mutation conferring resistance to daptomycin

ARO:3003761.definition: eatAv is a mutated form of the wildtype eatA ABC transporter gene isolated from Enterococcus faecium conferring resistance to lincosamides, streptogramin A's and pleuromutilins (LSaP phenotype).
ARO:3003761.label: eatAv

ARO:3003767.definition: Bacillus Cluster B mph are chromosomally-encoded macrolide phosphotransferases that inactivate 14-, 15- and 16-membered macrolides.
ARO:3003767.label: Bacillus Cluster B intrinsic mph

ARO:3003764.definition: Mechanism of antibiotic resistance conferred by deletion of gene (usually a porin)
ARO:3003764.label: resistance by absence

ARO:3000713.definition: Nucleic acids can also be targeted by antibiotics. These drugs are usually converted to an active form by enzymes unique to bacteria to prevent toxicity to the host.
ARO:3000713.label: nucleic acid targeted by antibiotic

ARO:3002361.definition: NDM-11 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of NDM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002361.label: NDM-11

ARO:3002360.definition: NDM-10 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of NDM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002360.label: NDM-10

ARO:3003768.definition: Deletion of gene or gene product results in resistance. For example, deletion of a porin gene blocks drug from entering the cell.
ARO:3003768.label: gene conferring resistance via absence

ARO:3002362.definition: NDM-12 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli.
ARO:3002362.label: NDM-12

ARO:3002365.definition: PER-3 is a beta-lactamase found in Aeromonas spp.
ARO:3002365.label: PER-3

ARO:3002364.definition: PER-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Salmonella typhimurium
ARO:3002364.label: PER-2

ARO:3002367.definition: PER-5 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3002367.label: PER-5

ARO:3002366.definition: PER-4 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of PER beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002366.label: PER-4

ARO:3003018.definition: dfrA22 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3003018.label: dfrA22

ARO:3004217.definition: SMB beta-lactamases are a subclass B3 beta-lactamases that hydrolyze a variety of beta-lactams, including penicillins, cephalosporins, and carbapenems.
ARO:3004217.label: SMB beta-lactamase

ARO:3000711.definition: Protein synthesis in bacteria is accomplished by cytosolic ribosomes that are structurally different from eukaryotic ribosomes, and thus a target for many antibiotics. By inhibiting ribosomal activity, either by directly binding to the ribosome or interacting with co-factors, antibiotics prevent protein synthesis.
ARO:3000711.label: protein synthesis machinery targeted by antibiotic

ARO:3003451.definition: Specific mutations that occurs on Mycobacterium tuberculosis iniC causing it to be ethambutol resistant.
ARO:3003451.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis iniC mutant conferring resistance to ethambutol

ARO:3000209.definition: ParY is part of a topoisomerase IV that is resistant to antibiotics that affect other topoisomerases.
ARO:3000209.label: antibiotic resistant DNA topoisomerase subunit parY

ARO:3003010.definition: ceoB is a cytoplasmic membrane component of the CeoAB-OpcM efflux pump
ARO:3003010.label: ceoB

ARO:3000716.definition: Mycolic acids are produced by mycobacteria. These fatty acids are required for the construction of cell walls. Enzymes that are targeted by antibiotics include synthases, elongases, and dehydrogenases.
ARO:3000716.label: mycolic acid synthesis enzyme targeted by antibiotic

ARO:3003012.definition: dfrA13 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3003012.label: dfrA13

ARO:3003013.definition: dfrA15 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Vibrio cholerae
ARO:3003013.label: dfrA15

ARO:3003014.definition: dfrA16 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3003014.label: dfrA16

ARO:3003015.definition: dfrA19 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3003015.label: dfrA19

ARO:3003016.definition: dfrA20 is a plasmid-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Pasteurella multocida
ARO:3003016.label: dfrA20

ARO:3000717.definition: Signal peptidase I is a bacterial signal peptidase that cleaves signal peptides from translated proteins. These signal peptides direct proteins to their destination, and then must be cleaved in order to function.
ARO:3000717.label: antibiotic sensitive signal peptidase I

ARO:3000714.definition: Enzymes in the folate synthesis pathway are targeted by two main classes of antibiotics: sulfonamides and diaminopyrimidines. Inhibition of these enzymes block the production of key precursors for nucleotides and amino acids.
ARO:3000714.label: folate synthesis enzyme targeted by antibiotic

ARO:3003258.definition: parY is a subunit of the topoisomerase IV. It decatenates and relaxes DNA to allow for transcription or translation.
ARO:3003258.label: antibiotic sensitive DNA topoisomerase subunit parY

ARO:3000299.definition: Stabilizes the C-P bond in phosphonopyruvate formed by phophoenolpyruvate mutase by catalyzing the self-removal of the carboxyl group.
ARO:3000299.label: phosphonopyruvate decarboxylase

ARO:3000715.definition: Enzymes in this pathway generate important precursors for macromolecules. While eukaryotes and prokaryotes both synthesize isoprenoids, many bacteria and notably mycobacteria use an alternative pathway that is targeted by antibiotics.
ARO:3000715.label: isoprenoid synthesis enzyme targeted by antibiotic

ARO:3001984.definition: CTX-M-125 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001984.label: CTX-M-125

ARO:3001985.definition: CTX-M-126 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001985.label: CTX-M-126

ARO:3001986.definition: CTX-M-127 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001986.label: CTX-M-127

ARO:3001987.definition: CTX-M-128 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001987.label: CTX-M-128

ARO:3001980.definition: CTX-M-121 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001980.label: CTX-M-121

ARO:3001981.definition: CTX-M-122 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001981.label: CTX-M-122

ARO:3001982.definition: CTX-M-123 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001982.label: CTX-M-123

ARO:3001983.definition: CTX-M-124 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001983.label: CTX-M-124

ARO:3000455.definition: Type A streptogramins are produced by a hybrid NRPS/PKS composed of 8 NRPS modules and 2 PKS modules.
ARO:3000455.label: streptogramin A biosynthesis

ARO:3000454.definition: Polymyxin B is mixture of mostly polymyxins B1 and B2, mainly used for resistant gram-negative infections. They are polypeptides with cationic detergent action on cell membranes.
ARO:3000454.label: polymyxin B

ARO:3000457.definition: ParE is a subunit of topoisomerase IV, which decatenates and relaxes DNA to allow access to genes for transcription or translation. Point mutations in ParE prevent anticoumarin antibiotics from inhibiting DNA synthesis, thus conferring resistance.
ARO:3000457.label: aminocoumarin resistant parE

ARO:3000456.definition: Derivative of Chloramphenicol. The nitro group (-NO2) is substituted by a sulfomethyl group (-SO2CH3).
ARO:3000456.label: thiamphenicol

ARO:3001988.definition: CTX-M-129 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001988.label: CTX-M-129

ARO:3000450.definition: Inactivation of an antibiotic via introduction a hydroxyl group (-OH).
ARO:3000450.label: hydroxylation of antibiotic conferring resistance

ARO:3000453.definition: vat (Virginiamycin acetyltransferases) enzymes catalyze the transfer of an acetyl group from acetyl-CoA to the secondary alcohol of streptogramin A compounds, thus inactivating virginiamycin-like antibiotics and conferring resistance to these compounds.
ARO:3000453.label: streptogramin vat acetyltransferase

ARO:3000452.definition: Fluoroquinolones inhibit type II and type IV topoisomerases (2 strand breaking enzymes) such as GyrA/GyrB and ParC/ParE. Point mutations in the associated gyrA and parC genes, in particular in the 'quinolone resistance determining region' (QRDR), give rise to resistance to the class.
ARO:3000452.label: fluoroquinolone resistant DNA topoisomerase

ARO:3003699.definition: MexQ is the inner membrane transporter of the multidrug efflux pump MexPQ-OpmE.
ARO:3003699.label: mexQ

ARO:3003259.definition: ParE is a subunit of topoisomerase IV, which decatenates and relaxes DNA to allow access to genes for transcription or translation. Targeting topoisomerase IV inhibits DNA synthesis, and may also lead to double-stranded cell breaks.
ARO:3003259.label: antibiotic sensitive DNA topoisomerase subunit parE

ARO:3004216.definition: A subclass B3 family of beta-lactamases that confer resistance to a range of beta-lactam antibiotics including penams, cephamycins, and cephalosporins.
ARO:3004216.label: AIM beta-lactamase

ARO:3003453.definition: Specific mutations that occurs on Mycobacterium tuberculosis embA leading to the lowered affinity of ethambutol to embA
ARO:3003453.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis embA mutant conferring resistance to ethambutol

ARO:3000206.definition: emrK is a membrane fusion protein that is a homolog of EmrA. Together with the inner membrane transporter EmrY and the outer membrane channel TolC, it mediates multidrug efflux.
ARO:3000206.label: emrK

ARO:3004358.definition: A family of class A beta-lactamase enzymes described in the gram-negative cocci Acidaminococcus fermentans.
ARO:3004358.label: ACI beta-lactamase

ARO:3004359.definition: A class A beta-lactamase described in Acidaminococcus fermentans. ACI-1 was the first description of a beta-lactamase enzyme in a gram-negative anaerobic cocci. Described by Galan et al 2000.
ARO:3004359.label: ACI-1

ARO:3004356.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3004356.label: PDC-93

ARO:3004357.definition: A chloramphenicol acetyltransferase identified in Brevibacillus brevis and shown to confer resistance to chloramphenicol antibiotics. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2017.
ARO:3004357.label: catV

ARO:3004354.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3004354.label: PDC-91

ARO:3004355.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3004355.label: PDC-92

ARO:3004352.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3004352.label: PDC-89

ARO:3000659.definition: Gatifloxacin is an 8-methoxy, 7-piperazinyl, 6-fluoroquinolone that can be taken orally or by intravenous administration. It is active against most Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, but inactive against non-fermenting Gram-negative rods including Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3000659.label: gatifloxacin

ARO:3004350.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3004350.label: PDC-87

ARO:3004351.definition: An AmpC-like beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3004351.label: PDC-88

ARO:3000658.definition: Lividomycins are aminoglycosidic antibiotics produced by Streptomyces lividus. They contain 2-amino-2,3-dideoxy-D-glucose.
ARO:3000658.label: lividomycin

ARO:3004421.definition: Greater than 5 x 105 cfu/mL for broth dilution and 104 cfu/mL for agar dilution.
ARO:3004421.label: greater than standard inoculum

ARO:3003455.definition: Point mutation in the M.tuberculosis embR results in increased resistance to ethambutol
ARO:3003455.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis embR mutant conferring resistance to ethambutol

ARO:3001404.definition: OXA-9 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae.
ARO:3001404.label: OXA-9

ARO:3000068.definition: DHA beta-lactamases are plasmid-mediated AmpC β-lactamases that confer resistance to cephamycins and oxyimino-cephalosporins.
ARO:3000068.label: DHA beta-lactamase

ARO:3000069.definition: CMY beta-lactamases are plasmid-mediated class C beta-lactamases that encodes for resistance to cephamycins.
ARO:3000069.label: CMY beta-lactamase

ARO:3000066.definition: GES beta-lactamases or Guiana extended-spectrum beta-lactamases are related to the other plasmid-located class A beta-lactamases
ARO:3000066.label: GES beta-lactamase

ARO:3000067.definition: FOX beta-lactamases are plasmid-encoded AmpC-type beta-lactamase which conferred resistance to broad-spectrum cephalosporins and cephamycins
ARO:3000067.label: FOX beta-lactamase

ARO:3000060.definition: IND beta-lactamases are class B carbapenem-hydrolyzing beta-lactamases
ARO:3000060.label: IND beta-lactamase

ARO:3001406.definition: OXA-11 is a beta-lactamase found in P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3001406.label: OXA-11

ARO:3004109.definition: rob is a positive regulator for the acrAB efflux genes, and is structurally similar to SoxS and MarA.
ARO:3004109.label: Escherichia coli rob

ARO:3004108.definition: rob is a positive regulator for the acrAB efflux genes, and is structurally similar to SoxS and MarA.
ARO:3004108.label: Enterobacter cloacae rob

ARO:3004107.definition: SoxR is a redox-sensitive transcriptional activator that induces expression of a small regulon that includes the RND efflux pump-encoding operon mexGHI-opmD. SoxR was shown to be activated by pyocyanin.
ARO:3004107.label: Pseudomonas aeruginosa soxR

ARO:3004106.definition: TMB-2 is a TMB metallo-beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter sp.
ARO:3004106.label: TMB-2

ARO:3004105.definition: TMB-1 is a TMB metallo-beta-lactamase found in Achromobacter sp.
ARO:3004105.label: TMB-1

ARO:3004104.definition: TMB-1, the first known member of the Tripoli metallo-beta-lactamase family (TMB) was isolated from Achromobacter xylosoxidans in a Tripoli central hospital. TMB-1 was located on a class 1 integron and is a chromosomally-encoded beta-lactamase capable of hydrolyzing multiple antibiotics.
ARO:3004104.label: TMB beta-lactamase

ARO:3004103.definition: QepA2 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance pump found in an Escherichia coli isolate from France
ARO:3004103.label: QepA2

ARO:3004102.definition: Methyltransferase enzyme first described in Streptoalloteichus tenebrarius. Confers resistance to aminoglycoside antibiotics (esp. apramycin) through methylation of the 16S rRNA at A1408, thereby modifying the antibiotic target.
ARO:3004102.label: kamB

ARO:3004101.definition: MdtNOP is a MFS efflux pump protein found in E. coli. The deletion of mdtP from strain W3110 resulted in increased susceptibility to acriflavin, puromycin, and tetraphenylarsonium chloride. An E. coli mdtN null mutant is more sensitive to sulfur drugs than wild type
ARO:3004101.label: MdtNOP

ARO:3004100.definition: LpeB is a subunit of the LpeAB efflux pump in Legionella pneumophila, which is homologous to AcrB in E. coli.
ARO:3004100.label: LpeB

ARO:3000111.definition: Novobiocin is an aminocoumarin antibiotic produced by Streptomyces spheroides and Streptomyces niveus, and binds DNA gyrase subunit B inhibiting ATP-dependent DNA supercoiling.
ARO:3000111.label: novobiocin

ARO:3000112.definition: Directed pumping of antibiotic out of a cell to confer resistance. Multidrug and toxic compound extrusion (MATE) transporters utilize the cationic gradient across the membrane as an energy source. Although there is a diverse substrate specificity, almost all MATE transporters recognize fluoroquinolones. Arciflavine, ethidium and aminoglycosides are also good substrates.
ARO:3000112.label: multidrug and toxic compound extrusion (MATE) transporter

ARO:3000113.definition: Vga-type efflux proteins are expressed in staphylococci that confer resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
ARO:3000113.label: vga

ARO:3000114.definition: Kinases that modify aminoglycoside antibiotics by phosphorylation using NTPs as cofactor
ARO:3000114.label: aminoglycoside phosphotransferase (APH)

ARO:3000115.definition: ParE is a subunit of topoisomerase IV, which decatenates and relaxes DNA to allow access to genes for transcription or translation. Mutations in ParE prevents antibiotics from inhibiting DNA synthesis, thus conferring resistance.
ARO:3000115.label: antibiotic resistant DNA topoisomerase subunit parE

ARO:3000116.definition: VanZ is a teicoplanin resistance gene that is an accessory protein. VanZ prevents the incorporation of the terminal D-Ala into peptidoglycan subunits.
ARO:3000116.label: vanZ

ARO:3000117.definition: A47934 is an 'aglycone' glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Streptomyces toyocaensis. It is a teicoplanin-like glycopeptide.
ARO:3000117.label: antibiotic A47934

ARO:3000118.definition: Vga(B) is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
ARO:3000118.label: vgaB

ARO:3000119.definition: Edeines are basic linear peptides produced by Bacillus brevis Vm4. They have antibacterial as well as antifungal, antiviral, and anticancer properties. Edeines are bacteriostatic and bacteriocidal at low and high concentrations, respectively. They are able to inhibit DNA synthesis and protein translation. These compounds are synthesized by nonribosomal peptide synthetases and contain numerous unusual amino acids.
ARO:3000119.label: edeine

ARO:3004210.definition: This type of Subclass B2 beta-lactamases was first identified from a Serratia fonticola environmental isolate.
ARO:3004210.label: SFH beta-lactamase

ARO:3003393.definition: inhA is a enoyl-acyl carrier reductase used in lipid metabolism and farry acid biosynthesis. It is inhibited by isoniazid. mutations in the promoter region or multiple copies of the inhA shows marked resistance to isoniazid mediated inhibition of mycolic acid biosynthesis.
ARO:3003393.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis inhA mutations conferring resistance to isoniazid

ARO:3002982.definition: amrA is the efflux pump subunit of the AmrAB-OprM multidrug efflux complex. amrA corresponds to 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 and 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
ARO:3002982.label: amrA

ARO:3003447.definition: Mutations that occurs on the iniA genes resulting in the resistance to ethambutol
ARO:3003447.label: Ethambutol resistant iniA

ARO:3003998.definition: An antibiotic mixture containing the penicillin-derived beta-lactam antibiotic Ampicillin and the beta-lactamase inhibitor Sulbactam. Also known as Unasyn and/or Ampictam.
ARO:3003998.label: ampicillin-sulbactam

ARO:3002970.definition: vanTC is a vanT variant found in the vanC gene cluster
ARO:3002970.label: vanTC

ARO:3002971.definition: vanTE is a vanT variant found in the vanE gene cluster
ARO:3002971.label: vanTE

ARO:3002972.definition: vanTG is a vanT variant found in the vanG gene cluster
ARO:3002972.label: vanTG

ARO:3002973.definition: vanTmL is a vanT variant found in the vanL gene cluster. vanTmL codes for the membrane-binding domain of vanTL
ARO:3002973.label: vanTmL

ARO:3003115.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases. Not yet released.
ARO:3003115.label: OXA-427

ARO:3002974.definition: vanTrL is a vanT variant found in the vanL gene cluster. vanTrL codes for the racemase component of vanT
ARO:3002974.label: vanTrL

ARO:3003997.definition: An antibiotic cocktail containing the beta-lactam antibiotic Amoxicillin and the beta-lactamase inhibitor Clavulanic Acid (potassium clavulanate).
ARO:3003997.label: amoxicillin-clavulanic acid

ARO:3002975.definition: vanTN is a vanT variant found in the vanN gene cluster
ARO:3002975.label: vanTN

ARO:3001221.definition: A macrolide antibiotic from Streptomyces narbonensis subsp. josamyceticus. The drug has antimicrobial activity against a wide spectrum of pathogens.
ARO:3001221.label: josamycin

ARO:3001220.definition: Factumycin is a kirromycin-like antibiotic produced by Kitasatospora setae and Streptomyces strains. Its biosynthetic cluster has been characterized which has interesting acetyl transferase domains in trans, or outside of the polyketide synthase domains. Factumycin has specific, rather than broad spectrum,  antibacterial properties, especially targeting various Acinetobacter baumanii strains.
ARO:3001220.label: factumycin

ARO:3001227.definition: Kitasamycin is a macrolide antibiotic and is produced by Streptoverticillium kitasatoense. The drug has antimicrobial activity against a wide spectrum of pathogens.
ARO:3001227.label: kitasamycin

ARO:3001228.definition: Produced by Streptomyces halstedii and Streptomyces thermotolerans.
ARO:3001228.label: carbomycin

ARO:3002601.definition: ANT(3'')-Ia is an aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase gene encoded by plasmids, transposons, integrons in Enterobacteriaceae, A. baumannii, P. aeruginosa and Vibrio cholerae
ARO:3002601.label: aadA

ARO:3002978.definition: van ligases that synthesize D-Ala-D-Lac, an alternative peptidoglycan substrate that confers resistance to vancomycin
ARO:3002978.label: D-Ala-D-Lac ligase

ARO:3000669.definition: Pristinamycin IIA is a streptogramin A antibiotic.
ARO:3000669.label: pristinamycin IIA

ARO:3002786.definition: QnrB74 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002786.label: QnrB74

ARO:3000662.definition: Norfloxacin is a 6-fluoro, 7-piperazinyl quinolone with a wide range of activity against Gram-negative bacteria. It is inactive against most anaerobes.
ARO:3000662.label: norfloxacin

ARO:3000663.definition: Ofloxacin is a 6-fluoro, 7-piperazinyl quinolone with a methyl-substituted oxazine ring. It has a broad spectrum of activity including many enterobacteria and mycoplasma but most anaerobes are resistant.
ARO:3000663.label: ofloxacin

ARO:3000660.definition: Lomefloxacin is a difluoropiperazinyl quinolone, sharing similar activities with other fluoroquinolones. It is used to treat urinary tract infections. Relative to other fluoroquinolones, it has a longer half life and has higher serum concentrations.
ARO:3000660.label: lomefloxacin

ARO:3000661.definition: Nalidixic acid is a quinolone derivative of naphthyridine active against many enterobacteria, but ineffective against Ps aeruginosa, Gram-positive bacteria, and anaerobes. Acquired resistance is common in nalidixic acid treatments.
ARO:3000661.label: nalidixic acid

ARO:3000666.definition: Sparfloxacin is a dimethylpiperazinyl difluoroquinolone that acts by inhibiting DNA gyrase. It is active against aerobic Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, as well as some mycobacteria. It has moderate activity against some anaerobes.
ARO:3000666.label: sparfloxacin

ARO:3000667.definition: Demeclocycline is a tetracycline analog with 7-chloro and 6-methyl groups. Due to its fast absorption and slow excretion, it maintains higher effective blood levels compared to other tetracyclines.
ARO:3000667.label: demeclocycline

ARO:3000664.definition: Trovafloxacin is a trifluoroquinalone with a broad spectrum of activity that acts by inhibiting the uncoiling of supercoiled DNA. While potent against many Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, it is less active against pseudomonads and Cl. difficile. It is usually taken as the prodrug trovafloxacin mesylate or alatrofloxacin mesylate for oral or intravenous administration, respectively.
ARO:3000664.label: trovafloxacin

ARO:3003803.definition: agrA is an autoinducer in a peptide-quorum two-component regulatory system whose mutations confer daptomycin resistance.

ARO:3003802.definition: Mutations to the gdpD glycerolphosphodiesterase confer resistance to daptomycin.

ARO:3003377.label: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrnB) mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin

ARO:3003804.definition: Mutations to the regulatory gene agrA confer daptomycin resistance.

ARO:3003579.label: basRS

ARO:3003578.definition: PmrF is required for the synthesis and transfer of 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (Ara4N) to Lipid A, which allows gram-negative bacteria to resist the antimicrobial activity of cationic antimicrobial peptides and antibiotics such as polymyxin. pmrF corresponds to 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 and 1 locus in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
ARO:3003578.label: PmrF

ARO:3003399.definition: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of helix 44, in the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to kanamycin A
ARO:3003399.label: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to kanamycin A

ARO:3003398.definition: Undecaprenyl phosphate is a universal lipid carrier of glycan biosynthetic intermediates for carbohydrate polymers that are exported to the bacterial cell envelope. Antibiotics that targets this compound or proteins associated with the production of this compound leads to cell death.
ARO:3003398.label: undecaprenyl pyrophosphate related proteins

ARO:3000598.definition: Erm(31) confers a MLSb resistant phenotype. Along with erm(30), these genes are responsible for self-resistance in the pikromycin/narbomycin/methymycin/neomethymycin producer, Streptomyces venezuelae.
ARO:3000598.label: Erm(31)

ARO:3003713.definition: VCC-1 is a Class A carbapenemase isolated from Vibrio cholerae and exhibits resistance to penicillins, carbapenems and monobactam antibiotics.
ARO:3003713.label: VCC-1

ARO:3000594.definition: ErmR is a methyltransferase found in the erythromycin producer Aeromicrobium erythreum. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the erythromycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.
ARO:3000594.label: ErmR

ARO:3000596.definition: ErmX is a rRNA methyltransferase that protects the ribosome from inactivation due to antibiotic binding.
ARO:3000596.label: ErmX

ARO:3003390.definition: The Escherichia coli ompF (oprF) is a nonspecific porin channel involved in the membrane translocation of small hydrophilic molecules, including and especially beta-lactam antibiotics. Mutations in ompF can decrease diffusion of antibiotics across the cellular membrane, thereby decreasing overall susceptibility through absence of porin function.
ARO:3003390.label: Escherichia coli ompF with mutation conferring resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics

ARO:3000590.definition: NDM-2 was isolated from a strain of Acinetobacter baumannii in Germany from a patient hospitalized in Cairo.  A single amino acid substitution (P28R) differentiates this gene from NDM-1 and the two enzymes appear to have an identical spectrum of hydrolysis.
ARO:3000590.label: NDM-2

ARO:3000591.definition: ErmI is a methyltransferase found in the midecamycin producer Streptomyces mycarofaciens. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the midecamycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance
ARO:3000591.label: ErmI

ARO:3000592.definition: ErmN is a methyltransferase found in the tylosin producer Streptomyces fradiae. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is found in the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance to tylosin.
ARO:3000592.label: ErmN

ARO:3002789.definition: QnrD2 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3002789.label: QnrD2

ARO:3002172.definition: MIR-7 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of MIR beta-lactamases.

ARO:3004315.definition: Any E.coli that has tested resistant (R) to at least one of the following: ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin, and moxifloxacin.
ARO:3004315.label: fluoroquinolone-resistant Escherichia coli

ARO:0001004.definition: Enzymatic inactivation of antibiotic to confer drug resistance.
ARO:0001004.label: antibiotic inactivation

ARO:0001002.definition: Replacement or substitution of antibiotic action target, which process will result in antibiotic resistance.
ARO:0001002.label: antibiotic target replacement

ARO:0001003.definition: Protection of antibiotic action target from antibiotic binding, which process will result in antibiotic resistance.
ARO:0001003.label: antibiotic target protection

ARO:0001001.definition: Mutational alteration or enzymatic modification of antibiotic target which results in antibiotic resistance.

MexV is the membrane fusion protein; MexW is the RND-type membrane protein; and OprM is the outer membrane channel. MexVW-OprM is associated with resistance to fluoroquinolones, tetracycline, chloramphenicol, erythromycin and acriflavine.

ARO:3000282.definition: Sulfonamides are broad spectrum, synthetic antibiotics that contain the sulfonamide group. Sulfonamides inhibit dihydropteroate synthase, which catalyzes the conversion of p-aminobenzoic acid to dihydropteroic acid as part of the tetrahydrofolic acid biosynthetic pathway. Tetrahydrofolic acid is essential for folate synthesis, a precursor of many nucleotides and amino acids. Many sulfamides are taken with trimethoprim, an inhibitor of dihydrofolate reductase, also disturbing the trihydrofolic acid synthesis pathway.
ARO:3000282.label: sulfonamide antibiotic

ARO:3000284.definition: Tetroxoprim is a trimethoprim derivative that inhibits bacterial dihydrofolate reductase.
ARO:3000284.label: tetroxoprim

ARO:3003958.definition: Oleic acid is a fatty acid that occurs naturally in various animal and vegetable fats and oils. Oleic acid is found to have antibacterial activity, particularly in inhibiting the growth of several Gram-positive bacterial species.
ARO:3003958.label: oleic acid

ARO:3003811.definition: AdeC is the outer membrane factor of the AdeABC multidrug efflux complex. It can be replaced by other outer membrane channels, and is not essential for antibiotic resistance.
ARO:3003811.label: adeC

ARO:3000444.definition: The enzymatic inactivation of rifampin by phosphorylation at the 21-OH position.

ARO:3003210.definition: fosA4 is an enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule.

ARO:3002841.label: vatB

ARO:3003211.definition: Many antibiotics inhibit the growth of bacteria by blocking protein synthesis on the ribosome. The antibiotic-binding sites are located within functionally important structures in the ribosomal RNA. Antibiotic resistance is often conferred by base substitutions or methylations at these sites in the rRNA. Point mutations in the bacterial 16S ribosomal RNA in the small 30S subunit can confer resistance to antibiotics.
ARO:3003211.label: 16S rRNA with mutation conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3004081.definition: The AcrAD-TolC efflux pump system in E. coli confers resistance to amikacin, gentamicin, and tobramycin.
ARO:3004081.label: AcrAD-TolC confers resistance to amikacin, gentamicin, and tobramycin

ARO:3003241.definition: Teixobactin is a peptide antibiotic isolated from the Gram-negative bacteria, Eleftheria terrae. It inhibits the synthesis of peptidoglycan by interacting with peptidoglycan precursor, Lipid II and Lipid III.
ARO:3003241.label: teixobactin

ARO:3002771.definition: QnrB58 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Citrobacter freundii
ARO:3002771.label: QnrB58

ARO:3002777.definition: QnrB65 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Citrobacter freundii
ARO:3002777.label: QnrB65

ARO:3000050.definition: These antibiotics are derived from tetracycline, a polyketide antibiotic that inhibits the 30S subunit of bacterial ribosomes.
ARO:3000050.label: tetracycline antibiotic

ARO:3000053.definition: Peptide antibiotics have a wide range of antibacterial mechanisms, depending on the amino acids that make up the antibiotic, although most act to disrupt the cell membrane in some manner. Subclasses of peptide antibiotics can include additional sidechains of other types, such as lipids in the case of the lipopeptide antibiotics.
ARO:3000053.label: peptide antibiotic

ARO:3000052.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to phenicol (chloramphenicol) antibiotics. These include chloramphenicol acetyltransferase (CAT) enzymes, which are found in a large number of species.
ARO:3000052.label: determinant of phenicol resistance

ARO:3000055.definition: SME beta-lactamases are chromosome-mediated class A beta-lactamases that hydrolyze carbapenems in Serratia marcescens.
ARO:3000055.label: SME beta-lactamase

ARO:3000054.definition: Acridine dyes are cell permeable, basic molecules with an acridine chromophore. These compounds intercalate DNA. The image shown represents the core structure of the acridine family, with specific dyes containing varying substituents.
ARO:3000054.label: acridine dye

ARO:3000057.definition: NDM beta-lactamases or New Delhi metallo-beta-lactamases are class B beta-lactamases that confer resistance to a broad range of antibiotics including carbapenems, cephalosporins and penicillins.
ARO:3000057.label: NDM beta-lactamase

ARO:3000056.definition: PER beta-lactamases are plasmid-mediated extended spectrum beta-lactamases found in the Enterobacteriaceae family.
ARO:3000056.label: PER beta-lactamase

ARO:3000059.definition: Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenem resistant (KPC) beta-lactamases are notorious for their ability to efficiently hydrolyze carbapenems, unlike other Ambler Class A beta-lactamases.  There are currently 9 variants reported worldwide.  These enzymes were first isolated from Klebsiella pneumoniae strains in 2001 in the United States.  Hospital outbreaks have since been reported in Greece and Israel and KPC carrying strains are now endemic to New York facilities.  KPC-1 and KPC-2 have been shown to be identical and are now referred to as KPC-2.
ARO:3000059.label: KPC beta-lactamase

ARO:3000058.definition: MIR beta-lactamases are plasmid-mediated beta-lactamases that confer resistance to oxyimino- and alpha-methoxy beta-lactams
ARO:3000058.label: MIR beta-lactamase

ARO:3002775.definition: QnrB62 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Citrobacter freundii
ARO:3002775.label: QnrB62

ARO:3002672.definition: cat86 is a chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Bacillus pumilus
ARO:3002672.label: cat86

ARO:3003458.definition: Specific mutations that occurs on Mycobacterium tuberculosis ethA causing it to be ethionamide resistant
ARO:3003458.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis ethA with mutation conferring resistance to ethionamide

ARO:3002671.definition: cat-TC is a plasmid-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Lactobacillus reuteri
ARO:3002671.label: cat-TC

ARO:3002670.definition:
cat is used to describe many variants of the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase gene in a range of organisms including Acinetobacter calcoaceticus, Agrobacterium tumefaciens, Bacillus clausii, Bacillus subtilis, Campylobacter coli, Enterococcus faecalis, Enterococcus faecium, Lactococcus lactis, Listeria monocytogenes, Listonella anguillarum
Morganella morganii, Photobacterium damselae subsp. piscicida, Proteus mirabilis, Salmonella typhi, Serratia marcescens, Shigella flexneri, Staphylococcus aureus, Staphylococcus haemolyticus, Staphylococcus intermedius, Streptococcus agalactiae, Streptococcus suis and Streptomyces acrimycini
ARO:3002670.label: cat

ARO:3004450.definition: A class C beta-lactamase enzyme identified from Aeromonas enteropelogenes. TRU-1 confers resistance to penicillin and cephalosporin antibiotics.
ARO:3004450.label: TRU-1

ARO:3002676.definition: catB3 is a plasmid or chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Salmonella typhimurium, Acinetobacter baumannii and Escherichia coli
ARO:3002676.label: catB3

ARO:3004060.definition: Type B NfxB mutants are more resistant to tetracycline and chloramphenicol, as well as ofloxacin, erythromycin, and the new zwitterionic cephems, than was PAO1, and they are four to eight times more susceptible to carbenicillin, sulbenicillin, imipenem, panipenem, biapenem, moxalactam, aztreonam, gentamicin, and kanamycin than PAO1. The mutation at the 46th amino acid position is sufficient for overproduction of OprJ and the multidrug resistance. nfxB corresponds to 2 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 (gene name: esrC/nfxB) and 2 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58 (gene name: nfxB).
ARO:3004060.label: Type B NfxB

ARO:3002675.definition: catB2 is a plasmid-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Escherichia coli, Salmonella enteritidis and Pasteurella multocida
ARO:3002675.label: catB2

ARO:3004061.definition: MexCD–OprJ with type A NfxB phenotype are four to eight times more resistant to ofloxacin, erythromycin, and new zwitterionic cephems, i.e., cefpirome, cefclidin, cefozopran, and cefoselis, than the parent strain, PAO1.
ARO:3004061.label: MexCD-OprJ with type A NfxB mutation

ARO:3002674.definition: catB is a chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Clostridium butyricum
ARO:3002674.label: catB

ARO:3004062.definition: MexCD-OprJ with Type B NfxB mutions are more resistant to tetracycline and chloramphenicol, as well as ofloxacin, erythromycin, and the new zwitterionic cephems, than was PAO1, and they are four to eight times more susceptible to carbenicillin, sulbenicillin, imipenem, panipenem, biapenem, moxalactam, aztreonam, gentamicin, and kanamycin than PAO1.
ARO:3004062.label: MexCD-OprJ with type B NfxB mutation

ARO:3003256.definition: ParC is a subunit of topoisomerase IV, which decatenates and relaxes DNA to allow access to genes for transcription or translation. Targeting topoisomerase IV inhibits DNA synthesis, and may also lead to double-stranded cell breaks.
ARO:3003256.label: antibiotic sensitive DNA topoisomerase subunit parC

ARO:3004063.definition: EdeQ is an N-acetyltransferase enzyme that confers high-level self-resistance to edeine in Brevibacillus brevis, a natural edeine producer. EdeQ converts active edeine to N-acetyledeine, which is ineffective in vivo.
ARO:3004063.label: EdeQ

ARO:3004118.definition: A ToxR negatively regulated outer membrane porin. In Vibrio cholerae, ToxR controls resistance to P2 (a BPI-derived antimicrobial peptide) by regulating the production of OmpT, especially in the absence of OmpU.
ARO:3004118.label: Vibrio cholerae OmpT

ARO:3004114.definition: In the presence of antibiotic stress, there is a coupled down-regulation of the porin OmpC with the OmpF.  Mutants both lacking both OmpC and OmpF proteins are resistant to cephaloridine and cefazolin. Analyses of genes involved in the increased resistance to tetracycline suggest that the up-regulation of efflux pump genes is accompanied by a decrease of OmpF and OmpC synthesis. Homologs of OmpC have been identified in Escherichia coli, Salmonella enterica, Enterobacter aerogenes and Serratia marcescens.
ARO:3004114.label: porin OmpC

ARO:3004115.definition: Nitroimidazoles are a group of drugs that have both antiprotozoal and antibacterial activity, classified with respect to the location of the nitro functional group.
ARO:3004115.label: nitroimidazole antibiotic

ARO:3004116.definition: Nitrofurans are chemotherapeutic agents with antibacterial and antiprotozoal activity.
ARO:3004116.label: nitrofuran antibiotic

ARO:3004117.definition: A ToxR-Regulated outer membrane porin. In Vibrio cholerae, ToxR controls resistance to P2 (a BPI-derived antimicrobial peptide) by regulating the production of OmpU. OmpU also confers resistance to polymyxin B sulfate.
ARO:3004117.label: Vibrio cholerae OmpU

ARO:3004110.definition: MCR-2 is a plasmid-borne phosphoethanolamine transferase that interferes with binding of colistin to the cell membrane via addition of phosphoethanolamine to lipid A, resulting in reduction of the negative charge of the cell membrane. Originally identified in a Belgian sample of Escherichia coli by Xavier et al, (2016).
ARO:3004110.label: MCR-2

ARO:3004111.definition: fosA6 is a plasmid-encoded enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule.
ARO:3004111.label: FosA6

ARO:3003017.definition: dfrA21 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3003017.label: dfrA21

ARO:3004113.definition: fosA7 is an enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Escherichia coli by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule.
ARO:3004113.label: FosA7

ARO:3000125.definition: The use of different nucleophilic molecules by enzymes can break up the epoxide ring of fosfomycin and render the molecule ineffective.
ARO:3000125.label: hydrolysis of fosfomycin epoxide ring

ARO:3000124.definition: mecI acts as a repressor of transcription of the mecA/mecR1/mecI operon.
ARO:3000124.label: mecI

ARO:3000127.definition: Phosphorylation of streptomycin on the hydroxyl group at position 3''
ARO:3000127.label: APH(3'')

ARO:3000126.definition: Phosphorylation of 2-deoxystreptamine aminoglycosides on the hydroxyl group at position 3'
ARO:3000126.label: APH(3')

ARO:3000121.definition: Aminoglycoside acetyltransferase enzymes modify aminoglycoside antibiotics by catalyzing the transfer of an acetyl group to one of the amino groups present in aminoglycosides, using acetyl coenzyme A as a donor substrate.
ARO:3000121.label: aminoglycoside acetyltransferase (AAC)

ARO:3000120.definition: Balhimycin is a vancomycin-like glycopeptide antibiotic produced by Amycolatopsis balhimycina. It binds to the terminal Lys-D-Ala-D-Ala of peptidoglycan precursors.
ARO:3000120.label: balhimycin

ARO:3000123.definition: Gramicidins are a family of antibiotics synthesized by Bacillus brevis. It includes the linear pentadecapeptides gramicidin A, B and C that make up the mixture gramicidin D. Gramicidin S is a cyclic peptide chain. Gramicidins are also components of tyrothricins, another mixture of antibiotics produced by Bacillus brevis.
ARO:3000123.label: gramicidin

ARO:3000122.definition: Inactivates chloramphenicol by addition of an acyl group. cat is used to describe many variants of the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase gene in a range of organisms including Acinetobacter calcoaceticus, Agrobacterium tumefaciens, Bacillus clausii, Bacillus subtilis, Campylobacter coli, Enterococcus faecalis, Enterococcus faecium, Lactococcus lactis, Listeria monocytogenes, Listonella anguillarum Morganella morganii, Photobacterium damselae subsp. piscicida, Proteus mirabilis, Salmonella typhi, Serratia marcescens, Shigella flexneri, Staphylococcus aureus, Staphylococcus haemolyticus, Staphylococcus intermedius, Streptococcus agalactiae, Streptococcus suis and Streptomyces acrimycini
ARO:3000122.label: chloramphenicol acetyltransferase (CAT)

ARO:3004067.definition: Subclass B1 (metallo-) beta-lactamases found in Myroides spp., which confer resistance to carbapenam class beta-lactamase antibiotics.
ARO:3004067.label: MUS beta-lactamase

ARO:3000129.definition: Enzymes, other proteins or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics.
ARO:3000129.label: determinant of beta-lactam resistance

ARO:3000128.definition: Phosphorylation of 2-deoxystreptamine aminoglycosides on the hydroxyl group at position 2''
ARO:3000128.label: APH(2'')

ARO:3000575.definition: VanU is a transcriptional activator of vancomycin resistance genes.
ARO:3000575.label: vanU

ARO:3002150.definition: DHA-19 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of DHA beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002150.label: DHA-19

ARO:3002849.definition: arr-4 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002849.label: arr-4

ARO:3002151.definition: DHA-20 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of DHA beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002151.label: DHA-20

ARO:3001236.definition: Efrotomycin is produced by Streptomyces lactamodurans NRRL 3802. This kirromycin-like antibiotic is used in animal agriculture, especially in the production of swine. Generally gram negative bacteria are susceptible to efrotomycin, while gram positive bacteria are resistant.
ARO:3001236.label: efrotomycin

ARO:3001237.definition:
GE2270A is the model molecule of cyclic thiazolyl peptide elfamycins. 
GE2270A is produced by Planobispora rosea. Biosynthesis of the molecule has been shown to originate as a ribosomally synthesized peptide that undergoes significant post-translational modification. Clinical use of cyclic thiazolyl peptides is hindered by their low water solubility and bioavailability.
ARO:3001237.label: GE2270A

ARO:3001234.definition: Kirromycin, also known as mocimycin, is the representative molecule of its own class of elfamycins which is composed of more than 10 analogs. Kirromycin binds to the domain 1,2 interface of elongation factor Tu. This interaction maintains the EF-Tu*GTP conformation even after GTP is hydrolyzed to GDP. EF-Tu*GDP normally releases aa-tRNA and then exits the ribosome; however, kirromycin*EF-Tu*GDP*aa-tRNA forms a strong complex and remains bound to the ribosome, prohibits translocation of the peptide chain and translation is halted.
ARO:3001234.label: kirromycin

ARO:3001235.definition: Aurodox is an elongation factor Tu inhibiting antibiotic. It was first referred to as X-5108. It is produced by Streptomyces goldiniensis var. goldiniensis and is active primarily against gram-positive bacteria.
ARO:3001235.label: aurodox

ARO:3001231.definition: Produced by Streptomyces caelestis, which also produces the macrolide niddamycin.
ARO:3001231.label: celesticetin

ARO:3003920.label: pgpB

ARO:3002688.label: catS

ARO:3003968.definition: Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. In beta-lactam-resistant Klebsiella, this porin is often deleted, limiting diffusion of the antibiotic into the cell. Klebsiella strains expressing OmpK36 are often beta-lactam sensitive even in the presence of beta-lactamases because of an inefficient mechanism.
ARO:3003968.label: Klebsiella pneumoniae OmpK36

ARO:3003969.definition: lmrP is a proton motive force-dependent drug transporter that is part of the MFS efflux pump family.
ARO:3003969.label: lmrP

ARO:3003785.definition: Chlamydia murA confers intrinsic resistance to fosfomycin. The presence of an aspartic acid residue in place of the critical cysteine at position 119 that enables fosfomycin binding is believed to be responsible for this intrinsic resistance.
ARO:3003785.label: Chlamydia trachomatis intrinsic murA conferring resistance to fosfomycin

ARO:3003964.definition: hp1181 is a translocase that is part of the MFS efflux pump family. It is found in H. pylori and has role in the active efflux of antibiotics.
ARO:3003964.label: hp1181

ARO:3003965.definition: hp1184 is a translocase that belongs to the MATE efflux pump family. It is found in H. pylori and is involved in the active efflux of antibiotics.
ARO:3003965.label: hp1184

ARO:3003966.definition: Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. In beta-lactam-resistant Klebsiella, this porin is often deleted, limiting diffusion of the antibiotic into the cell. Klebsiella strains expressing OmpK35 are often beta-lactam sensitive even in the presence of beta-lactamases because of an inefficient mechanism.
ARO:3003966.label: Klebsiella pneumoniae OmpK35

ARO:3003967.definition: lfrA is involved in the active efflux of quinolones and is found in Mycobacterium smegmatis. lfrA corresponds to 2 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 and 2 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
ARO:3003967.label: lrfA

ARO:3003960.definition: farAB is an MFS efflux pump found in gonococci that is involved in antibacterial fatty acid resistance. Moreover, expression of the tandemly linked farA and farB genes was positively associated with the presence of the MtrR transcriptional regulatory protein that normally downregulates the expression of mtrCDE.
ARO:3003960.label: farAB

ARO:3003961.definition: farA is the membrane fusion protein that is part of the farAB efflux pump.
ARO:3003961.label: farA

ARO:3003962.definition: farB is the cytoplasmic transporter protein that is part of the farAB efflux pump. farB corresponds to 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1 and 3 loci in Pseudomonas aeruginosa LESB58.
ARO:3003962.label: farB

ARO:3003963.definition: The Flo transporters can be plasmid- or chromosome-encoded. flo is an important determinant of florfenicol resistance in animal isolates of E. coli but is also found in human pathogens (e.g. Salmonella enterica and V. cholerae).
ARO:3003963.label: flo

ARO:3002689.definition: pp-cat is a plasmid-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Photobacterium damselae subsp. piscicida
ARO:3002689.label: plasmid-encoded cat (pp-cat)
