ARO:3002558.label: AAC(6')-Ik

ARO:3003816.definition: Mutations to the putative liaFSR target YvlB confer daptomycin resistance.
ARO:3003816.label: daptomycin resistant YvlB

ARO:3003817.definition: Mutations in the A subunit of DNA gyrase reduce its affinity for fluoroquinolones, thereby conferring resistance.
ARO:3003817.label: Acinetobacter baumannii gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3002541.definition: AAC(3)-VIIa is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Streptomyces rimosus
ARO:3002541.label: AAC(3)-VIIa

ARO:3002540.definition: AAC(3)-VIa is a plasmid-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in E. cloacae, S. enterica and E. coli
ARO:3002540.label: AAC(3)-VIa

ARO:3002543.definition: AAC(3)-IXa is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Micromonospora chalcea
ARO:3002543.label: AAC(3)-IXa

ARO:3002542.definition: AAC(3)-VIIIa is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Streptomyces fradiae
ARO:3002542.label: AAC(3)-VIIIa

ARO:3002545.definition: AAC(6')-Ia is an aminoglycoside acetyltransferase encoded by plasmids, transposons, integrons in Citrobacter diversus, E. coli, K. pneumoniae, Shigella sonnei, and P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3002545.label: AAC(6')-Ia

ARO:3002544.definition: AAC(3)-Xa is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Streptomyces griseus
ARO:3002544.label: AAC(3)-Xa

ARO:3002547.definition: AAC(6')-Ib-cr is an aminoglycoside acetyltransferase encoded by plasmids, transposons, integrons in Enterobacteriaceae. The aac(6')-Ib-cr variant gene can induce resistance against aminoglycoside and fluoroquinolone simultaneously
ARO:3002547.label: AAC(6')-Ib-cr

ARO:3002546.definition: AAC(6')-Ib is an aminoglycoside acetyltransferase encoded by plasmids, transposons, integrons in K. pneumoniae, P. mirabilis, P. aeruginosa, S. enterica, K. oxytoca, S. maltophilia, E. cloacae and V. cholerae
ARO:3002546.label: AAC(6')-Ib

ARO:3003561.definition: Sed-1 is a chromosomal-encoded class A beta-lactamase identified in Citrobacter sedlakii.
ARO:3003561.label: Sed-1

ARO:3003562.definition: Class A beta-lactamase found in Mycobacterium fortuitum
ARO:3003562.label: blaF

ARO:3003563.definition: RCP is a class A beta-lactamase found in Rhodopseudomonas capsulata.
ARO:3003563.label: RCP-1

ARO:3003564.definition: Class A beta-lactamase found in Streptomyces albus G
ARO:3003564.label: EXO-1

ARO:3003067.definition: smeS is the protein kinase sensor component of a two component signal transduction system that includes smeR
ARO:3003067.label: smeS

ARO:3003567.definition: Magainins A are antimicrobial peptides produced by amphibians as part of their innate immune system.
ARO:3003567.label: magainin A

ARO:3003568.definition: magainin B is is a synthetic analog of magainin 1, an antimicrobial peptide
ARO:3003568.label: magainin B

ARO:3003569.definition: magainin G is is a synthetic analog of magainin 1, an antimicrobial peptide. It differs from magainin B by the addition of an beta-alanine at the N terminal
ARO:3003569.label: magainin G

ARO:3003066.definition: smeR is the responder component of a two component signal transduction system that includes smeS
ARO:3003066.label: smeR

ARO:3003388.definition: Dapsone inhibits bacterial synthesis of dihydrofolic acid by competing with with para-aminobenzoate for the active site of dihydropteroate synthetase. Thus acts as a competitive inhibitor of folP. Point mutation within the folP gene results in lowered affinity of dapsone for folP
ARO:3003388.label: dapsone resistant dihydropteroate synthase folP

ARO:3003389.definition: Dapsone inhibits bacterial synthesis of dihydrofolic acid by competing with with para-aminobenzoate for the active site of dihydropteroate synthetase. Point mutation within the Mycobacterium leprae folP gene results in lowered affinity of dapsone for folP.
ARO:3003389.label: Mycobacterium leprae folP with mutation conferring resistance to dapsone

ARO:3003380.definition: RamR is a repressor that regulates RamA expression. Mutations lead to the upregulation of AcrAB, which is positively regulated by RamA.
ARO:3003380.label: Klebsiella pneumoniae ramR mutants

ARO:3003381.definition: SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps.
ARO:3003381.label: Escherichia coli soxR with mutation conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3003382.definition: SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps.
ARO:3003382.label: Salmonella enterica soxR with mutation conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3003383.definition: SoxS is a global regulator that up-regulates the expression of AcrAB efflux genes. It also reduces OmpF expression to decrease cell membrane permeability.
ARO:3003383.label: Salmonella serovars soxS with mutation conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3003385.definition: Mutant forms of the porin Omp36 result in reduced permeability to antibiotics.
ARO:3003385.label: Enterobacter aerogenes Omp36

ARO:3003386.definition: Point mutations in Escherichia coli dihydropteroate synthase folP prevent sulfonamide antibiotics from inhibiting its role in folate synthesis, thus conferring sulfonamide resistance.
ARO:3003386.label: Escherichia coli folP with mutation conferring resistance to sulfonamides

ARO:3003387.definition: Point mutations in Streptococcus pyogenes dihydropteroate synthase folP prevent sulfonamide antibiotics from inhibiting its role in folate synthesis, thus conferring sulfonamide resistance.
ARO:3003387.label: Streptococcus pyogenes folP with mutation conferring resistance to sulfonamides

ARO:3000723.definition: D-Alanine synthetase joins two D-alanines before their addition to the pentapeptide chains of peptidoglycan. It is found in both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
ARO:3000723.label: cycloserine sensitive D-alanine synthetase

ARO:3000722.definition: Alanine racemase converts the natural L-alanine to the D-alanine required in the pentapeptide chains in peptidoglycan. It is found in both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
ARO:3000722.label: cycloserine sensitive alanine racemase

ARO:3000721.definition: The cell wall is unique to bacteria and provides rigidity and protects the cell from lysis due to osmotic pressure. Its characteristic component is peptidoglycan, though cell wall structures vary significantly between Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, as well as mycobacteria.
ARO:3000721.label: cell wall component targeted by antibiotic

ARO:3000720.definition: The acyl-D-alanyl-D-alanine group is found at the terminal end of the pentapeptide chains of peptidoglycan subunits. Antibiotics that bind to this group block the addition of subunits, inhibiting peptidoglycan synthesis. This group is most accessible in Gram-postive bacteria.
ARO:3000720.label: acyl-D-alanyl-D-alanine

ARO:3000727.definition: The larger of two ribosomal subunits that make up the 70S bacterial ribosome.
ARO:3000727.label: 50S ribosomal subunit

ARO:3000726.definition: The pentaglycyl bridge is part of Gram-positive peptidoglycan, allowing the formation of a thick and rigid cell wall.
ARO:3000726.label: pentaglycyl bridge

ARO:3000725.definition: Arabinosyl transferases allow for the polymerization of arabinose to form arabinan. Arabanan is required for formation of mycobacterial cell walls.
ARO:3000725.label: antibiotic sensitive arabinosyltransferase

ARO:3000724.definition: Pyruvyl transferase is responsible for the conversion of N-acetylglucosamine (NAG) to N-acetylmuramic acid (NAMA). NAMA is a part of the macromolecular backbone of peptidoglycans. Pyruvyl transferase is found in both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
ARO:3000724.label: fosfomycin sensitive pyruvyl transferase (murA)

ARO:3000729.definition: The ribosomal complex can be targeted by antibiotics that stabilize the entire complex and prevent further translation. These antibiotics target both subunits in the process of protein translation.
ARO:3000729.label: ribosomal complex

ARO:3000728.definition: The smaller of two ribosomal subunits that make up the 70S bacterial ribosome.
ARO:3000728.label: 30S ribosomal subunit

ARO:3004091.definition: ANT(3'')-IIc is a aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase identified in Acinetobacter spp. via horizontal gene transfer mechanisms.
ARO:3004091.label: ANT(3'')-IIc

ARO:3003928.definition: Point mutation in Neisseria gonorrhoeae DNA gyrase subunit A. Decreases affinity between fluoroquinolone antibiotic molecule and gyrA, thereby conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone
ARO:3003928.label: Neisseria gonorrhoeae gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3002422.definition: OKP-A-5 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002422.label: OKP-A-5

ARO:3002383.definition: SME-5 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of SME beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002383.label: SME-5

ARO:3002382.definition: SME-4 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of SME beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002382.label: SME-4

ARO:3003706.definition: Penems are a class of unsaturated beta-lactam antibiotics with a broad spectrum of antibacterial activity and have a structure which renders them highly resistant to beta-lactamases. All penems are all synthetically made and act by inhibiting the synthesis of the peptidoglycan layer of bacterial cell walls. They are structurally similar to carbapenems, however, where carbapenems have a carbon, penems have a sulfur.
ARO:3003706.label: penem

ARO:3002380.definition: SME-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Serratia marcescens
ARO:3002380.label: SME-2

ARO:3003700.definition: opmE is an outer membrane factor protein that is part of the multidrug efflux pump MexPQ-OpmE.
ARO:3003700.label: opmE

ARO:3003701.definition: Rokitamycin is a macrolide antibiotic. Synthesized from strains of Streptomyces kitasatoensis.
ARO:3003701.label: rokitamycin

ARO:3003702.definition: Point mutation in Pseudomonas aeruginosa parC resulting in fluoroquinolone resistance also requiring a gyrA mutation.
ARO:3003702.label: Pseudomonas aeruginosa gyrA and parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

ARO:3003703.definition: MexMN-OprM is a multidrug efflux pump expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexM is the membrane fusion protein; MexN is the inner membrane transporter; and OprM is the outer membrane channel.
ARO:3003703.label: MexMN-OprM

ARO:3002389.definition: OXY-1-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
ARO:3002389.label: OXY-1-1

ARO:3002388.definition: OXY beta-lactamases are chromosomal class A beta-lactamases that are found in Klebsiella oxytoca. At constitutive low levels, OXY beta-lactamases confer resistance to aminopenicillins and carboxypenicillins. At high induced levels,  OXY beta-lactamases confer resistance to penicillins, cephalosporins and aztreonam.
ARO:3002388.label: OXY beta-lactamase

ARO:3003708.definition: Panipenem is a carbapenem antibacterial agent with a broad spectrum of in vitro activity covering a wide range of Gram-negative and Gram-positive aerobic and anaerobic bacterial.  It is used in combination with betamipron to inhibit panipenem uptake into the renal tubule and prevent nephrotoxicity.
ARO:3003708.label: panipenem

ARO:3003709.definition: MexZ is a transcriptional regulator that downregulates the mexXY multidrug transporter operon, which confers to aminoglycoside resistance on Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
ARO:3003709.label: MexZ

ARO:3003032.definition: MexXY-OprM is a multidrug efflux protein expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexY is the membrane fusion protein; MexX is the RND-type membrane protein; and OprM is the outer membrane channel. MexXY-OprM is associated with resistance to acriflavine, erythromycin, norfloxacin and ofloxacin. The efflux system may also be involved in acquisition of higher resistance, in particular when bacteria are repeatedly exposed to subinhibitory doses of AGs.
ARO:3003032.label: MexXY-OprM

ARO:3003033.definition: MexY is the RND-type membrane protein of the efflux complex MexXY-OprM.
ARO:3003033.label: mexY

ARO:3003030.definition: MexV is the membrane fusion protein of the MexVW-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
ARO:3003030.label: MexV

ARO:3002682.definition: catD is a chromosome and transposon-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Clostridium difficile
ARO:3002682.label: catD

ARO:3003036.definition: oleB is an ABC transporter in Streptomyces antibioticus and is involved in oleandomycin secretion
ARO:3003036.label: oleB

ARO:3003037.definition: OpcM is an outer membrane factor protein found in Burkholderia cepacia. It is part of the CeoAB-OpcM complex.
ARO:3003037.label: opcM

ARO:3003034.definition: MexX is the membrane fusion protein of the MexXY-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
ARO:3003034.label: mexX

ARO:3003035.definition: mfpA is a qnr homolog and a pentapeptide repeat protein that confers resistance to fluoroquinolones in Mycobacterium smegmatis
ARO:3003035.label: mfpA

ARO:3004284.definition: fabG is a 3-oxoacyl-acyl carrier protein reductase involved in lipid metabolism and fatty acid biosynthesis. The bacterial biocide Triclosan blocks the final reduction step in fatty acid elongation, inhibiting biosynthesis. Point mutations in fabG can confer resistance to Triclosan.
ARO:3004284.label: antibiotic resistance fabG

ARO:3004285.definition: A grouping of tunicamycin resistance proteins that are homologous to tmrB found in Bacillus subtilis.
ARO:3004285.label: tunicamycin resistance protein

ARO:3003038.definition: MexXY-OprA is a multidrug efflux protein expressed in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexY is the membrane fusion protein; MexX is the RND-type membrane protein; and OprA is the outer membrane channel. MexXY-OprA is associated with resistance to aminoglycosides
ARO:3003038.label: MexXY-OprA

ARO:3003039.definition: OprA is an outer membrane factor protein found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. It is part of the MexXY-OprA complex.
ARO:3003039.label: OprA

ARO:3004280.definition: The MltA-interacting Protein (MipA) family consists mainly of homologs to MipA and OmpV proteins. Proteins of this family, are predicted to form a ß-barrel.
ARO:3004280.label: MipA-interacting Protein

ARO:3004281.definition: These are GBPs that are associated with decreased susceptibility to beta-lactams either through mutations in the porin protein, absence of the porin protein, or expression of the porin protein.
ARO:3004281.label: General Bacterial Porin with reduced permeability to beta-lactams

ARO:3004282.definition: These are GBPs that are associated with decreased susceptibility to peptide antibiotics either through mutations in the porin protein, absence of the porin protein, or expression of the porin protein.
ARO:3004282.label: General Bacterial Porin with reduced permeability to peptide antibiotics

ARO:3004283.definition: The imipenum resistance-associated CarO porin family is composed of the CarO porin originally identified in Acinetobacter baumannii. The loss of these porins is associated with imipenem and meropenem multi-drug resistance. The channels formed by CarO porins show slight cation selectivity.
ARO:3004283.label: CarO porin

ARO:3002683.definition: catI is a chromosome and transposon-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Escherichia coli and Acinetobacter baumannii
ARO:3002683.label: catI

ARO:3003638.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003638.label: OXA-481

ARO:3003639.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003639.label: OXA-482

ARO:3002419.definition: OKP-A-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002419.label: OKP-A-2

ARO:3003148.definition: OXA-425 is a ß-lactamase found in clinical isolates of Acinetobacter baumannii. It is carbapenem-resistant
ARO:3003148.label: OXA-425

ARO:3003149.definition: OXA-426 is a beta-lactamase found in clinical isolates of Acinetobacter baumannii. It is carbapenem resistant
ARO:3003149.label: OXA-426

ARO:3003146.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases. Not yet released.
ARO:3003146.label: VEB-10

ARO:3003147.definition: OXA-424 is a ß-lactamase found in clinical isolates of Acinetobacter baumannii found in China. It is carbapenem resistant.
ARO:3003147.label: OXA-424

ARO:3003632.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003632.label: OXA-475

ARO:3003633.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003633.label: OXA-476

ARO:3003634.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003634.label: OXA-477

ARO:3003635.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003635.label: OXA-478

ARO:3003636.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003636.label: OXA-479

ARO:3003637.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003637.label: OXA-480

ARO:3002421.definition: OKP-A-4 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002421.label: OKP-A-4

ARO:3003236.definition: Point mutations in the 16S rRNA of Mycobacterium abscessus conferring resistance to kanamycin
ARO:3003236.label: Mycobacterium abscessus 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to kanamycin

ARO:3003237.definition: Point mutations in the 16S rRNA of Mycobacterium abscessus conferring resistance to tobramycin
ARO:3003237.label: Mycobacterium abscessus 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to tobramycin

ARO:3002329.definition: KPC-19 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of KPC beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002329.label: KPC-19

ARO:3002681.definition: catB9 is a chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Vibrio cholerae
ARO:3002681.label: catB9

ARO:3002328.definition: KPC-18 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of KPC beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002328.label: KPC-18

ARO:3001892.definition: CTX-M-30 is a beta-lactamase found in Citrobacter freundii
ARO:3001892.label: CTX-M-30

ARO:3001893.definition: CTX-M-31 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001893.label: CTX-M-31

ARO:3001890.definition: CTX-M-28 is a beta-lactamase found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3001890.label: CTX-M-28

ARO:3001891.definition: CTX-M-29 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001891.label: CTX-M-29

ARO:3001896.definition: CTX-M-34 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001896.label: CTX-M-34

ARO:3001897.definition: CTX-M-35 is a beta-lactamase found in Citrobacter koseri
ARO:3001897.label: CTX-M-35

ARO:3001894.definition: CTX-M-32 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001894.label: CTX-M-32

ARO:3001895.definition: CTX-M-33 is a beta-lactamase found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3001895.label: CTX-M-33

ARO:3001898.definition: CTX-M-36 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001898.label: CTX-M-36

ARO:3001899.definition: CTX-M-37 is a beta-lactamase found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3001899.label: CTX-M-37

ARO:3000547.definition: ArlRS is a two-component regulatory system for NorA. ArlS phosphorylates ArlR to promote NorA expression.
ARO:3000547.label: arlRS

ARO:3000546.definition: Clorobiocin is produced by a biosynthetic cluster in Streptomyces roseochromogenes.
ARO:3000546.label: Streptomyces roseochromogenes subsp. oscitans clorobiocin biosynthetic gene cluster

ARO:3000545.definition: MacAB-TolC is an ABC efflux pump complex expressed in E. coli and Salmonella enterica. It confers resistance to macrolides, including erythromycin.
ARO:3000545.label: MacAB-TolC

ARO:3000318.definition: The mphB gene encodes for MPH(2')-II. This enzymes phosphorylates 14-membered and 16-membered macrolides.  It phosphorylates macrolides in GTP- dependent manner at 2'-OH hydroxyl of desosamine sugar of macrolides.
ARO:3000318.label: mphB

ARO:3003800.definition: gdpD is a glycerolphosphodiesterase whose mutations confer resistance to daptomycin.
ARO:3003800.label: Enterococcus faecalis gdpD with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance

ARO:3003238.definition: Point mutations in the 16S rRNA of Mycobacterium abscessus conferring resistance to neomycin
ARO:3003238.label: Mycobacterium abscessus 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to neomycin

ARO:3003239.definition: Point mutations in the 16S rRNA of Mycobacterium abscessus conferring resistance to amikacin
ARO:3003239.label: Mycobacterium abscessus 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to amikacin

ARO:3000045.definition: A collection of curated phenotypic terms relating to antibiotic resistance and the Comprehensive Antibiotic Resistance Database.
ARO:3000045.label: component of AMR phenotype terminology

ARO:3000042.definition: Antibiotic adjuvants shown to inhibit the action of a beta-lactamase enzyme or enhance the ability of a beta-lactam antibiotic. These compounds are used along with antibiotics to treat beta-lactam-resistant infectious pathogens.
ARO:3000042.label: beta-lactamase inhibitor

ARO:3002323.definition: KPC-13 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of KPC beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002323.label: KPC-13

ARO:3000040.definition: Hydrolysis of an antibiotic molecule to confer resistance.
ARO:3000040.label: hydrolysis of antibiotic conferring resistance

ARO:3002322.definition: KPC-12 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of KPC beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002322.label: KPC-12

ARO:3000497.definition: Ethambutol is an antimycobacterial drug prescribed to treat tuberculosis. It is usually given in combination with other tuberculosis drugs, such as isoniazid, rifampicin, and pyrazinamide. Ethambutol inhibits arabinosyl biosynthesis, disrupting mycobacterial cell wall formation.
ARO:3000497.label: ethambutol

ARO:3003402.definition: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of helix 44, in the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to neomycin
ARO:3003402.label: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to neomycin

ARO:3000230.definition: Plasmid or integron-encoded nucleotidylylation of 2-deoxystreptamine aminoglycosides at the hydroxyl group at position 2'' in P. aeruginosa, K. pneumoniae, Morganella morganii, E. coli, S. typhimurium, C. freundii and A. baumannii
ARO:3000230.label: ANT(2'')-Ia

ARO:3000735.definition: subunit of the DNA topoisomerase IV sensitive to fluoroquinolone
ARO:3000735.label: fluoroquinolone sensitive parC

ARO:3004121.definition: Bactericidal/permeability-increasing (BPI) protein is a member of a new generation of proteins known as super-antibiotics that are implicated as endotoxin neutralising agents. The potent (nM) cytotoxicity of BPI is limited to gram-negative bacteria (GNB), reflecting the high affinity (<10 nM) of BPI for bacterial lipopolysaccharides (LPS). Binding of BPI to live bacteria via LPS causes immediate growth arrest, actual killing coincides with later damage to the inner membrane.
ARO:3004121.label: BPI

ARO:3004120.definition: CBP C1-aminomethylene vancomycin is a synthetic vancomycin derivative which exhibits multiple synergistic mechanisms of action, allowing it to effectively inhibit otherwise-glycopeptide resistant Gram-positive bacteria (notably those with functioning VanA clusters).
ARO:3004120.label: CBP C1-aminomethylene vancomycin

ARO:3004123.definition: Heterologous expression of Burkholderia pseudomallei Omp38 (BpsOmp38) in Omp-deficient E. coli host cells lowers their permeability and in consequence, their antimicrobial susceptibility to penicillin G, cefoxitin, ceftazidime and imipenem.
ARO:3004123.label: Burkholderia pseudomallei Omp38

ARO:3004122.definition: Klebsiella pneumoniae outer membrane porin protein. Is preferentially detected in porin-deficient strains. Functional characterization of this new porin revealed a narrower pore than those of porins OmpK35 and OmpK36, which did not allow penetration by certain β-lactams. Also, when a resistant strain expresses porin OmpK37 is less susceptible to cefotaxime and cefoxitin than when it is expressing either OmpK36 or OmpK35.
ARO:3004122.label: Klebsiella pneumoniae OmpK37

ARO:3004125.definition: Nucleotide point mutations in the 23S rRNA subunit may confer resistance to macrolide antibiotics.
ARO:3004125.label: 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics

ARO:3004124.definition: The outer membrane protein M35 of Moraxella catarrhalis is an antigenically conserved porin. Down-regulation of M35 significantly increases the MICs of aminopenicillins, specifically amoxicillin.
ARO:3004124.label: Moraxella catarrhalis M35

ARO:3004127.definition: MltA-interacting protein (mipA), is an antibiotic resistance-related outer membrane protein. Deletion of mipA increases kanamycin, nalidixic acid and streptomycin resistance.
ARO:3004127.label: Escherichia coli mipA

ARO:3004126.definition: LamB is a negative regulator for antibiotic resistance, it serves as a porin to influx antibiotic. When down-regulated, it increases resistance to chlortetracycline, ciprofloxacin, balofloxacin and nalidixic acid. It also interacts with Odp1, an energy metabolic enzyme, creating a complex that decreases in antibiotic-resistant strains.
ARO:3004126.label: Escherichia coli LamB

ARO:3004129.definition: Cephaloridine is a semisynthetic, broad-spectrum, first-generation cephalosporin with antibacterial activity. Cephaloridine binds to and inactivates penicillin-binding proteins (PBPs) located on the inner membrane of the bacterial cell wall. PBPs are enzymes involved in the terminal stages of assembling the bacterial cell wall and in reshaping the cell wall during growth and division. Inactivation of PBPs interferes with the cross-linkage of peptidoglycan chains necessary for bacterial cell wall strength and rigidity. This results in the weakening of the bacterial cell wall and causes cell lysis.
ARO:3004129.label: cephaloridine

ARO:3000133.definition: Catalyzes the addition of a thiol group from a nucleophilic molecule to fosfomycin.
ARO:3000133.label: fosfomycin thiol transferase

ARO:3000130.definition: Edeine A is a subtype of the peptide antibiotic edeine, composed of beta-tyr, beta-ser, diaminopropionic acid, diaminohydroxyazelaic acid, glycine, and spermidine. Edeine A is a mixture of edeine A1 and its inactive isomer, edeine A2. Edeines bind to the 30S subunit to block fMet-tRNA interaction at the P site, inhibiting protein synthesis and subsequent structure/function processes critical for life or replication.
ARO:3000130.label: edeine A

ARO:3000136.definition: Edeine F is a subtype of edeine similar to edeine B with beta-tyr replaced by beta-phe-beta-ala. Edeines bind to the 30S subunit to block fMet-tRNA interaction at the P site, inhibiting protein synthesis and subsequent structure/function processes critical for life or replication.
ARO:3000136.label: edeine F

ARO:3000134.definition: Edeine B is a subtype of the peptide antibiotic edeine, composed of beta-tyr, beta-ser, diaminopropionic acid, diaminohydroxyazelaic acid, glycine, and guanylspermidine. Edeine B is a mixture of edeine B1 and its inactive isomer, edeine B2.  Edeines bind to the 30S subunit to block fMet-tRNA interaction at the P site, inhibiting protein synthesis and subsequent structure/function processes critical for life or replication. Edeine B has also been shown to inhibit septation and cause filamentous morphology, also leading to cell death.
ARO:3000134.label: edeine B

ARO:3000135.definition: Edeine D is a subtype of edeine similar to edeine A with the beta-tyr replaced by beta-phe-beta-ala. Edeines bind to the 30S subunit to block fMet-tRNA interaction at the P site, inhibiting protein synthesis and subsequent structure/function processes critical for life or replication.
ARO:3000135.label: edeine D

ARO:3003951.definition: microcin J25 is a peptide antibiotic that inhibits transcription by bacterial RNA polymerase. MccJ25 is produced by Escherichia coli strains that harbor a plasmid-borne antibiotic-synthesis and antibiotic-export cassette, consisting of a gene for MccJ25 precursor (a 58 residue linear peptide), two genes for factors that process MccJ25 precursor into MccJ25, and one gene for export of MccJ25.
ARO:3003951.label: microcin J25

ARO:3003950.definition: MsbA is a multidrug resistance transporter homolog from E. coli and belongs to a superfamily of transporters that contain an adenosine triphosphate (ATP) binding cassette (ABC) which is also called a nucleotide-binding domain (NBD). MsbA is a member of the MDR-ABC transporter group by sequence homology. MsbA transports lipid A, a major component of the bacterial outer cell membrane, and is the only bacterial ABC transporter that is essential for cell viability.
ARO:3003950.label: msbA

ARO:3003953.definition: hmrM is a multidrug efflux pump belonging to the MATE family and functions as a  Na+/drug antiporter.
ARO:3003953.label: hmrM

ARO:3003952.definition: YojI mediates resistance to the peptide antibiotic microcin J25 when it is expressed from a multicopy vector. YojI is capable of pumping out microcin molecules.  The outer membrane protein TolC in addition to YojI is required for export of microcin J25 out of the cell. Microcin J25 is thus the first known substrate for YojI.
ARO:3003952.label: YojI

ARO:3003955.definition: efpA is an MFS transporter found in Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

ARO:3003957.definition: Palmitic acid is the most common saturated fatty acid found in animals, plants, and microorganisms. Palmitic acid is found to have antibacterial properties.
ARO:3003957.label: palmitic acid

ARO:3003956.definition: Amongst the diverse and potent biological activities of free fatty acids (FFAs) is the ability to kill or inhibit the growth of bacteria. The antibacterial properties of FFAs are used by many organisms to defend against parasitic or pathogenic bacteria. The prime target of FFA action is the cell membrane, where FFAs disrupt the electron transport chain and oxidative phosphorylation. Besides interfering with cellular energy production, FFA action may also result from the inhibition of enzyme activity, impairment of nutrient uptake, generation of peroxidation and auto-oxidation degradation products or direct lysis of bacterial cells.
ARO:3003956.label: antibacterial free fatty acids

ARO:3003959.definition: Linoleic acid is a polyunsaturated omega-6 fatty acid. Linoleic acid has been found to have antibacterial activity, particularly in inhibiting the growth of Gram-positive bacterial species.
ARO:3003959.label: linoleic acid

ARO:3003827.definition: Rhodamine is a flurone dye that is often used as a tracer due to determine the rate and direction of flow and transport. It permeates the cell membrane of gram negative organisms E. coli and P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3003827.label: rhodamine

ARO:3003821.definition: BAL30072 is a monocyclic beta-lactam antibiotic belonging to the sulfactams. BAL30072 was found to trigger the spheroplasting and lysis of Escherichia coli rather than the formation of extensive filaments.
ARO:3003821.label: BAL30072

ARO:3003820.definition: mgrB is a small transmembrane protein produced in the PhoPQ signalling system. It acts as a negative regulator in this system. Inactivation or down-regulation of mgrB confers colistin resistance by absence as shown in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3003820.label: mgrB

ARO:3003823.definition: Benzalkonium chloride is a type of cationic surfactant. It is an organic salt called a quaternary ammonium compound. It has three main categories of use: as a biocide, a cationic surfactant, and as a phase transfer agent.
ARO:3003823.label: benzalkonium chloride

ARO:3003822.definition: Battacin is a cationic lipopeptide antibiotic produced from a Paenibacillus tianmuensis soil isolate. Battacin kills bacteria in vitro and has potent activity against Gram-negative bacteria, including multidrug-resistant and extremely drug-resistant clinical isolates. The bactericidal kinetics of battacin correlate with the depolarization of the cell membrane, suggesting that battacin kills bacteria by disrupting the cytoplasmic membrane.
ARO:3003822.label: battacin

ARO:3000740.definition: Many types of ribonucleic acids (RNAs) are targeted by antibiotics, including mRNA templates and ribosomal RNA. Some antibiotics target all RNAs and cause strand breaks.

ARO:3001816.definition: ACC-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Hafnia alvei
ARO:3001816.label: ACC-2

ARO:3001817.label: ACC-3

ARO:3000730.definition: Elongation factor G (EF-G) provides energy for the translocation step in protein synthesis. Antibiotics that target EF-G allow one round of translocation but prevent EF-G from dissociating from the ribosome-RNA complex.
ARO:3000730.label: elongation factor G

ARO:3000731.definition: Elongation factor Tu is required for peptide elongation in bacterial protein synthesis.
ARO:3000731.label: elongation factor Tu

ARO:3000732.definition: Isoleucyl-tRNA transferase recognizes isoleucine codons and works with the ribosome to incorporate isoleucine amino acids into polypeptide chains. It can be targeted by antibiotics that have an analog of isoleucine through competitive inhibition.
ARO:3000732.label: antibiotic sensitive Isoleucyl-tRNA transferase

ARO:3000733.definition: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Binding the alpha-subunit is sufficient to inhibit DNA supercoiling.
ARO:3000733.label: fluoroquinolone sensitive gyrA

ARO:3000734.synonyms: gyrase beta subunit;gyrase subunit B;gyrase B
ARO:3000734.definition: DNA gyrase is responsible for DNA supercoiling and consists of two alpha and two beta subunits. Binding the beta-subunit is sufficient to inhibit DNA supercoiling.
ARO:3000734.label: antibiotic sensitive DNA topoisomerase subunit gyrB

ARO:3003126.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases. Not yet released.
ARO:3003126.label: OXA-433

ARO:3000736.definition: The rho transcription terminator factor moves along RNA as it is transcribed, unwinding the RNA from the DNA. It is also responsible for recognizing transcription termination pause sites, slowing down RNA polymerase and allowing mRNA to be released.
ARO:3000736.label: rho transcription terminator factor

ARO:3000737.definition: The beta-subunit of RNA polymerase is targeted as a complex. When blocked, RNA strand elongation cannot continue after the first few nucleotides.
ARO:3000737.label: rifamycin sensitive beta-subunit of RNA polymerase (rpoB)

ARO:3000738.definition: Antibiotics can target DNA to cause strand breaks or prevent transcription. The activity of these antibiotics can be context dependent: some antibiotics are converted to an active form only in certain species, while others target DNA as it is being transcribed.
ARO:3000738.label: deoxyribonucleic acid

ARO:3000739.definition: RNA intron self-splicing action can be inhibited by antibiotics that target a G-binding site to compete with the guanosine cofactor.
ARO:3000739.label: RNA guanosine binding site

ARO:3001815.definition: ACC-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3001815.label: ACC-1

ARO:3000743.definition: This reductoisomerase is found in an alternate isoprenoid synthase pathway that is mevalonate independent. Isoprenoids are important precursors to many other macromolecules. This non-mevalonate pathway is used by plants and most bacteria, including mycobacteria, but not eukaryotes, allowing for selectivea action. Staphylococcus aureus and some other Gram-positive bacteria use a mevalonate-dependent pathway, and are resistant against 1-deoxy-D-xylose 5-phosphate reductoisomerase inhibitors.
ARO:3000743.label: 1-deoxy-D-xylulose 5-phosphate reductoisomerase

ARO:3003731.definition: A specific fusidic acid resistance gene conferring intrinsic resistance in the bacteria Staphylococcus saprophyticus.
ARO:3003731.label: fusD

ARO:3003730.definition: Bifidobacteria have an intrinsically resistant form of ileS (isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase) that confers resistance to mupirocin.
ARO:3003730.label: Bifidobacterium ileS conferring resistance to mupirocin

ARO:3003733.definition: FusC is a fusidic acid resistance gene enabling ribosomal translocase EF-G dissociation from the ribosome that has been detected in Staphylococcus aureus and Staphylococcus intermedius. Its mechanism is believed to be similar to fusB due to its high level of sequence homology.
ARO:3003733.label: fusC

ARO:3003735.definition: The mutations to this gene are involved in altering the translation elongation factor G (EF-G) in association with the ribosome to prevent fusidic acid from binding EF-G and preventing translation.
ARO:3003735.label: Staphylococcus aureus fusA with mutation conferring resistance to fusidic acid

ARO:3003734.definition: Antibiotic resistant fusA is caused by mutations to the elongation factor G (EF-G) and confers resistance to fusidic acid.
ARO:3003734.label: antibiotic resistant fusA

ARO:3003737.definition: The mutations to the rplF gene encoding riboprotein L6 have been shown to cause fusidic acid resistance, demonstrating a potential secondary site of action of the antibiotic that is blocked through these mutations. Several types of mutations have been identified that cause resistance, including SNPs, frameshift mutations and early stop codons.
ARO:3003737.label: Staphylococcus aureus fusE with mutation conferring resistance to fusidic acid

ARO:3003736.definition: Antibiotic resistant fusE is caused by mutations in a region of the rplF gene encoding riboprotein L6, and confers resistance to fusidic acid.
ARO:3003736.label: antibiotic resistant fusE

ARO:3002390.definition: OXY-1-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
ARO:3002390.label: OXY-1-2

ARO:3002391.definition: OXY-1-3 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
ARO:3002391.label: OXY-1-3

ARO:3002392.label: OXY-1-4

ARO:3002394.label: OXY-1-6

ARO:3002396.label: OXY-2-1

ARO:3002397.label: OXY-2-2

ARO:3002399.definition: OXY-2-4 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
ARO:3002399.label: OXY-2-4

ARO:3000841.definition: CGB-1 is an Ambler class B beta-lactamase that mediates resistance for carbapenems in Chryseobacterium gleum
ARO:3000841.label: CGB-1

ARO:3003047.definition: qacB is a subunit of the qac multidrug efflux pump
ARO:3003047.label: qacB

ARO:3003046.definition: qacA is a subunit of the qac multidrug efflux pump
ARO:3003046.label: qacA

ARO:3003043.definition: PBP2x is a penicillin-binding protein found in Streptococcus pneumoniae
ARO:3003043.label: Streptococcus pneumoniae PBP2x conferring resistance to amoxicillin

ARO:3003042.definition: PBP2b is a penicillin-binding protein found in Streptococcus pneumoniae
ARO:3003042.label: Streptococcus pneumoniae PBP2b conferring resistance to amoxicillin

ARO:3003041.definition: PBP1a is a penicillin-binding protein found in Streptococcus pneumoniae
ARO:3003041.label: Streptococcus pneumoniae PBP1a conferring resistance to amoxicillin

ARO:3003040.definition: Pencillin-binding proteins are transpeptidase proteins essential for cell wall synthesis. PBPs bind to penicillin antibiotics, which inactivates the enzyme and therefore disrupts cell wall synthesis. Multiple mechanisms and determinants are implicated in antibiotic resistant PBP.
ARO:3003040.label: beta-lactam resistant penicillin-binding proteins

ARO:3003589.definition: NmcA is a class A serine beta-lactamase isolated from Enterobacter cloacae.
ARO:3003589.label: NmcA

ARO:3003049.definition: rosB is part of an efflux pump/potassium antiporter system (RosAB) in Yersinia that confers resistance to cationic antimicrobial peptides such as polymyxin B.
ARO:3003049.label: rosB

ARO:3003048.definition: rosA is part of an efflux pump/potassium antiporter system (RosAB) in Yersinia that confers resistance to cationic antimicrobial peptides such as polymyxin B.
ARO:3003048.label: rosA

ARO:3001953.definition: CTX-M-93 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001953.label: CTX-M-93

ARO:3001952.definition: CTX-M-92 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001952.label: CTX-M-92

ARO:3001951.definition: CTX-M-91 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001951.label: CTX-M-91

ARO:3001950.definition: CTX-M-90 is a beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis
ARO:3001950.label: CTX-M-90

ARO:3001957.definition: CTX-M-98 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001957.label: CTX-M-98

ARO:3001956.definition: CTX-M-96 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001956.label: CTX-M-96

ARO:3001955.definition: CTX-M-95 is a beta-lactamase found in Kluyvera spp.
ARO:3001955.label: CTX-M-95

ARO:3001954.definition: CTX-M-94 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001954.label: CTX-M-94

ARO:3001959.definition: CTX-M-100 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001959.label: CTX-M-100

ARO:3001958.definition: CTX-M-99 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3001958.label: CTX-M-99

ARO:3004085.definition: lnuG is a transposon-mediated lincosamide nucleotidyltransferase found in Enterococcus faecalis on Tn6260.
ARO:3004085.label: lnuG

ARO:3000745.definition: Dihydrofolate reductase synthesizes the co-enzyme tetrahydrofolic acid, which is also an essential precursor in the de novo synthesis of the DNA nucleotide thymidine.
ARO:3000745.label: antibiotic sensitive dihydrofolate reductase

ARO:3000421.definition: NorB is a multidrug efflux pump in Staphylococcus aureus that confers resistance to fluoroquinolones and other structurally unrelated antibiotics like tetracycline. It shares 30% similarity with NorB, and is a structural homolog of Blt of Bacillus subtilis. It is regulated by mgrA, also known as NorR.
ARO:3000421.label: norB

ARO:3000423.definition: In the presence of ATP and magnesium (II), fosfomycin gets phosphorylated at the phosphate group resulting in a diphosphate group which inactivates the antibiotic.
ARO:3000423.label: FomA

ARO:3001653.definition: OXA-132 is a beta-lactamase found in A. baumannii
ARO:3001653.label: OXA-132

ARO:3003609.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003609.label: OXA-453

ARO:3003608.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003608.label: OXA-452

ARO:3003605.label: OXA-449

ARO:3003604.label: OXA-448

ARO:3003607.label: OXA-451

ARO:3003606.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003606.label: OXA-450

ARO:3003601.label: OXA-445

ARO:3003600.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003600.label: OXA-444

ARO:3003603.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003603.label: OXA-447

ARO:3003602.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003602.label: OXA-446

ARO:3004408.definition: Specific vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility based in Japan. Omron is the developer of the MicroScan automated testing platform.
ARO:3004408.label: Omron

ARO:3004380.definition: Antibiotic adjuvant and beta-lactamase inhibitor, often paired with meropenem for clinical use.
ARO:3004380.label: vaborbactam

ARO:3003452.definition: Mutations that occurs on the embA genes resulting in the resistance to ethambutol
ARO:3003452.label: ethambutol resistant embA

ARO:3004389.definition: Reagents and procedures used during microbial susceptibility testing.
ARO:3004389.label: reagent or protocol used for testing AMR

ARO:3000558.definition: Folate is an essential precursor for many nucleotides and amino acids, making folate biosynthesis a desirable target for antibiotics. Mutation to enzymes within the folate biosynthetic pathway can reverse antibiotic action. Modification of dihydropteroate synthase (folP) can result in resistance to sulfonamide antibiotics. Resistance can be conferred by mutation to the native folP gene or by acquiring a resistant DHPS (sul) gene through gene transfer. The sul gene has three known variants (sul1, sul2, sul3) and encodes a highly resistant dihydropteroate synthase that can be acquired via transposons or plasmids.
ARO:3000558.label: sulfonamide resistant dihydropteroate synthase

ARO:3000559.definition: AdeN is a repressor of AdeIJK, a RND-type efflux pump in Acinetobacter baumannii. Its inactivation increases expression of AdeJ.
ARO:3000559.label: adeN

ARO:3000550.definition: Aztreonam was the first monobactam discovered, and is greatly effective against Gram-negative bacteria while inactive against Gram-positive bacteria. Artreonam is a poor substrate for beta-lactamases, and may even act as an inhibitor. In Gram-negative bacteria, Aztreonam interferes with filamentation, inhibiting cell division and leading to cell death.
ARO:3000550.label: aztreonam

ARO:3000551.definition: Organoarsenic antibiotics are arsenic-containing compounds with antibacterial effects. The organoarsenic antibiotic arsphenamine and its derivatives were developed in the 1910s as the first modern chemotherapeutic agents.
ARO:3000551.label: organoarsenic antibiotic

ARO:3000552.definition: Arsphenamine, also known as Salvarsan and 606, is a drug that was used beginning in the 1910s to treat syphilis and trypanosomiasis. It is an organoarsenic compound and was the first modern chemotherapeutic agent.
ARO:3000552.label: arsphenamine

ARO:3000553.definition: AdeR is a positive regulator of AdeABC efflux system. AdeR inactivation leads to susceptibility to aminoglycoside antibiotics.
ARO:3000553.label: adeR

ARO:3000554.definition: Mupirocin, also known as pseudomonic acid, is a bacteriostatic polyketide antibiotic from Pseudomonas fluorescens used to treat S. aureus and MRSA. It inhibits Ile tRNA synthetase.
ARO:3000554.label: mupirocin

ARO:3000556.definition: Tet44 is a tetracycline resistance gene found in Campylobacter fetus, and binds to the ribosome to confer antibiotic resistance as a ribosomal protection protein.
ARO:3000556.label: tet44

ARO:3000557.definition: Enzyme that catalyzes the inactivation of an antibiotic resulting in resistance.  Inactivation includes chemical modification, destruction, etc.
ARO:3000557.label: antibiotic inactivation enzyme

ARO:3000785.definition: CmeC is the outer membrane channel protein of the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
ARO:3000785.label: cmeC

ARO:3003875.definition: Sequence variants of Enterococcus faecium elongation factor Tu that confer resistance to elfamycin antibiotics.
ARO:3003875.label: Enterococcus faecium EF-Tu mutants conferring resistance to elfamycin

ARO:3002436.definition: OKP-B-3 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002436.label: OKP-B-3

ARO:3000254.definition: emrY is a multidrug transport that moves substrates across the inner membrane of the Gram-negative E. coli. It is a homolog of emrB.
ARO:3000254.label: emrY

ARO:3000784.definition: CmeB is the inner membrane transporter the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
ARO:3000784.label: cmeB

ARO:3000746.definition: MepR is an upstream repressor of MepA in Staphylococcus aureus. It is part of the mepRAB operon.
ARO:3000746.label: mepR

ARO:3000787.definition: MdtABC-TolC is a multidrug efflux system in Gram-negative bacteria, including E. coli and Salmonella. MdtA is a membrane fusion protein; TolC is the outer membrane channel; MdtBC form a drug transporter. In the absence of MdtB, the MdtAC-TolC has narrower drug specificity, leading to the loss of novobiocin resistance, for example.
ARO:3000787.label: MdtABC-TolC

ARO:3000207.definition: Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrA represents the periplasmic portion of the transport protein.
ARO:3000207.label: acrA

ARO:0000051.definition: Tetracycline is a broad-spectrum polyketide antibiotic produced by many Streptomyces. It works by inhibiting action of the prokaryotic 30S ribosome.
ARO:0000051.label: tetracycline

ARO:3003262.definition: Sensitive form of 16s susceptable to antibiotics
ARO:3003262.label: Antibiotic sensitive Escherichia coli 16S rRNA

ARO:3000781.definition: AdeJ is a RND efflux protein that acts as the inner membrane transporter of the AdeIJK efflux complex. It has 57% identity with E. coli AcrB.
ARO:3000781.label: adeJ

ARO:3002914.definition: vanJ is a novel membrane protein that confers resistance to teicoplanin and its derivatives in Streptomyces coelicolor by recycling undecaprenol pyrophosphate during cell wall biosynthesis.
ARO:3002914.label: vanJ

ARO:3003480.definition: Point mutations within the 530 loop of the 16S rRNA of Mycobacterium tuberculosis can result in resistance against streptomycin. These mutations do not directly inhibit the binding of streptomycin, but is hypothesized that they interfere with conformational perturbations that account for streptomycin's action on the ribosome.
ARO:3003480.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis 16S rRNA mutation conferring resistance to streptomycin

ARO:3000780.definition: AdeI is the membrane fusion protein of the AdeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
ARO:3000780.label: adeI

ARO:3000783.definition: CmeA is the membrane fusion protein of the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
ARO:3000783.label: cmeA

ARO:3000763.definition: EmbC is an arabinosyltransferase involved in lipoarabinomannan synthesis.
ARO:3000763.label: antibiotic sensitive embC

ARO:3000782.definition: AdeK is the outer membrane factor protein in the adeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
ARO:3000782.label: adeK

ARO:3003582.definition: Response regulator for Lipid A modification genes; two-component system involved in polymyxin resistance that senses high extracellular Fe(2+)
ARO:3003582.label: basR

ARO:3004259.definition: Acetylation of the aminoglycoside antibiotic on the amino group at position 1.
ARO:3004259.label: AAC(1)

ARO:3004258.definition: A family of acetyltransferases that confer resistance to apramycin.
ARO:3004258.label: amp acetyltransferase

ARO:3003810.definition: Natural producers of kirromycin and kirromycin-like antibiotics (i.e., kirrothrycin) possess self-resistance, which is classified here
ARO:3003810.label: kirromycin self resistant EF-Tu

ARO:3004253.definition: vanUG is a vanG variant found in the vanG gene cluster.
ARO:3004253.label: vanUG

ARO:3004251.definition: Adenylate cyclases encoded by cya genes, which are involved in the synthesis cyclic AMP which regulates the fosfomycin transporter glpT. Mutations in cya genes can confer resistance to fosfomycin.
ARO:3004251.label: cya adenylate cyclase

ARO:3004250.definition: PtsI family phosphotransferases are involved in cyclic AMP synthesis, which regulates glpT expression. Mutations in PtsI family genes can negatively affect expression of UhpT, which is needed for fosfomycin import.
ARO:3004250.label: PtsI phosphotransferase

ARO:3004257.definition: Acetyltransferases of the cpa family confer resistance to capreomycin, an aminoglycoside antibiotic
ARO:3004257.label: cpa acetyltransferase

ARO:3004256.definition: Bleomycin resistant proteins (BRP) confer resistance to bleomycin and to bleomycin-like molecules.
ARO:3004256.label: Bleomycin resistant protein

ARO:3004255.definition: vanJ and vanJ homologue proteins confer resistance to the teicoplanin.
ARO:3004255.label: vanJ membrane protein

ARO:3004254.definition: vanVB is a vanV variant found in the vanB gene cluster. It is found in some but not all vanB operons in E. faecalis, suggesting the existence of varied gene compositions in vanB operons.
ARO:3004254.label: vanVB

ARO:3002999.definition: CblA-1 beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in Bacteroides uniformis that is species-specific.
ARO:3002999.label: CblA-1

ARO:3003583.definition: Histidine protein kinase sensor Lipid A modification gene; part of a two-component system involved in polymyxin resistance that senses high extracellular Fe(2+)
ARO:3003583.label: basS

ARO:3003260.definition: Beta-subunit of DNA gyrase sensitive to inhibition by aminocoumarins
ARO:3003260.label: aminocoumarin sensitive gyrB

ARO:3001850.definition: ACT-30 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001850.label: ACT-30

ARO:3004136.definition: Point mutations occurring in the iniB region of the iniBAC operon shown to confer resistance to ethambutol
ARO:3004136.label: Ethambutol resistant iniB

ARO:3004137.definition: iniB, an isoniazid-induced protein, is part of the iniBAC operon that participates in the development of tolerance to both isoniazid and ethambutol. May function through a MDR-pump like mechanism, although it does not appear to directly transport isoniazid from the cell.
ARO:3004137.label: Antibiotic resistant iniB

ARO:3004134.definition: Point mutations in Helicobacter pylori shown to confer resistance to clarithromycin, a macrolide antibiotic
ARO:3004134.label: Helicobacter pylori 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to clarithromycin

ARO:3004135.definition: Point mutations in M. tuberculosis iniB shown to confer resistance to ethambutol.
ARO:3004135.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis iniB with mutation conferring resistance to ethambutol

ARO:3004132.definition: Point mutation in 23S rRNA of C. reinhardtii chloroplast shown clinically to confer resistance to Erythromycin, a macrolide antibiotic.
ARO:3004132.label: Chlamydomonas reinhardtii 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to erythromycin

ARO:3004133.definition: Point mutation in B. hyodysenteriae 23S rRNA shown to confer resistance to tylosin and erythromycin
ARO:3004133.label: Brachyspira hyodysenteriae 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to tylosin

ARO:3004130.definition: Balofloxacin is an 8-methoxy fluoroquinolone antibiotic. It shows potent bactericidal activity and inhibits the supercoiling activity of DNA gyrase of S. aureus, E. coli, and P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3004130.label: balofloxacin

ARO:3004131.definition: Point mutation in the 23S rRNA of Escherichia coli shown clinically to confer resistance to the macrolide-class antibiotics erythromycin and telithromycin.
ARO:3004131.label: Escherichia coli 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to erythromycin and telithromycin

ARO:3000145.definition: Tylosin is a 16-membered macrolide, naturally produced by Streptomyces fradiae. It interacts with the bacterial ribosome 50S subunit to inhibit protein synthesis.
ARO:3000145.label: tylosin

ARO:3004138.definition: Point mutations in the 23S ribosomal RNA subunit of M. catarrhalis shown clinically to confer resistance to macrolide class antibiotics.
ARO:3004138.label: Moraxella catarrhalis 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to macrolide antibiotics

ARO:3004139.definition: MCR-3 is a plasmid-borne phosphoethanolamine transferase that interferes with binding of colistin to the cell membrane via addition of phosphoethanolamine to lipid A, resulting reduction in negative charge of the cell membrane. Originally described by Yin et al. 2017, from a porcine Escherichia coli plasmid pWJ1.
ARO:3004139.label: MCR-3

ARO:3000389.definition: Type B streptogramins are cyclic hexa- or hepta-depsipeptides produced by NRPSs in Streptomyces.  The NRPS contains 6 or 7 modules arranged on one or more genes. SnbA catalyzes the activation of the first residue, 3-hydroxypicolynic acid. SnbC then activates and incorporates threonine and aminobutyric acid. Lastly, SnbDE activates and incoporates the last four amino acids. The thioesterase domain is responsible for peptide cyclization, and it is located at the end of the assembly line.
ARO:3000389.label: streptogramin B biosynthesis

ARO:3000381.definition: Alternate proteins that have the same functions as other antibiotic target proteins, but are structurally different and thus resistant to antibiotics. These can replace the activity of other antibiotic-sensitive proteins in the presence of antibiotics.
ARO:3000381.label: antibiotic target replacement protein

ARO:3000380.definition: FosC is an enzyme that phosphorylates fosfomycin to confer resistance
ARO:3000380.label: FosC

ARO:3000383.definition: Enzymes, other proteins, or other gene products shown clinically to confer resistance to rifamycin (rifampin) antibiotics.
ARO:3000383.label: determinant of rifamycin resistance

ARO:3000382.definition: Azidamfenicol is a water soluble derivative of chloramphenicol, sharing the same mode of action of inhibiting peptide synthesis by interacting with the 23S RNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit.
ARO:3000382.label: azidamfenicol

ARO:3001851.definition: ACT-31 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001851.label: ACT-31

ARO:3000384.definition: AcrAB-TolC is a tripartite RND efflux system that confers resistance to tetracycline, chloramphenicol, ampicillin, nalidixic acid, and rifampin  in Gram-negative bacteria. The system spans the cell membrane (AcrB) and the outer-membrane (TolC), and is linked together in the periplasm by AcrA.
ARO:3000384.label: AcrAB-TolC

ARO:3000387.definition: Phenicols are broad spectrum bacteriostatic antibiotics acting on bacterial protein synthesis. More specifically, the phenicols block peptide elongation by binding to the peptidyltansferase centre of the 70S ribosome.
ARO:3000387.label: phenicol antibiotic

ARO:3000386.definition: MexAB-OprM is a multidrug efflux protein expressed in the Gram-negative Pseudomonas aeruginosa. MexA is the membrane fusion protein; MexB is the inner membrane transporter; and OprM is the outer membrane channel. MexAB-OprM is associated with resistance to fluoroquinolones, chloramphenicol, erythromycin, azithromycin, novobiocin, and certain β-lactams and lastly over-expression is linked to colistin resistance.
ARO:3000386.label: MexAB-OprM

ARO:3002997.definition: LCR-1 is a class D beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002997.label: LCR-1

ARO:3002411.definition: OXY-5-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
ARO:3002411.label: OXY-5-1

ARO:3002825.definition: ErmY is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Staphylococcus aureus
ARO:3002825.label: ErmY

ARO:3001012.definition: TEM-145 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
ARO:3001012.label: TEM-145

ARO:3001013.definition: TEM-146 is a beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
ARO:3001013.label: TEM-146

ARO:3002800.definition: QnrVC3 is an integron-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Vibrio cholerae
ARO:3002800.label: QnrVC3

ARO:3002801.definition: QnrVC4 is an integron-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Aeromonas punctata
ARO:3002801.label: QnrVC4

ARO:3002802.definition: QnrVC5 is an integron-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Vibrio fluvialis
ARO:3002802.label: QnrVC5

ARO:3002803.definition: QnrVC6 is an integron-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Acinetobacter baumannii
ARO:3002803.label: QnrVC6

ARO:3002804.definition: An enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Enterobacter cloacae by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule. It depends on the cofactors Manganese (II) and Potassium and uses Glutathione (GSH) as the nucleophilic molecule.
ARO:3002804.label: FosA2

ARO:3004439.definition: Details required in reporting antimicrobial resistance.
ARO:3004439.label: component of AMR phenotype measurement

ARO:3002995.definition: ROB-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Pasteurella and Haemophilus
ARO:3002995.label: ROB-1

ARO:3004438.definition: Vendor of AMR testing equipment and reagents.
ARO:3004438.label: AMR testing vendor

ARO:3003099.definition: CphA2 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas hydrophila. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein
ARO:3003099.label: cphA2

ARO:3000098.definition: PDC beta-lactamases are class C beta-lactamases that are found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

ARO:3000094.definition: OCH beta-lactamases are Ambler class C chromosomal-encoded beta-lactamases in Ochrobactrum anthropi

Inhibiting dihydropteroate leads to slow cell death, as bacteria can survive on existing folate storages for a few generations.

ARO:3000702.label: acrR

ARO:3000709.definition: Cell wall biosynthesis provides bacteria with a layer of peptidoglycan that provides rigidity and protects the cell from lysis due to osmotic pressure. Cell wall structures vary significantly between Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, while mycobacteria have a unique cell wall composition.
ARO:3000709.label: cell wall synthesis enzyme targeted by antibiotic

ARO:3000708.definition: Antibiotic targets are components of the bacterial cell usually unique to bacteria or significantly different from their eukaryotic counterparts to allow for selective antibacterial activity. Exceptions include antibiotics that are converted to an active form inside the bacterium. Resistance mechanisms may modify these targets to protect bacteria from the effects of antibiotics.
ARO:3000708.label: antibiotic target

ARO:3003728.definition: VanRI is the regulatory transcriptional activator in the VanSR regulator within the VanI glycopeptide resistance gene cluster.
ARO:3003728.label: vanRI

ARO:3003729.definition: Point mutations to the isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase (ileS) in Staphylococcus aureus that confer resistance to mupirocin.
ARO:3003729.label: Staphylococcus aureus ileS with mutation conferring resistance to mupirocin

ARO:3003726.definition: VanSI is a vanS variant found in the vanI gene cluster; it is a histidine kinase.
ARO:3003726.label: vanSI

ARO:3003727.definition: VanKI is a peptidoglycan bridge formation protein also known as FemAB that is part of the VanI glycopeptide resistance gene cluster.
ARO:3003727.label: vanKI

ARO:3003724.definition: VanWI is a vanW variant found in the vanI gene cluster
ARO:3003724.label: vanWI

ARO:3003725.definition: VanXI is a VanX variant found in the VanI glycopeptide resistance gene cluster. It is a D-Ala-D-Ala dipeptidase.
ARO:3003725.label: vanXI

ARO:3003722.definition: This inducible cluster confers high resistance to vancomycin and intermediate resistance to teicoplanin. It achieves this through peptidoglycan restructuring with its VanA ligase homologue, VanI, causing the precursurs to end in D-Ala-D-Lac. The cluster uniquely contains murF, the final enzyme in the synthesis of UDP-N-acetylmuramoyl-pentapeptide, the precursor of murein. The VanI gene cluster has been found in chromosomal DNA. Gene orientation: vanSRIWK-murFvanX
ARO:3003722.label: glycopeptide resistance gene cluster VanI

ARO:3003723.definition: VanI is a D-Ala-D-Lac ligase that reduces vancomycin binding affinity, helping to confer vancomycin resistance as part of the VanI resistance gene cluster in Desulfitobacterium spp. and Desulfosporosinus spp.
ARO:3003723.label: vanI

ARO:3003720.definition: SPG-1 is a subclass B3 metallo-beta lactamase isolated from Sphingomonas sp.
ARO:3003720.label: SPG-1

ARO:3003396.definition: Point mutations in the 3' minor domain of helix 44, in the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to gentamicin C
ARO:3003396.label: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to gentamicin C

ARO:3004187.definition: Point mutations in the 23S rRNA subunit may confer resistance to lincosamide antibiotics by reducing antibiotic binding-site affinity.
ARO:3004187.label: 23S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to lincosamide antibiotics

ARO:3002533.definition: AAC(3)-IIa is a plasmid-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in K. pneumoniae, E. cloacae, Actinobacillus pleuropneumoniae, S. typhimurium, Citrobacter freundii, and P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3002533.label: AAC(3)-IIa

ARO:3003054.definition: SmeDEF is a multidrug resistance efflux pump that confers resistance to quinolones, tetracyclines, macrolides, chloramphenicol, and novobiocin in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ARO:3003054.label: SmeDEF

ARO:3003055.definition: smeD is the membrane fusion protein of the smeDEF multidrug efflux complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ARO:3003055.label: smeD

ARO:3003056.definition: smeE is the RND protein of the efflux complex smeDEF in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ARO:3003056.label: smeE

ARO:3003057.definition: smeF is an outer membrane multidrug efflux protein of the smeDEF complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ARO:3003057.label: smeF

ARO:3003050.definition: SmeABC is a multidrug resistance efflux pump that confers resistance to aminoglycosides, beta-lactams, and fluoroquinolones in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ARO:3003050.label: SmeABC

ARO:3003051.definition: smeA is the membrane fusion protein of the smeABC multidrug efflux complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ARO:3003051.label: smeA

ARO:3003052.definition: smeB is the inner membrane multidrug exporter of the efflux complex smeABC in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ARO:3003052.label: smeB

ARO:3003053.definition: smeC is an outer membrane multidrug efflux protein of the smeABC complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ARO:3003053.label: smeC

ARO:3004409.definition: Specific vendor of automated system of analysis for determining antimicrobial susceptibility that was acquired by Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. Thermo Fisher Scienfiic Inc. is headquartered in Massachusetts, USA.  Trek is the developer of the Sensitire automated testing platform.
ARO:3004409.label: Trek

ARO:3002288.definition: VIM-18 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002288.label: VIM-18

ARO:3001940.definition: CTX-M-79 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001940.label: CTX-M-79

ARO:3001941.definition: CTX-M-80 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3001941.label: CTX-M-80

ARO:3001942.definition: CTX-M-81 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3001942.label: CTX-M-81

ARO:3001943.definition: CTX-M-82 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001943.label: CTX-M-82

ARO:3001944.definition: CTX-M-83 is a beta-lactamase found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3001944.label: CTX-M-83

ARO:3001945.definition: CTX-M-84 is a beta-lactamase found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3001945.label: CTX-M-84

ARO:3001946.definition: CTX-M-86 is a beta-lactamase found in Salmonella enterica
ARO:3001946.label: CTX-M-86

ARO:3001947.definition: CTX-M-87 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001947.label: CTX-M-87

ARO:3001948.definition: CTX-M-88 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001948.label: CTX-M-88

ARO:3001949.definition: CTX-M-89 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3001949.label: CTX-M-89

ARO:3000413.definition: Sul3 is a sulfonamide resistant dihydropteroate synthase similar to Sul1 and Sul2. Its resistance gene was found encoded in E. coli plasmid DNA of sulfonamide resistant isolates.
ARO:3000413.label: sul3

ARO:3000412.definition: Sul2 is a sulfonamide resistant dihydropteroate synthase of Gram-negative bacteria, usually found on small plasmids.
ARO:3000412.label: sul2

ARO:3004433.definition: A microbe whose susceptibility to antibiotics differs from that of a reference susceptible microbe, meaning that the microbe is resistant to the particular antibiotic.
ARO:3004433.label: non wild-type

ARO:3003374.definition: AcrR is a repressor of the AcrAB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrR mutations result in high level antibiotic resistance.
ARO:3003374.label: Enterobacter aerogenes acrR with mutation conferring multidrug antibiotic resistance

ARO:3003805.definition: gshF is a bifunctional glutamate-cysteine ligase/ glutathione synthetase that when mutated, confers daptomycin resistance.
ARO:3003805.label: Enterococcus faecalis gshF with mutation conferring daptomycin resistance

ARO:3003376.definition: Point mutations in the 3' major domain of the rrsB 16S rRNA gene of Escherichia coli can confer resistance to spectinomycin
ARO:3003376.label: Escherichia coli 16S rRNA (rrsB) mutation conferring resistance to spectinomycin

ARO:3003394.definition: pncA is a pyrazinamidase/nicotinamidase. It catalyzes the activation of pyrazinamide. Some mutation within pncA are associated with loss of enzyme activity, resulting in pyrazinamide resistance.
ARO:3003394.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis pncA mutations conferring resistance to pyrazinamide

ARO:3003612.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003612.label: OXA-456

ARO:3003613.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003613.label: OXA-457

ARO:3003610.label: OXA-454

ARO:3003611.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003611.label: OXA-455

ARO:3003616.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003616.label: OXA-460

ARO:3003617.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003617.label: OXA-461

ARO:3003614.label: OXA-458

ARO:3003615.label: OXA-459
