ARO:3003618.label: OXA-462

ARO:3003619.definition: Assigned by Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no accessions or other information available
ARO:3003619.label: OXA-463

ARO:3003809.definition: An outer member protein (OMP) found in Acinetobacter baumannii involved in the uptake of imipenem and basic amino acids. This porin is homologous to Pseudomonas aeruginosa OprD, which performs an identical function.
ARO:3003809.label: Acinetobacter baumannii OprD conferring resistance to imipenem

ARO:3003808.definition: carO is a transmembrane beta-barrel involved in the influx of carbapenem antibiotics in Acinetobacter baumannii. Disruption of the carO gene by distinct insertion elements results in a loss of carO expression causing resistance to carbapenem antibiotics. Homologs of carO have been identified in genera Acinetobacter, Moraxella and Psychrobacter.
ARO:3003808.label: carO

ARO:3002928.definition: vanRM is a vanR variant found in the vanM gene cluster
ARO:3002928.label: vanRM

ARO:3004448.definition: A class A beta-lactamase with penicillinase activity described in Atlantibacter (Escherichia) hermannii
ARO:3004448.label: HERA-1

ARO:3003573.definition: The LpxA gene is widely known to be involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane
ARO:3003573.label: LpxA

ARO:3000569.definition: Tet41 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Serratia, a Gram-negative bacterium.  It is related to Acinetobacter Tet(39).
ARO:3000569.label: tet(41)

ARO:3000568.definition: Subclass B1 possess a binuclear active site.  Within this active site can be either one or two Zn(II) ions.  This subclass is able to hydrolyze penicillins, cephalosporins and carbapenems.  This is the most clinically relevant subclass of MBLs.
ARO:3000568.label: subclass B1 (metallo-) beta-lactamase

ARO:3003572.definition: Magainin 2 is an antimicrobial peptides produced from Xenopus laevis skin. It induce osmotic lysis of bacteria
ARO:3003572.label: magainin 2

ARO:3000565.definition: Tet38 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in the Gram-positive Staphylococcus aureus. It is regulated by mgrA, which also regulates NorB.
ARO:3000565.label: tet(38)

ARO:3000567.definition: Tet40 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in the Gram-positive Clostridium. It is similar to tetA(P).
ARO:3000567.label: tet(40)

ARO:3000566.definition: Tet39 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Gram-negative bacteria, including Brevundimonas, Stenotrophomonas, Enterobacter, Alcaligenes, Acinetobacter, and Providencia.
ARO:3000566.label: tet(39)

ARO:3000561.definition: Tet30 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in agrobacterium, a Gram-negative bacterium.
ARO:3000561.label: tet(30)

ARO:3000560.definition: Erm proteins are part of the RNA methyltransferase family and methylate A2058 (E. coli nomenclature) of the 23S ribosomal RNA conferring degrees of resistance to Macrolides, Lincosamides and Streptogramin b. This is called the MLSb phenotype.
ARO:3000560.label: Erm 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferase

ARO:3002922.definition: vanRC is a vanR variant found in the vanC gene cluster
ARO:3002922.label: vanRC

ARO:3003570.definition: magainin H is is a synthetic analog of magainin 1, an antimicrobial peptide. It differs from magainin B with the substitution of D-alanine instead of L-alanine.
ARO:3003570.label: magainin H

ARO:3003577.definition: PmrE is required for the synthesis and transfer of 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (Ara4N) to Lipid A, which allows gram-negative bacteria to resist the antimicrobial activity of cationic antimicrobial peptides and antibiotics such as polymyxin
ARO:3003577.label: PmrE

ARO:3003576.definition: PmrC mediates the modification of Lipid A by the addition of 4-amino-4-deoxy-L-arabinose (L-Ara4N) and phosphoethanolamine, resulting in a less negative cell membrane and decreased binding of polymyxin B.
ARO:3003576.label: PmrC

ARO:3002567.definition: AAC(6')-Iw is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Acinetobacter sp.
ARO:3002567.label: AAC(6')-Iw

ARO:3003575.definition: The LpxD gene is widely known to be involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane
ARO:3003575.label: LpxD

ARO:3002534.definition: AAC(3)-IIb is an aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in E. coli, A. faecalis and S. marcescens
ARO:3002534.label: AAC(3)-IIb

ARO:3003574.definition: The LpxC gene is widely known to be involved in the biosynthesis of lipid A in Gram-negative bacteria and mutations to this gene may cause resistance to antimicrobial peptides that target the outer membrane
ARO:3003574.label: LpxC

ARO:3003309.definition: Point mutation in Ureaplasma urealyticum parC resulting in fluoroquinolone resistance
ARO:3003309.label: Ureaplasma urealyticum parC conferring resistance to fluoroquinolone

ARO:3003880.definition: ADC-74 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii.
ARO:3003880.label: ADC-74

ARO:3004248.definition: UhpT encodes a transporter that can import fosfomycin-type drugs into bacterial cells. Mutations to UhpT confer resistance.
ARO:3004248.label: UhpT

ARO:3004249.definition: UhpA acts as a positive regulator of UhpT, which is a transporter to bring fosfomycin drugs into bacterial cells. Mutations in UhpA that negatively impact the expression of UhpT can confer resistance.
ARO:3004249.label: UhpA

ARO:3004240.definition: NPS beta-lactamases are class D beta-lactamases that have partial hydrolyzing abilities against penicillins and cephalosporin.
ARO:3004240.label: NPS beta-lactamase

ARO:3004241.definition: Beta-lactamases that are part of the LRA gene family and are classified as Class D beta-lactamases.
ARO:3004241.label: class D LRA beta-lactamase

ARO:3004242.definition: Members of the MSI-OXA family are class D beta-lactamases that encompass hybrids of MSI-1 and putative OXA homologues.
ARO:3004242.label: MSI-OXA family beta-lactamase

ARO:3004243.definition: RbpA is a family of bacterial RNA polymerase-binding proteins, which acts as a transcription factor and binds to the sigma subunit of RNA polymerase.
ARO:3004243.label: RbpA bacterial RNA polymerase-binding protein

ARO:3004244.definition: The DnaA family of replication initiation proteins interact with RNA polymerase to confer resistance against rifampicin anitibiotics.
ARO:3004244.label: DnaA chromosomal replication initiation protein

ARO:3004245.definition: The fosC family of phosphotransferases phosphorylate fosfomycin to confer resistance and have been found in various bacterial isolates.
ARO:3004245.label: fosC phosphotransferase family

ARO:3004246.definition: Two members of the Fom family have been identified, FomA and FomB. FomB must interact with FomA confer resistance to fosfomycin, however FomA is capable of conferring resistance alone.
ARO:3004246.label: Fom phosphotransferase family

ARO:3004247.definition: Fosfomycin is transported bacterial cells through transporters, one of them being glycerol-3-phosphate, which is encoded by the GlpT gene. Mutations in the GlpT gene can confer resistance to fosfomycin.
ARO:3004247.label: GlpT

ARO:3001845.definition: ACT-25 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001845.label: ACT-25

ARO:3000774.definition: AdeA is the membrane fusion protein of the multidrug efflux complex AdeABC.
ARO:3000774.label: adeA

ARO:3003250.definition: bcrC is an undecaprenyl pyrophosphate phosphatase that has a role in bacitracin resistance if it is overexpressed. It is isolated from Bacillus subtilis.
ARO:3003250.label: bcrC

ARO:3003251.definition: Undecaprenyl pyrophosphate is a precursor to a cell wall polymer carrier. It's activation requires a phosphatase.
ARO:3003251.label: undecaprenyl pyrophosphate

ARO:3000158.definition: Azithromycin is a 15-membered macrolide and falls under the subclass of azalide. Like other macrolides, azithromycin binds bacterial ribosomes to inhibit protein synthesis. The nitrogen substitution at the C-9a position prevents its degradation.
ARO:3000158.label: azithromycin

ARO:3000159.definition: Efflux proteins that pump antibiotic out of a cell to confer resistance.
ARO:3000159.label: efflux pump complex or subunit conferring antibiotic resistance

ARO:3004288.definition: varG is an Ambler class B metallo-beta-lactamase found on the antibiotic resistance var regulon in Vibrio cholerae, along with an antibiotic efflux pump varABCDEF. These genes are organized as a regulon under the control of VarR transcriptional activator. VarG was shown to have beta-lactamase activity against penicillins, carbapenems and cephalosporins in-vitro.
ARO:3004288.label: subclass B1 Vibrio cholerae varG beta-lactamase

ARO:3000154.definition: Phosphorylation of hygromycin on the hydroxyl group at position 7''
ARO:3000154.label: APH(7'')

ARO:3000155.definition: Phosphorylation of hygromycin on the hydroxyl group at position 4
ARO:3000155.label: APH(4)

ARO:3000156.definition: Spiramycin is a 16-membered macrolide and is natural product produced by Streptomyces ambofaciens. It binds to the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes and inhibits peptidyl transfer activity to disrupt protein synthesis.
ARO:3000156.label: spiramycin

ARO:3000157.definition: Rifamycin antibiotics are a group of broad-spectrum ansamycin antibiotics that inhibit bacterial RNA polymerase by binding to a highly conserved region, blocking the oligonucleotide exit tunnel, and preventing the extension of nascent mRNAs.
ARO:3000157.label: rifamycin antibiotic

ARO:3000150.definition: Coumermycin A1 is an antibiotic produced by Streptomyces rishiriensis, and binds DNA gyrase subunit B to inhibit ATP-dependent DNA supercoiling.
ARO:3000150.label: coumermycin A1

ARO:3000151.definition: Phosphorylation of streptomycin on the hydroxyl group at position 6
ARO:3000151.label: APH(6)

ARO:3000152.definition: Minocycline is second generation semi-synthetic derivative of the tetracycline group of antibiotics. It inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 30S subunit of the bacterial ribosome and preventing the aminotransferase-tRNA from associating with the ribosome.
ARO:3000152.label: minocycline

ARO:3000153.definition: Phosphorylation of spectinomycin on the hydroxyl group at position 9
ARO:3000153.label: APH(9)

ARO:3000775.definition: AdeB is the multidrug transporter of the adeABC efflux system.
ARO:3000775.label: adeB

ARO:3000394.definition: Biosynthesis of teicoplanin by Actinoplanes teichomyceticus
ARO:3000394.label: Actinoplanes teichomyceticus teicoplanin gene cluster

ARO:3000392.definition: Erm(37) is found in Mycobacterium species and confers the MLSb phenotype. In addition to methylation of A2058 this Erm methylates adjacent adenosines (A2057 and A2059) as well.
ARO:3000392.label: Erm(37)

ARO:3000189.definition: Oritavancin is a semi-synthetic derivative of chloroeremomycin, a vancomycin-like glycopeptide. Oritavancin inhibits both transglycosylation and transpeptidation, by binding both the D-Ala-D-Ala and pentaglycine bridge segments of peptidoglycan to inhibit cell wall formation.
ARO:3000189.label: oritavancin

ARO:3000390.definition: Enzyme responsible for the ADP-ribosylative inactivation of rifampin at the 23-OH position using NAD+.
ARO:3000390.label: rifampin ADP-ribosyltransferase (Arr)

ARO:3000391.definition: NorA is a multidrug efflux pump in Staphylococcus aureus that confers resistance to fluoroquinolones and other structurally unrelated antibiotics like acriflavine. It shares 30% similarity with NorA, and is a structural homolog of Bmr of Bacillus subtilis. It is regulated by arlRS and mgrA, the latter also known as NorR.
ARO:3000391.label: norA

ARO:3002303.definition: VIM-33 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002303.label: VIM-33

ARO:3000188.definition: Trimethoprim is a synthetic 5-(3,4,5- trimethoxybenzyl) pyrimidine inhibitor of dihydrofolate reductase, inhibiting synthesis of tetrahydrofolic acid. Tetrahydrofolic acid is an essential precursor in the de novo synthesis of the DNA nucleotide thymidine. Trimethoprim is a bacteriostatic antibiotic mainly used in the prophylaxis and treatment of urinary tract infections in combination with sulfamethoxazole, a sulfonamide antibiotic.
ARO:3000188.label: trimethoprim

ARO:3002302.definition: VIM-32 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of VIM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002302.label: VIM-32

ARO:3004296.definition: Bulgecin A is a lytic transglycosylase inhibitor and antibiotic adjuvant produced from Pseudomonas mesoacidophila. In the presence of some beta-lactam antibiotics, including ampicillin and meropenem, Bulgecin A has been shown to restore susceptibility to carbapenems in carbapenem-resistant pathogens.
ARO:3004296.label: bulgecin A

ARO:3002301.definition: VIM-31 is a beta-lactamase found in Enterobacter cloacae
ARO:3002301.label: VIM-31

ARO:3002750.definition: QnrB35 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Citrobacter freundii
ARO:3002750.label: QnrB35

ARO:3002300.definition: VIM-30 is a beta-lactamase found in the Enterobacteriaceae family
ARO:3002300.label: VIM-30

ARO:3004313.definition: Any strain of E. coli that has tested resistant to one of the following carbapenem antibiotics: imipenem, meropenem, doripenem, ertapenem.
ARO:3004313.label: carbapenem-resistant Escherichia coli

ARO:3002307.definition: VIM-37 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002307.label: VIM-37

ARO:3002306.definition: VIM-36 is a beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
ARO:3002306.label: VIM-36

ARO:3000183.definition: TetZ is a tetracycline efflux protein found in Gram-positive bacteria (Corynebacterium and Lactobacillus). It is associated with plasmid DNA.
ARO:3000183.label: tet(Z)

ARO:3002305.definition: VIM-35 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of VIM beta-lactamases.
ARO:3002305.label: VIM-35

ARO:3000182.definition: TetY is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Gram-negative bacteria (Aeromonas and Escherichia). It is associated with plasmid DNA.
ARO:3000182.label: tet(Y)

ARO:3002304.definition: VIM-34 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002304.label: VIM-34

ARO:3000548.definition: Coumermycin A1 is produced by a biosynthetic cluster in Streptomyces rishiriensis.
ARO:3000548.label: Streptomyces rishiriensis strain DSM 40489 coumermycin A1 biosynthetic gene cluster

ARO:3004099.definition: LpeA is a subunit of the LpeAB efflux pump in Legionella pneumophila, which is homologous to AcrA in E. coli.
ARO:3004099.label: LpeA

ARO:3004098.definition: LpeAB are components of an efflux pump, which is a macrolide resistance determinant in L. pneumophila Paris strain. Mutations observed in the upstream sequence of lpeAB operon in resistant lineages led to an overexpression of this efflux pump. Sub-inhibitory concentrations of macrolides themselves participated in upregulating this efflux and could constitute a first step in the acquisition of a high macrolide resistance level. As Lpp2879–Lpp2880 is homologous to Escherichia coli AcrAB, lpp2879–lpp2880 was renamed to lpeAB.
ARO:3004098.label: LpeAB

ARO:3000777.definition: AdeF is the membrane fusion protein of the multidrug efflux complex AdeFGH.
ARO:3000777.label: adeF

ARO:3002839.definition: lnuF is an integron-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002839.label: lnuF

ARO:3002838.definition: lnuD is a plasmid-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Streptococcus uberis
ARO:3002838.label: lnuD

ARO:3002835.definition: lnuA is a plasmid-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Staphylococcus chromogenes
ARO:3002835.label: lnuA

ARO:3004090.definition: ANT(3'')-IIb is a aminoglycoside nucleotidyltransferase identified in Acinetobacter spp. via horizontal gene transfer mechanisms.
ARO:3004090.label: ANT(3'')-IIb

ARO:3004093.definition: NDM-17 is a metallo-beta-lactamase isolated from Escherichia coli with enhanced carbapenemase activity compared to NDM-1.
ARO:3004093.label: NDM-17

ARO:3002836.definition: lnuB is a plasmid-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Streptococcus lutetiensis
ARO:3002836.label: lnuB

ARO:3002831.definition: vgaC is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
ARO:3002831.label: vgaC

ARO:3002830.definition: vgaALC is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
ARO:3002830.label: vgaALC

ARO:3002833.definition: vgaE is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with transposon DNA.
ARO:3002833.label: vgaE

ARO:3004096.definition: Mutations to the CdsA phosphatidate cytidylyltransferase conferring resistance to daptomycin.
ARO:3004096.label: daptomycin resistant CdsA

ARO:3000083.definition: MOX beta-lactamases are plasmid-mediated AmpC-type beta-lactamases.
ARO:3000083.label: MOX beta-lactamase

ARO:3000080.definition: Aminonucleoside antibiotics are nucleoside antibiotics that contain an amino group. This amino group is often acylated, e.g. puromycin.

ARO:3000081.definition: Glycopeptide antibiotics are natural products produced non-ribosomally by Actinomycetales bacteria. With the exception of bleomycins, they act by binding the terminal D-Ala-D-Ala in peptidoglycan precursors of the growing bacterial cell wall and are generally active against Gram-positive bacteria.  This inhibits transglycosylation leading to cell death due to osmotic stress.
ARO:3000081.label: glycopeptide antibiotic

ARO:3003846.definition: ADC beta-lactamases, also known as AmpC beta-lactamases, are cephalosporinases with extended-spectrum resistance to cephalosporins but not to carbapenems. ADC beta-lactamases are found in Acinetobacter sp. and Oligella urethralis.
ARO:3003846.label: ADC beta-lactamase

ARO:3003844.definition: mfd dissociates transcription elongation complexes blocked at nonpairing lesions and mediates recruitment of DNA repair proteins. The Mfd (mutation frequency decline) protein, also known as transcription-repair coupling factor, is responsible for ATP-dependent removal of stalled RNA polymerase from DNA lesions by inducing forward movement of the RNA polymerase and subsequent recruitment of nucleotide excision repair machinery to the sites of the lesions.
ARO:3003844.label: mfd

ARO:3003843.definition: leuO, a LysR family transcription factor, exists in a wide variety of bacteria of the family Enterobacteriaceae and is involved in the regulation of as yet unidentified genes affecting the stress response and pathogenesis expression. LeuO is also an activator of the MdtNOP efflux pump.
ARO:3003843.label: leuO

ARO:3003842.definition: MUS-2 is a chromosome-encoded beta-lactamase from Myroides odoratimimus.
ARO:3003842.label: MUS-2

ARO:3003841.definition: kdpE is a transcriptional activator that is part of the two-component system KdpD/KdpE that is studied for its regulatory role in potassium transport and has been identified as an adaptive regulator involved in the virulence and intracellular survival of pathogenic bacteria. kdpE regulates a range of virulence loci through direct promoter binding.
ARO:3003841.label: kdpE

ARO:3003840.definition: Positive regulator of gene expression in the cysteine regulon. cysB mutants confer resistance to novobiocin, an aminocoumarin antibiotic, in Escherichia coli.
ARO:3003840.label: aminocoumarin resistant cysB

ARO:3003539.definition: Point mutations in the highly conserved helix 44 of the 16S rrsA rRNA gene of Mycobacterium smegmatis can confer resistance to hygromycin B. Resistance against hygromycin B is the result of conformational alterations that distorts a strong hydrogen bond leading to a change in the local geometry of the hygromycin B binding site.
ARO:3003539.label: Mycobacterium smegmatis 16S rRNA (rrsA) mutation conferring resistance to hygromycin B

ARO:3003280.label: antibiotic sensitive mprF

ARO:3003443.definition: tlyA encodes for hemolysin. It Catalyzes the 2'-O-methylation at nucleotides C1409 in 16S rRNA and C1920 in 23S rRNA. Mutation that arise within this gene reduces the binding affinity of aminoglycosides to rRNA
ARO:3003443.label: Antibiotic resistant tlyA

ARO:3003441.definition: CfrA is a chloramphenicol-florfenicol resistance gene and methyltransferase enzyme. Methylation of position 8 of A2503 in 23S rRNA confers resistance to chloramphenicol antibiotics. Additional Oxazolidinone resistance mediated by the cfr gene in a human isolated was first reported from Colombia in linezolid- and methicillin-resistant staphylocci. Described by Arias et al. 2008.
ARO:3003441.label: cfrA

ARO:3003440.definition: A foreign PBP2 acquired by lateral gene transfer that able to perform peptidoglycan synthesis in the presence of beta-lactams.

ARO:3003999.definition: Cefamandole is a second-generation cephalosporin-class beta-lactam antibiotic.
ARO:3003999.label: cefamandole

ARO:3003446.definition: iniA, an isoniazid-induced protein, is part of the iniBAC operon that participates in the development of tolerance to both isoniazid and ethambutol. May function through a MDR-pump like mechanism, although it does not appear to directly transport isoniazid from the cell
ARO:3003446.label: Antibiotic resistant iniA

ARO:3003445.definition: Specific mutations that arise in Mycobacterium tuberculosis tlyA resulting in aminoglycosides resistance
ARO:3003445.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis tlyA mutations conferring resistance to aminoglycosides

ARO:3003995.definition: Amino acid substitutions in Clostridium difficile gyrase subunit A which when present confer functional resistance to fluoroquinolone antibiotics.
ARO:3003995.label: Clostridium difficile gyrA conferring resistance to fluoroquinolones

ARO:3003994.definition: cpaA is a capreomycin acetyltransferase protein found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, an isolated strain of Paenibacillus in Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to capreomycin, an aminoglycoside antibiotic. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003994.label: cpaA

ARO:3003449.definition: iniC, an isoniazid-induced protein, is part of the iniBAC operon that participates in the development of tolerance to both isoniazid and ethambutol. May function through a MDR-pump like mechanism, although it does not appear to directly transport isoniazid from the cell
ARO:3003449.label: Antibiotic resistant iniC

ARO:3003448.definition: Specific mutations in Mycobacterium tuberculosis iniA resulting in resistance to ethambutol
ARO:3003448.label: Mycobacterium tuberculosis iniA mutant conferring resistance to Ethambutol

ARO:3003991.definition: mphI is a macrolide phosphotransferase protein found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to macrolide antibiotics. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003991.label: mphI

ARO:3003990.definition: VgbC is a streptogramin B-type lyase found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to streptogramin B-type antibiotics by linearization of the lactone ring on an ester bond, resulting in antibiotic inactivation. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003990.label: vgbC

ARO:3003993.definition: Capreomycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic, capable of treating a large number of infections but in particular used for killing bacteria causing tuberculosis.
ARO:3003993.label: capreomycin

ARO:3003992.definition: rphB is a rifampin phosphotransferase protein found in Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain of Paenibacillus isolated from Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA. Confers resistance to rifamycin antibiotics, specifically rifampin, through rifampin inactivation. Described by Pawlowski et al. 2016.
ARO:3003992.label: rphB

ARO:3000149.definition: An enzyme that confers resistance to fosfomycin in Serratia marcescens by breaking the epoxide ring of the molecule. It depends on the cofactors Manganese (II) and Potassium and uses Glutathione (GSH) as the nucleophilic molecule. In Pseudomonas aeruginosa, FosA catalyzes the conjugation of glutathione to carbon-1 of fosfomycin, rendering it ineffective as an antibacterial drug.
ARO:3000149.label: FosA

ARO:3002409.definition: OXY-3-1 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
ARO:3002409.label: OXY-3-1

ARO:3003263.definition: Sensitive form of 16s susceptable to antibiotics
ARO:3003263.label: Antibiotic sensitive Mycobacterium abscessus 16S rRNA

ARO:3001572.definition: OXA-386 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of OXA beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001572.label: OXA-386

ARO:3003261.definition: Beta-subunit of DNA gyrase sensitive to inhibition by fluoroquinolones
ARO:3003261.label: fluoroquinolone sensitive gyrB

ARO:3004038.definition: EmrE is a small multidrug transporter that functions as a homodimer and that couples the efflux of small polyaromatic cations from the cell with the import of protons down an electrochemical gradient. Confers resistance to tetraphenylphosphonium, methyl viologen, gentamicin, kanamycin, and neomycin.
ARO:3004038.label: Pseudomonas aeruginosa emrE

ARO:3003265.definition: Sensitive form of 16s susceptable to antibiotics
ARO:3003265.label: Amikacin sensitive Mycobacterium abscessus 16S rRNA mutation

ARO:3003264.definition: Sensitive form of 16s susceptable to antibiotics
ARO:3003264.label: Aminoglycosides sensitive Mycobacterium abscessus 16S rRNA

ARO:3001975.definition: CTX-M-115 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter baumannii
ARO:3001975.label: CTX-M-115

ARO:3001974.definition: CTX-M-114 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001974.label: CTX-M-114

ARO:3001977.definition: CTX-M-117 is a beta-lactamase found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3001977.label: CTX-M-117

ARO:3001976.definition: CTX-M-116 is a beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis
ARO:3001976.label: CTX-M-116

ARO:3001971.definition: CTX-M-111 is a beta-lactamase found in Shigella spp.
ARO:3001971.label: CTX-M-111

ARO:3001970.definition: CTX-M-110 is a beta-lactamase found in Shigella spp.
ARO:3001970.label: CTX-M-110

ARO:3001973.definition: CTX-M-113 is a beta-lactamase found in Shigella spp.
ARO:3001973.label: CTX-M-113

ARO:3001972.definition: CTX-M-112 is a beta-lactamase found in Shigella spp.
ARO:3001972.label: CTX-M-112

ARO:3004417.definition: Concentration at which bacterial cells in suspension, calculated with respect to final volume (colony forming units/milliliter (cfu/mL)). The standard for broth dilution is 5 x 105cfu/mL. The standard for agar dilution is 104cfu/mL.
ARO:3004417.label: inoculum

ARO:3001979.definition: CTX-M-120 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001979.label: CTX-M-120

ARO:3001978.definition: CTX-M-119 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of CTX-M beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001978.label: CTX-M-119

ARO:3000983.definition: TEM-121 is an inhibitor-resistant, extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli and Enterobacter aerogenes.
ARO:3000983.label: TEM-121

ARO:3002898.definition: SAT-3 is a plasmid-mediated streptothricin acetyltransferase and streptothricin resistance determinant. Originally described from an E. coli plasmid gene by Tietze and Brevet, 1995.
ARO:3002898.label: SAT-3

ARO:3000982.definition: TEM-120 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca.
ARO:3000982.label: TEM-120

ARO:3000981.definition: TEM-118 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase that has been found in clinical isolates.
ARO:3000981.label: TEM-118

ARO:3003195.definition: The GIM beta-lactamases are isolated from Pseudomonas aeruginosa. They are located in a distinct integron structure. They confers high broad spectrum resistant, including all ß-lactams, aminoglycosides and quinolones.
ARO:3003195.label: GIM beta-lactamase

ARO:3003666.definition: Point mutations in the 16S rRNA of bacteria can confer resistance to aminoglycosides.
ARO:3003666.label: 16s rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to aminoglycoside antibiotics

ARO:3003665.definition: NmcR is a homolog of the LysR regulator found in Enterobacter cloacae that contribute to the regulation of NmcA beta-lactamase
ARO:3003665.label: NmcR

ARO:3003196.definition: tet45 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Bhargavaea cecembensis strain previously isolated from a poultry-litter-impacted soil.
ARO:3003196.label: tet(45)

ARO:3003663.definition: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available
ARO:3003663.label: NDM-15

ARO:3003662.definition: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available
ARO:3003662.label: VIM-46

ARO:3003661.definition: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available
ARO:3003661.label: VIM-45

ARO:3003660.definition: From Lahey's list of beta-lactamases, no additional information available
ARO:3003660.label: VIM-44

ARO:3000987.definition: TEM-125 is a CMT-type, inhibitor-resistant, extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
ARO:3000987.label: TEM-125

ARO:3003199.definition: AAC(6')-Iak is a 6'-N-aminoglycoside acetyltransferase-encoding gene isolated from a multidrug-resistant clinical isolate of Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ARO:3003199.label: AAC(6')-Iak

ARO:3004295.definition: A ribosomally synthesized cyclic peptide antibiotic. Lassomycin has been shown to be effective against drug-resistant mycobacteria but shows little activity against other bacteria. Lassomycin targets and binds to a region of the ClpC1 ATPase complex and uncouples ATPase from proteolytic activity, an essential function for mycobacterial viability, causing cell death.
ARO:3004295.label: lassomycin

ARO:3003669.definition: Point mutations in the bacterial 16S rRNA region shown clinically to confer resistance to tetracycline and tetracycline derivatives (polyketide antibiotics).
ARO:3003669.label: 16S rRNA with mutation conferring resistance to tetracycline derivatives

ARO:3000986.definition: TEM-124 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Morganella morganii.
ARO:3000986.label: TEM-124

ARO:3004294.definition: A chromosome-encoded  class C cephalosporinase and penicillinase from Buttiauxella spp. shown clinically to confer resistance to beta-lactam antibiotics. Described by Fihman et al. 2002.
ARO:3004294.label: BUT-1

ARO:3000985.definition: TEM-123 is an extended-spectrum beta-lactamase found in Proteus mirabilis.
ARO:3000985.label: TEM-123

ARO:3003021.definition: dfrB2 is an integron-encoded dihydrofolate reductase found in an uncultured bacterium from a wastewater treatment plant
ARO:3003021.label: dfrB2

ARO:3000984.definition: TEM-122 is an inhibitor-resistant beta-lactamase found in E. coli.
ARO:3000984.label: TEM-122

ARO:3002562.definition: AAC(6')-Is is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Acinetobacter genomosp. 15
ARO:3002562.label: AAC(6')-Is

ARO:3004291.definition: A periplasmic cephalosporinase described in Rhodobacter sphaeroides shown to contribute to resistance of beta-lactam antibiotics.
ARO:3004291.label: Rhodobacter sphaeroides ampC beta-lactamase

ARO:3004290.definition: A class C ampC beta-lactamase (cephalosporinase) enzyme described in Escherichia coli shown clinically to confer resistance to penicillin-like and cephalosporin-class antibiotics.
ARO:3004290.label: Escherichia coli ampC beta-lactamase

ARO:3000572.definition: Tet42 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in both Gram-negative (Pseudomonas) and Gram-positive (Microbacterium, Bacillus, Staphylococcus, Paenibacillus) bacteria.
ARO:3000572.label: tet(42)

ARO:3000573.definition: Tet(43) is a tetracycline resistance gene with unknown origins, isolated from metagenomic DNA.
ARO:3000573.label: tet(43)

ARO:3000570.definition: Metallo-beta-lactmases of subclass B2 contain only one Zn ion in their active site and selectively hydrolyze carbapenems.
ARO:3000570.label: subclass B2 (metallo-) beta-lactamase

ARO:3000571.definition: Metallo-beta-lactamases of subclass B3 are similar to B1 in that they have activity against penicillins, cephalosporins and carbapenems; however, the are only active with two Zn(II) ions in the active site.
ARO:3000571.label: subclass B3 (metallo-) beta-lactamase

ARO:3000576.definition: Enzymes that inactivate rifampin antibiotics by chemical modification.
ARO:3000576.label: rifampin inactivation enzyme

ARO:3000577.definition: Bacillus cereus beta-lactamases are zinc metallo-beta-lactamases that hydrolyze a large number of penicillins and cephalosporins.
ARO:3000577.label: Bc beta-lactamase

ARO:3000574.definition: VanR is a OmpR-family transcriptional activator in the VanSR regulatory system. When activated by VanS, it promotes cotranscription of VanA, VanH, and VanX.
ARO:3000574.label: vanR

ARO:3001831.definition: ACT-8 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001831.label: ACT-8

ARO:3000578.definition: This CcrA beta-lactamases is found in Bacteroides fragilis.
ARO:3000578.label: CcrA

ARO:3000579.definition: This BlaB specific to Chryseobacterium meningosepticum mediates resistance against many beta-lactam antibiotics, notably penams and carbapenems.
ARO:3000579.label: Chryseobacterium meningosepticum BlaB

ARO:3002561.definition: AAC(6')-Ir is a chromosomal-encoded aminoglycoside acetyltransferase in Acinetobacter genomosp. 14
ARO:3002561.label: AAC(6')-Ir

ARO:3002752.definition: QnrB37 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Citrobacter freundii
ARO:3002752.label: QnrB37

ARO:3003069.definition: vanXYG is a vanXY variant found in the vanG gene cluster
ARO:3003069.label: vanXYG

ARO:3003068.definition: smeRS is a two component regulatory system for smeABC where smeR is a response regulator, while smeS is a sensor kinase.
ARO:3003068.label: smeRS

ARO:3003061.definition: vph is a phosphotransferase that confers resistance to viomycin in Streptomyces vinaceus
ARO:3003061.label: vph

ARO:3003060.definition: tsnR is a 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferase that methylates adenosine-1067 to confer resistance to thiostrepton
ARO:3003060.label: tsnR

ARO:3003063.definition: ykkC is an SMR-type protein that is a subunit of the ykkCD efflux pump
ARO:3003063.label: ykkC

ARO:3003062.definition: ykkCD is a multidrug efflux pump with two SMR-type protein subunits that confers resistance to cationic drugs, chloramphenicol, streptomycin and tetracycline.
ARO:3003062.label: ykkCD

ARO:3003065.definition: Non-erm 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferases modify adenosine 1067 to confer resistance to peptide antibiotics
ARO:3003065.label: non-erm 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferase (A1067)

ARO:3003064.definition: ykkD is an SMR-type protein that is a subunit of the ykkCD efflux pump
ARO:3003064.label: ykkD

ARO:3003301.definition: Point mutation in Staphylococcus aureus resulting in aminocoumarin resistance
ARO:3003301.label: Staphylococcus aureus gyrB conferring resistance to aminocoumarin

ARO:3002159.definition: FOX-5 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
ARO:3002159.label: FOX-5

ARO:3000385.definition: Chloramphenicol is a bacteriostatic antimicrobial originally derived from the bacterium Streptomyces venezuelae. It was the first antibiotic to be manufactured synthetically on a large scale. It functions by inhibiting peptidyl transferase activity of the bacterial ribosome, binding to A2451 and A2452 residues in the 23S rRNA of the 50S ribosomal subunit and preventing peptide bond formation.
ARO:3000385.label: chloramphenicol

ARO:3002560.definition: AAC(6')-Iq is a aminoglycoside acetyltransferase encoded by plasmids and integrons in K. pneumoniae
ARO:3002560.label: AAC(6')-Iq

ARO:3000521.definition: An alternative isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase conferring resistance to mupirocin.
ARO:3000521.label: Staphylococcus mupA conferring resistance to mupirocin

ARO:3001839.definition: ACT-18 is a beta-lactamase. From the Lahey list of ACT beta-lactamases.
ARO:3001839.label: ACT-18

ARO:3002384.definition: BEL beta-lactamases are class A expanded-spectrum beta-lactamases that are inhibited by clavulanic acid. They are chromosomally encoded and hydrolyze most cephalosporins and aztreonam.
ARO:3002384.label: BEL beta-lactamase

ARO:3004279.definition: Members of the Sugar Porin family tend to facilitate the transport of maltodextrins and other sugars across the outer membrane of Gram-negative bacteria. These porins form a homotrimeric structure.
ARO:3004279.label: Sugar Porin (SP)

ARO:3004278.definition: The Opr family consists of porins in Pseudomonas species, and other Gram-negative bacteria, that exhibit a variety of substrate selectivities.
ARO:3004278.label: Outer Membrane Porin (Opr)

ARO:3004275.definition: Nucleotidylylation of streptomycin at the hydroxyl group at position 3''
ARO:3004275.label: ANT(3'')

ARO:3004274.definition: Methyltransferases that modify the 23S rRNA of the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes, conferring resistance to drugs that target 23S rRNA.
ARO:3004274.label: 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferase

ARO:3004277.definition: General bacterial porins are a family of porins found in the outer membrane of Gram-negative bacteria. They catalyze the energy-independent transport of small molecules across the outer membranes of bacteria. Most of the porins of these family are homotrimeric and have variable selectivity, ranging from being cation-selective, anion-selective or selective for different compounds. The most well characterized members of this family are the OmpF and OmpC porins of Escherichia coli. This family is also known as the classical porins.
ARO:3004277.label: General Bacterial Porin (GBP)

ARO:3004276.definition: Nucelotidylylation of streptomycin at the hydroxyl group at position 2''.
ARO:3004276.label: ANT(2'')

ARO:3004271.definition: Methyltransferases that methylate the G1405 position of 16S rRNA, which is part of an aminoglycoside binding site.
ARO:3004271.label: 16S rRNA methyltransferase (G1405)

ARO:3004270.definition: fabI is a enoyl-acyl carrier reductase used in lipid metabolism and fatty acid biosynthesis. The bacterial biocide Triclosan blocks the final reduction step in fatty acid elongation, inhibiting biosynthesis. Point mutations in fabI can confer resistance to Triclosan and Isoniazid.
ARO:3004270.label: antibiotic resistant fabI

ARO:3004273.definition: A family of lincosamide resistant 23S rRNA methyltransferases. The only member of the family discovered so far was isolated from Paenibacillus sp. LC231, a strain found in Lechuguilla Cave, NM, USA.
ARO:3004273.label: Llm 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferase

ARO:3004272.definition: Methyltransferases that methylate the A1408 position of 16S rRNA, which is part of an aminoglycoside binding site.
ARO:3004272.label: 16S rRNA methyltransferase (A1408)

ARO:3000160.definition: blaI acts as a repressor of transcription of the blaZ/blaR1/blaI operon.
ARO:3000160.label: blaI

ARO:3000165.definition: TetA is a tetracycline efflux pump found in many species of Gram-negative bacteria.
ARO:3000165.label: tet(A)

ARO:3000167.definition: Tet(C) is a tetracycline efflux pump found in many species of Gram-negative bacteria. It is typically found in plasmid DNA.
ARO:3000167.label: tet(C)

ARO:3000166.definition: Tet(B) is a tetracycline efflux protein expressed in many Gram-negative bacteria. It confers resistance to tetracycline, doxycycline, and minocycline, but not tigecycline.
ARO:3000166.label: tet(B)

ARO:3000169.definition: Rifampin is a semi-synthetic rifamycin, and inhibits RNA synthesis by binding to RNA polymerase. Rifampin is the mainstay agent for the treatment of tuberculosis, leprosy and complicated Gram-positive infections.
ARO:3000169.label: rifampin

ARO:3000168.definition: TetD is a tetracycline efflux pump found exclusively in Gram-negative bacteria.
ARO:3000168.label: tet(D)

ARO:3000363.definition: EreB is an erythromycin esterase-like protein that hydrolyses the drug's lactone ring.
ARO:3000363.label: EreB

ARO:3000361.definition: EreA is an erythromycin esterase that hydrolyses the drug's lactone ring.
ARO:3000361.label: EreA

ARO:3000369.definition: The mtr (multiple transferable resistance) system of Neisseria gonorrhoeae confers resistance to many hydrophobic agents including antibiotics, fatty-acids and detergents. MtrCDE is homologous to AcrAB-TolC, where MtrC is the membrane fusion protein, MtrD is the inner membrane transporter, and MtrE is the outer membrane channel protein.
ARO:3000369.label: MtrCDE

ARO:3000368.definition: VanC is a D-Ala-D-Ala ligase homolog that synthesizes D-Ala-D-Ser, an alternative substrate for peptidoglycan synthesis that reduces vancomycin binding affinity. It is specific to Enterococcus gallinarum and E. casseliflavus, providing intrinsic resistance.
ARO:3000368.label: vanC

ARO:3000767.definition: Avoparcin is a glycopeptide antibiotic that is an analog of vancomycin. It was formally used to treat animals, but has since been banned because of its selection for vancomycin-resistant enterococci.
ARO:3000767.label: avoparcin

ARO:3000766.definition: Topoisomerases are responsible for winding and relaxing supercoiled DNA. The subunits of gyrase (gyrA, gyrB) and topoisomerase IV (parC, parE, parY) are targeted by antibiotics.
ARO:3000766.label: antibiotic sensitive topoisomerase subunit

ARO:3002823.definition: ErmH is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Streptomyces thermotolerans
ARO:3002823.label: ErmH

ARO:3002826.definition: EreA2 is an integron-encoded erythromycin esterase that hydrolyses the drug's lactone ring. EreA2 is found in Providencia stuartii
ARO:3002826.label: EreA2

ARO:3002827.definition: tlrC is an efflux pump found in Streptomyces fradiae and confers resistance to mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. tlrC is found in the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is one mechanism by which S. fradiae protects itself from self-destruction when producing this macrolide.
ARO:3002827.label: tlrC

ARO:3002824.definition: ErmV is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Streptomyces viridochromogenes
ARO:3002824.label: ErmV

ARO:0000071.definition: Levofloxacin is a synthetic chemotherapeutic antibiotic of the fluoroquinolone drug class. Its main target is topoisomerase IV, inhibiting its function and disrupting DNA replication.
ARO:0000071.label: levofloxacin

ARO:3004086.definition: APH(3')-VIII is an aminoglycoside phosphoryltransferase that acts on the 3-OH target of aminoglycosides.
ARO:3004086.label: APH(3')-VIII

ARO:3004087.definition: APH(3')-IX is an aminoglycoside phosphoryltransferase that acts on the 3-OH target of aminoglycosides.
ARO:3004087.label: APH(3')-IX

ARO:3002828.definition: srmB is an efflux pump found in Streptomyces ambofaciens that confers resistance to spiramycin
ARO:3002828.label: srmB

ARO:3002829.definition: vgaA is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
ARO:3002829.label: vgaA

ARO:3004082.definition: AcrAD-TolC efflux pump system in E. coli from the resistance-nodulation-division family, was shown to participate in the efflux of aminoglycosides.
ARO:3004082.label: AcrAD-TolC

ARO:3004083.definition: AcrEF-TolC efflux pump system of E. coli confers resistance to fluoroquinolones (ciprofloxacin).
ARO:3004083.label: AcrEF-TolC confers resistance to ciprofloxacin

ARO:3004080.definition: MexAB-OprM efflux pump system with MexR mutations confers resistance to multiple antibiotics in P. aeruginosa.
ARO:3004080.label: MexAB-OprM with MexR mutations confers resistance to multiple antibiotics

ARO:3003851.definition: ADC-5 is a beta-lactamase found in Acinetobacter pittii.
ARO:3003851.label: ADC-5

ARO:3000765.definition: EmbB is an arabinosyltransferase that works as a heterodimer with EmbA. It is involved in the synthesis of arabinogalactan, a component of the mycobacterial cell wall.
ARO:3000765.label: antibiotic sensitive embB

ARO:3003093.definition: CEPH-A3 is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas veronii. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems and is active as a mono-zinc protein.
ARO:3003093.label: cphA3

ARO:3003094.definition: imiH is an Ambler Class B MBL; subclass B2 originally isolated from Aeromonas hydrophila. This enzyme has specific activity against carbapenems.
ARO:3003094.label: imiH

ARO:3003853.definition: ADC-7 is a beta-lactamase that is found in Acinetobacter baumannii.
ARO:3003853.label: ADC-7

ARO:0000075.definition: Nitrofurantoin is an antibiotic used to treat urinary tract infections. It inhibits enzyme synthesis by inhibiting essential enzymes involved in the citric acid cycle, as well as those involved in DNA, RNA, and protein synthesis. It is marketed under the following brand names: Furadantin, Macrobid, Macrodantin, Nitro Macro and Urantoin.
ARO:0000075.label: nitrofurantoin

ARO:3001294.definition: A gentamicin-group aminoglycoside isolated from Micromonospora.
ARO:3001294.label: verdamicin

ARO:3001295.definition: A semisynthetic genamicin-group aminoglycoside, derived from verdamicin.
ARO:3001295.label: vertilimicin

ARO:3001296.definition: An unusual aminoglycoside because the cyclitol ring is not amino substituted; it was discovered as a fermentation product of Streptomyces kasugaensis.
ARO:3001296.label: kasugamycin

ARO:3003096.definition: cfxA5 beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in Bacteroides distasonis
ARO:3003096.label: CfxA5

ARO:3002414.definition: OXY-6-2 is a beta-lactamase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
ARO:3002414.label: OXY-6-2

ARO:3003097.definition: cfxA6 beta-lactamase is a class A beta-lactamase found in an uncultured bacterium
ARO:3003097.label: CfxA6

ARO:3001298.definition: Non-erm 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferases modify guanosine 748 (E. coli numbering) to confer resistance to some macrolides and lincosamides
ARO:3001298.label: non-erm 23S ribosomal RNA methyltransferase (G748)

ARO:3001299.definition: TlrB is a methyltransferase found in Streptomyces fradiae and confers resistance to mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. Specifically, this enzyme adds a methyl group to guanosine 748 (E. coli numbering). TlrB is found in the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is one mechanism by which S. fradiae protects itself from self-destruction when producing this macrolide.
ARO:3001299.label: tlrB conferring tylosin resistance

ARO:3000764.definition: EmbA is an arabinosyltransferase that works as a heterodimer with EmbB. It is involved in the synthesis of arabinogalactan, a component of the mycobacterial cell wall.
ARO:3000764.label: antibiotic sensitive embA

ARO:3003151.definition: From the Lahey list of beta-lactamases.
ARO:3003151.label: CARB-22

ARO:3002586.definition: AAC(6')-32 is an aminoglycoside acetyltransferase encoded by plasmids and integrons in P. aeruginosa
ARO:3002586.label: AAC(6')-32

ARO:3002736.definition: QnrB21 is a plasmid-mediated quinolone resistance protein found in Escherichia coli
ARO:3002736.label: QnrB21

ARO:3002929.definition: vanRN is a vanR variant found in the vanN gene cluster
ARO:3002929.label: vanRN
